Polyphase Resampler Functions

The polyphase resampler works most efficiently when the ratio of input and output sample rates is a rational expression where the denominator and the numerator are both positive integers of 255 or less.

If the values for inputSampleRate and outputSampleRate do not satisfy this condition, the polyphase resampler converts the output sample rate to the nearest value that satisfies this condition and then performs its process. You can use nn::audio::CalculatePolyphaseResamplerActualOutputSampleRate() to calculate the actual output sample rate and check whether that actual value differs from the specified value (either before or after initialization of PolyphaseResamplerType) and whether that difference is tolerable.

size_t GetRequiredBufferSizeForPolyphaseResampler (int inputSampleRate, int outputSampleRate, int channelCount, bool isHighQuality) noexcept
 Determines the size of the buffer required for the polyphase resampler. More...
 
double CalculatePolyphaseResamplerActualOutputSampleRate (int inputSampleRate, int outputSampleRate) noexcept
 Calculates the actual output sample rate for the polyphase resampler. More...
 
int GetPolyphaseResamplerOutputSampleCount (const PolyphaseResamplerType *pResampler, int inputSampleCount) noexcept
 Calculates the maximum number of output samples that will be obtained from the polyphase resampler process based on the number of input samples. More...
 
Result InitializePolyphaseResampler (PolyphaseResamplerType *pResampler, void *buffer, size_t bufferSize, int inputSampleRate, int outputSampleRate, int channelCount, bool isHighQuality, float gain) noexcept
 Initializes the polyphase resampler. More...
 
Result ProcessPolyphaseResamplerBuffer (PolyphaseResamplerType *pResampler, int *pOutputSampleCount, int16_t *pOutputBuffer, size_t outputBufferSize, const int16_t *pInputBuffer, int inputSampleCount) noexcept
 Uses the polyphase resampler to convert the frequency. More...

 Calculates the maximum number of output samples that will be obtained from the resampler process based on the number of input samples. More...

 Initializes the resampler. More...

 Uses the resampler to change the frequency. More...

 The number of samples per APDCM frame.
 
constexpr size_t AdpcmFrameSize = 8
 The size per APDCM frame.

 ADPCM file header size.
 
static constexpr std::int32_t AudioCoprocessorFrameTimeLimit = 4000
 The audio coprocessor is the maximum amount of time, in microseconds, available for processing of one audio frame. More...
 
constexpr float AudioDeviceOutputVolumeMax = 128.0f
 The maximum volume that can be specified for SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume().
 
constexpr float AudioDeviceOutputVolumeMin = 0.0f
 The minimum volume that can be specified for SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume().
 
constexpr int AudioInBufferCountMax = 32
 Upper limit of AudioInBuffer objects able to be added to audio inputs.
 
constexpr int AudioInCountMax = 4
 Maximum supported number of simultaneous audio inputs.
 
constexpr float AudioInDeviceGainMax = 1.0f
 The maximum device gain that can be set for the audio input.
 
constexpr float AudioInDeviceGainMin = 0.0f
 The minimum device gain that can be set for the audio input.
 
constexpr int AudioOutBufferCountMax = 32
 Upper limit of AudioOutBuffer objects able to be added to audio inputs.
 
constexpr int AudioOutCountMax = 2
 Maximum supported number of simultaneous audio outputs.
 
constexpr int AudioRendererCountMax = 2
 The number of AudioRenderer instances that can be used at the same time.
 
constexpr int BufferAlignSize = 64
 The alignment size for audio buffers.
 
constexpr int MixBufferCountMax = 24
 The maximum number of mix buffers that can be created for a single instance of SubMix or FinalMix.
 

Detailed Description

Namespace for the audio library.

Enumeration Type Documentation

◆ AudioInState

enum nn::audio::AudioInState

Enumerated type representing the states of an audio input.

Enumerator

Running.

AudioInState_Stopped 

Stopped.

◆ AudioOutState

Enumerated type representing the states of an audio output.

Running.

AudioOutState_Stopped 

Stopped.

AudioRendererState_Stopped

enum nn::audio::PerformanceDetailType

Enumerated type representing the type of detailed performance information.

Enumerator
PerformanceDetailType_Unknown 

Unknown performance information.

Information about loading signed 16-bit integer PCM data.

Information about loading ADPCM data.

Volume process information.

Information about biquad filters applied to VoiceType objects.

Information about VoiceType, SubMixType, and FinalMixType mixes and BufferMixer effect mixes.

◆ SampleFormat

enum nn::audio::SampleFormat

Enumerates the sample formats.

Details
This enumerated type represents the sample formats used by audio devices.

Enumerator
SampleFormat_Invalid 

Invalid format.

SampleFormat_PcmInt8 

8-bit signed integer PCM format.

SampleFormat_PcmInt16 

16-bit signed integer PCM format.

SampleFormat_PcmInt24 

24-bit signed integer PCM format.

SampleFormat_PcmInt32 

32-bit signed integer PCM format.

SampleFormat_PcmFloat 

Single-precision floating point PCM format.

SampleFormat_Adpcm 

ADPCM format.

◆ ParseAdpcmHeader()

void nn::audio::ParseAdpcmHeader ( AdpcmHeaderInfo *  pOutInfo,
const void *  header,
std::size_t  size 
)
noexcept

Analyzes the ADPCM header information.

Parameters
[out]pOutInfoADPCM header information.
[in]headerHeader data.
[in]sizeSize of the header data.
Precondition
  • pOutInfo != nullptr.
  • header != nullptr.
  • header is aligned to sizeof(int32_t).
  • size >= nn::audio::AdpcmHeaderSize.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetAudioInDeviceGain()

nn::Result nn::audio::SetAudioInDeviceGain ( AudioIn *  pAudioIn,
float  gain 
)
noexcept

Sets the device gain for the audio input.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
[in]gainDevice gain value.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNotSupported must be handled.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • gain >= nn::audio::AudioInDeviceGainMin && gain <= nn::audio::AudioInDeviceGainMax.
Postcondition
  • The device gain is set for the audio input.

Details
Sets the device gain for the audio input. The device gain is the gain value for hardware, such as microphones, that is associated with audio input. For example, you can use this function to set the gain of the microphone amplifier when using a microphone. The device gain settings may not be supported depending on the type of input device. If this occurs, this function will return nn::audio::ResultNotSupported and fail. The mapping between the values specified by this function and the values actually applied to the hardware depends on the platform and device.

The processing for this function may require some time. Do not operate pAudioIn while this function is called.

◆ GetAudioInDeviceGain()

float nn::audio::GetAudioInDeviceGain ( const AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Gets the device gain of the audio buffer.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Returns
Returns the device gain.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.

Details
Returns nn::audio::AudioInDeviceGainMax immediately after calling nn::audio::OpenAudioIn() (in other words, if nn::audio::SetAudioInDeviceGain() is not called).

The device gain settings may not be supported depending on the type of input device. If this occurs, this function will always return nn::audio::AudioInDeviceGainMax.

◆ ListAudioIns()

int nn::audio::ListAudioIns ( AudioInInfo *  outAudioIns,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets a list of available audio inputs.

Parameters
[out]outAudioInsBuffer to get audio input information.
[in]countNumber of audio inputs that can be stored in outAudioIns.
Returns
Returns the number of audio inputs retrieved and stored in outAudioIns.
Precondition
  • 0 <= count.
Postcondition
  • For a return value of n, data is written from outAudioIns[0] to outAudioIns[n-1].

Details
You can use the name from the obtained AudioInInfo to open an audio input with the OpenAudioIn() function. Note that the audio inputs that were available for use when the ListAudioIns() function was called might not be available when the OpenAudioIn() function is called (because the connection might have been dropped).

Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ InitializeAudioInParameter()

void nn::audio::InitializeAudioInParameter ( AudioInParameter *  pOutParameter)
noexcept

Initializes the audio input parameters.

Parameters
[out]pOutParameterParameters
Precondition
  • pOutParameter != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • pOutParameter->sampleRate == 0.

Details
Initializes the audio input parameters specified in pOutParameter. The audio input parameters after initialization will be replaced by the initial values specified by the postconditions. Before using the audio input parameters, make sure to call this API and initialize them.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutParameter while calling this function.

Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ OpenDefaultAudioIn() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenDefaultAudioIn ( AudioIn *  pOutAudioIn,
const AudioInParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the default audio input and gets an accessor.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutAudioIn != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • If the default audio input is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pOutAudioIn is initialized.
    • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pOutAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.
  • If the specified audio input is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
The number of audio inputs that can be open at the same time is nn::audio::AudioInCountMax.

After the audio inputs are opened, you can get information from them or manipulate them with functions like nn::audio::AppendAudioInBuffer(). Audio recording does not begin until you call nn::audio::StartAudioIn().

When the parameter member variable is set to 0, it takes the default value. The default is platform-dependent.

NX Platform Only:
The NX platform can only use a sampleRate value of 48000. The default values are as follows.
  • sampleRate = 48000.
The sample format for audio input will always become a 16 bit signed integer PCM format (nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmInt16). The number of channels will always be two. However, the data for each channel is identical at this point.
Windows Platform Only:
In the PC development environment, this default value takes the format specified in Microphone Properties. For more information, open the Control Panel and select Sound.

The processing for this function may require some time.

◆ OpenAudioIn() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenAudioIn ( AudioIn *  pOutAudioIn,
const char *  name,
const AudioInParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the audio input specified in name and gets an accessor.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
[in]nameName of the audio input.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNotFound must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutAudioIn != nullptr.
  • name != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • If the specified audio input is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pOutAudioIn is initialized.
    • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pOutAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.
  • If the specified audio input is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
You must use the name defined for each platform. You can get a list of the names of the audio inputs that are actually available with the ListAudioIns() function.

The number of audio inputs that can be open at the same time is nn::audio::AudioInCountMax.

After the audio inputs are opened, you can get information from them or manipulate them with functions like nn::audio::AppendAudioInBuffer(). Audio recording does not begin until you call nn::audio::StartAudioIn().

When the parameter member variable is set to 0, it takes the default value. The default is platform-dependent.

NX Platform Only:
The NX platform can only use a sampleRate value of 48000. The default values are as follows.
  • sampleRate = 48000.
The sample format for audio input will always become a 16 bit signed integer PCM format (nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmInt16). The number of channels will always be two. However, the data for each channel is identical at this point.
Windows Platform Only:
In the PC development environment, this default value takes the format specified in Microphone Properties. For more information, open the Control Panel and select Sound.

The processing for this function may require some time.

Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ CloseAudioIn()

void nn::audio::CloseAudioIn ( AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Closes the audio input and destroys the accessor.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • The audio input managed by pAudioIn is opened.
  • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.
Postcondition
  • pAudioIn no longer manages an audio input.
Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ StartAudioIn()

Result nn::audio::StartAudioIn ( AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Starts recording a waveform from an audio input.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • The audio input managed by pAudioIn is opened.
  • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Started.
Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ StopAudioIn()

void nn::audio::StopAudioIn ( AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Stops recording a waveform from an audio input.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • The audio input managed by pAudioIn is opened.
  • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Started.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.

Details
After this function is called, items that have not completed recording will no longer be accessed in the audio input buffer registered with nn::audio::AppendAudioInBuffer(), but the items are still registered and access will resume if nn::audio::StartAudioIn() is called again. The registrations for all audio input buffers will be cleared if you call the nn::audio::CloseAudioIn() function.

Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Returns
Returns the state.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • The audio input managed by pAudioIn is opened.

◆ GetAudioInName()

const char * nn::audio::GetAudioInName ( const AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Gets the name of an audio input.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Returns
Returns a pointer to the name buffer of the audio input.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • The audio input managed by pAudioIn is opened.

Details
The content of the buffer returned by this function becomes undefined after the nn::audio::CloseAudioIn() function is called.

◆ SetAudioInBufferInfo()

void nn::audio::SetAudioInBufferInfo ( AudioInBuffer *  pOutAudioInBuffer,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
size_t  dataSize 
)
noexcept

Sets information in an audio input buffer.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioInBufferAudio input buffer.
[in]bufferData buffer.
[in]bufferSizeSize of the data buffer.
[in]dataSizeThe amount of data, in bytes, to enter.
Precondition
  • pAudioInBuffer != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to AudioInBuffer::AddressAlignment.
  • bufferSize > 0 and is aligned to AudioInBuffer::SizeGranularity.
  • dataSize > 0 and dataSize <= bufferSize.
Postcondition
  • The information in buffer, bufferSize, and dataSize is set in pOutAudioInBuffer.
Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ AppendAudioInBuffer()

void nn::audio::AppendAudioInBuffer ( AudioIn *  pAudioIn,
AudioInBuffer *  pAudioInBuffer 
)
noexcept

Registers an audio input buffer.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
[in]pAudioInBufferAudio input buffer.
Returns
Returns true if registration is successful, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • pAudioInBuffer != nullptr.
  • GetAudioInBufferDataPointer(pAudioInBuffer) != nullptr.
  • GetAudioInBufferDataPointer(pAudioInBuffer) is aligned to nn::audio::AudioInBuffer::AddressAlignment.
  • ContainsAudioInBuffer(pAudioInBuffer, pAudioIn) == false.
  • GetAudioInBufferDataSize(pAudioInBuffer) % (nn::audio::GetAudioInChannelCount(pAudioIn) * nn::audio::GetSampleByteSize (nn::audio::GetAudioInSampleFormat(pAudioIn))) == 0.
Postcondition
  • Managed under pAudioIn until audio is recorded in pAudioInBuffer.

Details
The registered audio input buffers are managed in the audio inputs as FIFO lists and are consecutively recorded from the audio inputs in the order they were registered.

After registration, either check completion with the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioInBuffer() function or avoid manipulating the audio input buffers because they can still be manipulated by pAudioIn until the nn::audio::CloseAudioIn() function is called.

Up to nn::audio::AudioInBufferCountMax instances of AudioInBuffer can be added at the same time. To add more than this number of AudioInBuffer objects, you must wait for registered AudioInBuffer objects to finish recording, and then call the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioOutBuffer() function.

The data stored in nn::audio::GetAudioInBufferDataPointer() is in a format obtainable by nn::audio::GetAudioInSampleFormat() and is interleaved.

The following features are not provided.

  • Deregistering audio input buffers before or during recording
  • Determining whether an audio input buffer is currently in recording
  • Treating an audio input buffer as a ring buffer when recording
Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ GetReleasedAudioInBuffer()

AudioInBuffer * nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioInBuffer ( AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Gets an audio input buffer that has already been recorded to.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Returns
Returns an audio input buffer that has already been recorded to.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.

Details
If multiple audio input buffers have finished recording, the one that finished recording first is returned. If no audio input buffers have finished recording, nullptr is returned.

Examples
AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp.

◆ ContainsAudioInBuffer()

bool nn::audio::ContainsAudioInBuffer ( const AudioIn *  pAudioIn,
const AudioInBuffer *  pAudioInBuffer 
)
noexcept

Determines whether an AudioInBuffer object was appended to an AudioIn object.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
[in]pAudioInBufferAudio input buffer.
Returns
Returns true if AudioInBuffer was appended to AudioIn, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • pAudioInBuffer != nullptr.

◆ OpenDefaultAudioIn() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenDefaultAudioIn ( AudioIn *  pOutAudioIn,
nn::os::SystemEvent *  pOutSystemEvent,
const AudioInParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the default audio input, gets an accessor, and initializes a synchronization object for notification purposes.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
[out]pOutSystemEventSystemEvent for synchronization.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutAudioIn != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
Postcondition
  • If the default audio input is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pOutAudioIn is initialized.
    • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pOutAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.
    • *pOutSystemEvent is initialized.
  • If the specified audio input is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
pOutSystemEvent becomes a signaled event when it is possible to release one or more of the audio output buffers appended by nn::audio::AppendAudioInBuffer(). After the event becomes signaled, make sure that you use the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioInBuffer() function to check whether the buffers have been released. pOutSystemEvent is initialized to nn::os::EventClearMode_AutoClear.

Warning
The nn::os::SystemEvent class object specified for pOutSystemEvent must call nn::os::DestroySystemEvent( pOutSystemEvent->GetBase() ) after nn::audio::CloseAudioIn() has been called. Failure to make this call could cause the application to stop responding.

For more information, see nn::audio::OpenDefaultAudioIn(AudioIn* pOutAudioIn, const AudioInParameter& parameter).

◆ OpenAudioIn() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenAudioIn ( AudioIn *  pOutAudioIn,
nn::os::SystemEvent *  pOutSystemEvent,
const char *  name,
const AudioInParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the audio input specified by name, gets an accessor, and initializes a synchronization object for notification purposes.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
[out]pOutSystemEventSystemEvent for synchronization.
[in]nameName of the audio input.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNotFound must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutAudioIn != nullptr.
  • name != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
Postcondition
  • If the specified audio input is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pOutAudioIn is initialized.
    • nn::audio::GetAudioInState(pOutAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.
    • *pOutSystemEvent is initialized.
  • If the specified audio input is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
pOutSystemEvent becomes a signaled event when it is possible to release one or more of the audio output buffers appended by nn::audio::AppendAudioInBuffer(). After the event becomes signaled, make sure that you use the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioInBuffer() function to check whether the buffers have been released. pOutSystemEvent is initialized to nn::os::EventClearMode_AutoClear.

Warning
The nn::os::SystemEvent class object specified for pOutSystemEvent must call nn::os::DestroySystemEvent( pOutSystemEvent->GetBase() ) after nn::audio::CloseAudioIn() has been called. Failure to make this call could cause the application to stop responding.

For more information, see nn::audio::OpenAudioIn(AudioIn* pOutAudioIn, const char* name, const AudioInParameter& parameter).

◆ GetAudioInBufferCount()

int nn::audio::GetAudioInBufferCount ( const AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Gets the number of audio input buffers registered in AudioIn.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Returns
Returns the number of registered audio input buffers.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • pAudioIn is initialized.

Details
Gets the number of registered audio input buffers. This number includes the buffer that is currently being used for recording.

◆ FlushAudioInBuffers()

bool nn::audio::FlushAudioInBuffers ( AudioIn *  pAudioIn)
noexcept

Records to all audio input buffers registered to AudioIn that have not been recorded to.

Parameters
[in]pAudioInThe pointer to the AudioIn structure.
Returns
Indicates whether all registered buffers have been recorded to.
Precondition
  • pAudioIn != nullptr.
  • pAudioIn is initialized.
  • GetAudioInState(pAudioIn) == nn::audio::AudioInState_Stopped.

Details
Records to all audio input buffers registered to pAudioIn that have not been recorded to. The buffers recorded to by this function have recordings of silence. When pAudioIn is active, audio input buffers that are recording audio are not transitioned to the recorded state by this function. When pAudioIn is stopped, all audio input buffers including those that are recording audio are transitioned to the recorded state by this function.

The function returns true if all audio input buffers registered to pAudioIn have been transitioned to the recorded state. Otherwise, the function returns false.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not operate pAudioIn while this function is called.

◆ ListAudioOuts()

int nn::audio::ListAudioOuts ( AudioOutInfo *  outAudioOuts,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets a list of available audio outputs.

Parameters
[out]outAudioOutsBuffer to get audio output information.
[in]countNumber of audio outputs that can be stored in outAudioOuts.
Returns
Returns the number of audio outputs retrieved and stored in outAudioOuts.
Precondition
  • 0 <= count.
Postcondition
  • Information is written from outAudioOuts[0] to outAudioOuts[n-1] for return value n.

Details
The audio output obtained using this function is a virtual audio device that can be used in nn::audio. By using this virtual audio device, you can automatically set the output destination based on the operating environment of the program. Use nn::audio::SetAudioDeviceMapping() to explicitly set the output destination in a PC environment.

You can open audio outputs with the OpenAudioOut() function using the name from the obtained AudioOutInfo. Note that audio outputs that were available for use when the ListAudioOuts() function was called might not be available when the OpenAudioOut() function is called (because the connection might have been lost).

Examples
AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, and AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp.

◆ InitializeAudioOutParameter()

void nn::audio::InitializeAudioOutParameter ( AudioOutParameter *  pOutParameter)
noexcept

Initializes the audio output parameters.

Parameters
[out]pOutParameterParameters
Precondition
  • pOutParameter != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • pOutParameter->sampleRate == 0.
  • pOutParameter->channelCount == 0.

Details
Initializes the audio output parameters specified in pOutParameter. The audio output parameters after initialization will be replaced by the initial values specified by the postconditions. Before using the audio output parameters, make sure that you call this function to initialize them.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutParameter while calling this function.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

◆ OpenDefaultAudioOut() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenDefaultAudioOut ( AudioOut *  pOutAudioOut,
const AudioOutParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the default audio output and gets an accessor.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidChannelCount must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • If the default audio output is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pAudioOut is initialized.
    • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.
  • If the specified audio output is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
The number of audio inputs that can be open at the same time is nn::audio::AudioOutCountMax.

After the audio inputs have been opened, you can get information from them and operate on them using functions like nn::audio::AppendAudioOutBuffer(). Audio is not played back until you call nn::audio::StartAudioOut().

When the parameter member variable is set to 0, it takes the default value. The default is platform-dependent.

NX Platform Only:
The NX platform can only use a sampleRate value of 48000 and a channelCount value of either 2 or 6. The default values are as follows.
  • sampleRate = 48000.
  • channelCount = 2.
The sample format for audio output will always become a 16 bit signed integer PCM format (nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmInt16).
Windows Platform Only:
The default value in a PC development environment is the format you specify using the speaker properties. For more information, open the Control Panel and select Sound.

The processing for this function may require some time.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

◆ OpenDefaultAudioOut() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenDefaultAudioOut ( AudioOut *  pOutAudioOut,
nn::os::SystemEvent *  pOutSystemEvent,
const AudioOutParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the default audio output, gets an accessor, and initializes a synchronization object for notification purposes.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
[out]pOutSystemEventSystemEvent for synchronization.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidChannelCount must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
Postcondition
  • If the default audio output is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pAudioOut is initialized.
    • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.
    • *pOutSystemEvent is initialized.
  • If the specified audio output is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
pOutSystemEvent becomes a signaled event when it is possible to release one or more of the audio output buffers appended by nn::audio::AppendAudioOutBuffer(). After the event becomes signaled, make sure that you use the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioOutBuffer() function to check whether the buffers have been released. pOutSystemEvent is initialized to nn::os::EventClearMode_AutoClear.

Warning
The nn::os::SystemEvent class object specified for pOutSystemEvent must call nn::os::DestroySystemEvent( pOutSystemEvent->GetBase() ) after nn::audio::CloseAudioOut() has been called. Failure to make this call could cause the application to stop responding.

For more information, see nn::audio::OpenDefaultAudioOut(AudioOut* pOutAudioOut, const AudioOutParameter& parameter).

◆ OpenAudioOut() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenAudioOut ( AudioOut *  pOutAudioOut,
const char *  name,
const AudioOutParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the audio output specified in name and gets an accessor.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
[in]nameName of an audio output.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNotFound must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidChannelCount must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • name != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • If the specified audio output is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pAudioOut is initialized.
    • nn::audio::GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.
  • If the specified audio output is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
You must use the name defined for each platform. You can get a list of the names of the audio outputs that are actually available by using the ListAudioOuts() function.

The number of audio outputs that can be open at the same time is nn::audio::AudioOutCountMax.

After the audio output have been opened, you can get information from them and operate on them using functions like nn::audio::AppendAudioOutBuffer(). Audio is not played back until you call nn::audio::StartAudioOut().

When the parameter member variable is set to 0, it takes the default value. The default is platform-dependent.

NX Platform Only:
The NX platform can only use a sampleRate value of 48000 and a channelCount value of either 2 or 6. The default values are as follows.
  • sampleRate = 48000.
  • channelCount = 2.
The sample format for audio output will always become a 16 bit signed integer PCM format (nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmInt16).
Windows Platform Only:
The default value in a PC development environment is the format you specify using the speaker properties. For more information, open the Control Panel and select Sound.

The processing for this function may require some time.

Examples
AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, and AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp.

◆ OpenAudioOut() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenAudioOut ( AudioOut *  pOutAudioOut,
nn::os::SystemEvent *  pOutSystemEvent,
const char *  name,
const AudioOutParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Initializes the audio output specified by name, gets an accessor, and initializes a synchronization object for notification purposes.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
[out]pOutSystemEventSystemEvent for synchronization.
[in]nameName of an audio output.
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNotFound must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidSampleRate must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidChannelCount must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
  • name != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • If the specified audio output is available, the postconditions are as follows.
    • pAudioOut is initialized.
    • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.
    • *pOutSystemEvent is initialized.
  • If the specified audio output is not available, there are no postconditions.

Details
pOutSystemEvent becomes a signaled event when it is possible to release one or more of the audio output buffers appended by nn::audio::AppendAudioOutBuffer(). After the event becomes signaled, make sure that you use the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioOutBuffer() function to check whether the buffers have been released. pOutSystemEvent is initialized to nn::os::EventClearMode_AutoClear.

Warning
The nn::os::SystemEvent class object specified for pOutSystemEvent must call nn::os::DestroySystemEvent( pOutSystemEvent->GetBase() ) after nn::audio::CloseAudioOut() has been called. Failure to make this call could cause the application to stop responding.

For more information, see nn::audio::OpenAudioOut(AudioOut* pOutAudioOut, const char* name, const AudioOutParameter& parameter).

◆ CloseAudioOut()

void nn::audio::CloseAudioOut ( AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Closes the audio output and destroys the accessor.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • The audio output managed by pAudioOut was opened.
  • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.
Postcondition
  • pAudioOut no longer manages an audio output.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

◆ StartAudioOut()

Result nn::audio::StartAudioOut ( AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Starts playing a waveform from an audio output.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • The audio output managed by pAudioOut was opened.
  • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.
Postcondition
  • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Started.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

◆ StopAudioOut()

void nn::audio::StopAudioOut ( AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Stops playing a waveform from an audio output.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • The audio output managed by pAudioOut was opened.
  • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Started.
Postcondition
  • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.

Details
Note that if you call this function, audio output buffers registered with the nn::audio::AppendAudioOutBuffer() function will no longer be accessed if playback has not finished, but they remain registered and will be accessible if you call the nn::audio::StartAudioOut() function again. The registrations for all audio output buffers will be cleared if you call the nn::audio::CloseAudioOut() function.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

noexcept

Parameters

Returns
Returns the playback state.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • The audio output managed by pAudioOut was opened.
Examples
AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, and AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp.

noexcept

Gets the name of an audio output.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Returns
Returns a pointer to the name buffer of the audio output.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • The audio output managed by pAudioOut was opened.

Details
The content of the buffer returned by this function becomes undefined after the nn::audio::CloseAudioOut() function is called.

Examples
AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, and AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp.

◆ SetAudioOutBufferInfo()

void nn::audio::SetAudioOutBufferInfo ( AudioOutBuffer *  pOutAudioOutBuffer,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
size_t  dataSize 
)
noexcept

Sets information in an audio output buffer.

Parameters
[out]pOutAudioOutBufferAudio output buffer.
[in]bufferData buffer.
[in]bufferSizeSize of the data buffer.
[in]dataSizeThe amount of data, in bytes, to play.
Precondition
  • pAudioOutBuffer != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to AudioOutBuffer::AddressAlignment.
  • bufferSize > 0 and is aligned to AudioOutBuffer::SizeGranularity.
  • dataSize > 0 and dataSize <= bufferSize.
Postcondition
  • The information in buffer, size, startOffset, and endOffset is set in pOutAudioOutBuffer.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

Precondition

AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, and AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp.

◆ AppendAudioOutBuffer()

void nn::audio::AppendAudioOutBuffer ( AudioOut *  pAudioOut,
AudioOutBuffer *  pAudioOutBuffer 
)
noexcept

Registers an audio output buffer.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
[in]pAudioOutBufferAudio output buffer.
Returns
Returns true if registration is successful, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pAudioOutBuffer != nullptr.
  • GetAudioOutBufferDataPointer(pAudioOutBuffer) != nullptr.
  • GetAudioOutBufferDataPointer(<var>pAudioOutBuffer</var>) is aligned to nn::audio::AudioOutBuffer::AddressAlignment.
  • ContainsAudioOutBuffer(<var>pAudioOutBuffer</var>, <var>pAudioOut</var>) == false.
  • GetAudioOutBufferDataSize(<var>pAudioOutBuffer</var>) % (nn::audio::GetAudioOutChannelCount(<var>pAudioOut</var>) * nn::audio::GetSampleByteSize (nn::audio::GetAudioOutSampleFormat(<var>pAudioOut</var>))) == 0.
Postcondition
  • Managed under pAudioOut until the content of pAudioOutBuffer is played.

Details
The buffers are managed in the audio inputs as FIFO lists and are consecutively recorded from the audio inputs in the order they were registered.

After registration, either check completion with the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioOutBuffer() function or avoid manipulating the audio output buffers because they can still be manipulated by pAudioOut until the nn::audio::CloseAudioOut() function is called.

Up to nn::audio::AudioOutBufferCountMax instances of AudioOutBuffer can be added at the same time. If you want to add more than this number of AudioOutBuffer instances, you must first wait for the registered instances of AudioOutBuffer to finish playing and then call the nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioOutBuffer() function.

The data stored in nn::audio::GetAudioOutBufferDataPointer() must be in a format that the nn::audio::GetAudioOutSampleFormat() function can get, have a sample rate that the nn::audio::GetAudioOutSampleRate() function can get, and be interleaved (if there are two or more channels).

The following features are not provided.

  • Deregistering audio output buffers before or during playback
  • Determining whether an audio output buffer is currently being played back
  • Looping playback of the audio output buffer
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

◆ GetReleasedAudioOutBuffer()

AudioOutBuffer * nn::audio::GetReleasedAudioOutBuffer ( AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Gets an audio output buffer that has already been played.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Returns
Returns an audio output buffer that has already been played.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.

Details
If multiple audio output buffers have finished playback, the one that finished playback first is returned. If no audio output buffers have finished playback, nullptr is returned.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioEchoback/AudioEchoback.cpp, AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp, AudioOutWithResampler/AudioOutWithResampler.cpp, and CodecAacDecoder/CodecAacDecoder.cpp.

◆ ContainsAudioOutBuffer()

bool nn::audio::ContainsAudioOutBuffer ( const AudioOut *  pAudioOut,

)
noexcept

[in]pAudioOutBufferAudio input buffer.
Returns
Returns true if AudioOutBuffer was appended to AudioOut, or returns false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pAudioOutBuffer != nullptr.

◆ GetAudioOutBufferCount()

int nn::audio::GetAudioOutBufferCount ( const AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Gets the number of audio output buffers registered to AudioOut.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Returns
Returns the number of registered audio output buffers.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pAudioOut is initialized.

Details
Gets the number of registered audio output buffers. This number includes the buffer that is currently being used for playback.

◆ GetAudioOutPlayedSampleCount()

int64_t nn::audio::GetAudioOutPlayedSampleCount ( const nn::audio::AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Gets the number of samples of the data played back by AudioOut.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Returns
Returns the number of samples played back by pAudioOut after StartAudioOut() is called.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pAudioOut is initialized.

Details
The sample count information is only updated at set intervals. The time interval varies depending on the platform.

Windows Platform Only:
In the Windows environment, the sample count information is updated every 10 milliseconds.
NX Platform Only:
In the NX environment, the sample count information is updated every 5 milliseconds.

◆ FlushAudioOutBuffers()

bool nn::audio::FlushAudioOutBuffers ( AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Sets all of the unplayed audio output buffers registered in AudioOut to played.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Returns
A flag indicating whether all registered buffers have been set to played.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pAudioOut is initialized.
  • GetAudioOutState(<var>pAudioOut</var>) == nn::audio::AudioOutState_Stopped.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform an operations on pAudioOut while calling this function.

◆ SetAudioOutVolume()

int nn::audio::SetAudioOutVolume ( AudioOut *  pAudioOut,
float  volume 
)
noexcept

Sets the volume for AudioOut.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
[in]volumeVolume value to be configured.
Precondition
  • nn::audio::AudioOut::GetVolumeMin() <= volume <= nn::audio::AudioOut::GetVolumeMax().
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pAudioOut is initialized.
Postcondition
  • volume == nn::audio::GetAudioOutVolume().

Details
Sets the volume for AudioOut. The default is 1.0f. The volume that is ultimately applied to the waveforms output from AudioOut is the product of the volume set by this function for each AudioOut multiplied by the device volume. For more information about the device volume, see nn::audio::SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume().

Note
Audio cutoff may occur depending on the set volume value. If audio cutoff occurs, verify that the volume is within appropriate values.
Examples
AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp.

◆ GetAudioOutVolume()

float nn::audio::GetAudioOutVolume ( const AudioOut *  pAudioOut)
noexcept

Gets the volume of the AudioOut object.

Parameters
[in]pAudioOutPointer to an AudioOut structure.
Precondition
  • pAudioOut != nullptr.
  • pAudioOut is initialized.
Returns
Volume value.
Examples
AudioOut/AudioOut.cpp.

◆ InitializeAudioRendererParameter()

void nn::audio::InitializeAudioRendererParameter ( AudioRendererParameter *  pOutParameter)
noexcept

Initializes the audio renderer parameters.

Parameters
[out]pOutParameterParameters
Precondition
  • pOutParameter != nullptr.
Postcondition
  • pOutParameter->sampleRate == 48000.
  • pOutParameter->sampleCount == 240.
  • pOutParameter->mixBufferCount == 1.
  • pOutParameter->subMixCount == 0.
  • pOutParameter->voiceCount == 1.
  • pOutParameter->sinkCount == 1.
  • pOutParameter->effectCount == 0.
  • pOutParameter->performanceFrameCount == 0.
  • pOutParameter->isVoiceDropEnabled == false.
  • pOutParameter->executionMode == nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution.

Details
Initializes the audio renderer parameters specified by pOutParameter. The audio renderer parameters after initialization will be replaced by the initial values specified by the postconditions. Before using the audio renderer parameters, make sure to call this API and initialize them.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutParameter while calling this function.

NX Platform Only:
The following postconditions are added for the NX platform.
  • pOutParameter->renderingDevice == nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_AudioCoprocessor.
Windows Platform Only:
The following postconditions are added for the Windows platform. - pOutParameter->renderingDevice == nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ IsValidAudioRendererParameter()

bool nn::audio::IsValidAudioRendererParameter ( const AudioRendererParameter &  parameter)
noexcept

Determines whether the audio renderer parameter is valid.

Parameters
[in]parameterParameters
Returns
Returns true if parameter is allowed, or false otherwise.

Details
Specifically, this function checks the following. Depending on the platform, additional conditions might be checked.

  • parameter.sampleRate == 32000 || parameter.sampleRate == 48000.
  • parameter.mixBufferCount > 0 && parameter.mixBufferCount <= nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter::MixBufferCountMax.
  • parameter.voiceCount > 0 && parameter.voiceCount <= nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter::VoiceCountMax.
  • parameter.subMixCount >= 0 && parameter.subMixCount <= nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter::SubMixCountMax.
  • parameter.sinkCount > 0 && parameter.sinkCount <= nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter::SinkCountMax.
  • parameter.effectCount >= 0 && parameter.effectCount <= nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter::EffectCountMax.
  • parameter.sampleCount == parameter.sampleRate * 0.005.
NX Platform Only:
The following additional conditions are checked for the NX platform.
  • (parameter.renderingDevice == nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_AudioCoprocessor && parameter.renderingExecutionMode == nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution) || (parameter.renderingDevice == nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu && parameter.renderingExecutionMode == nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_ManualExecution)
Windows Platform Only:
The following additional conditions are checked for the Windows platform. parameter.renderingDevice == nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu.

The current release only supports a rate of 5 milliseconds per audio frame.

Note
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on parameter while calling this function.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetAudioRendererExclusiveControlLeakageCheckEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetAudioRendererExclusiveControlLeakageCheckEnabled ( bool  enabled)
noexcept

Enables or disables mutual exclusion error detection functionality when using the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]enabledEnabled or disabled.
Precondition
The audio renderer that was opened does not exist.
Postcondition
nn::audio::IsAudioRendererExclusiveControlLeakageCheckEnabled() == enabled.

Details
Enables or disables detection functionality for mutual exclusion error detection when using the audio renderer. It is disabled by default. The application stops with an assertion failure when a mutual exclusion error is detected. Enabling this functionality increases the time required to call audio renderer functions for processing mutual exclusion errors. This functionality is disabled in release builds regardless of the setting.

Mutual exclusion error detection is performed for the following function calls in the current release.

  • Calls to RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() and calls to functions that must be mutually exclusive to RequestUpdateAudioRenderer().

◆ IsAudioRendererExclusiveControlLeakageCheckEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsAudioRendererExclusiveControlLeakageCheckEnabled ( )
noexcept

Gets the enabled status of the mutual exclusion error detection functionality when using the audio renderer.

Returns
Returns true if enabled, or false otherwise.

◆ GetAudioRendererElapsedFrameCount()

int64_t nn::audio::GetAudioRendererElapsedFrameCount ( const AudioRendererConfig *  pConfig)
noexcept

Gets the number of frames that have elapsed in the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pConfigAudioRendererConfig.
Returns
Returns the number of elapsed frames.
Precondition
  • pConfig != nullptr.

Details
Gets the number of frames that have elapsed in the audio renderer. The number of elapsed frames is a value that represents how many times audio frames have been created since rendering began in the audio renderer. For example, if each audio frame is 5 milliseconds and 15 milliseconds of audio have been rendered, this function returns 3 frames as the return value. The initial value immediately after the audio renderer has been opened is 0 frames. The value is reset to 0 when the audio renderer is started by StartAudioRenderer().

The value returned by this function is updated by a call to RequestUpdateAudioRenderer(). Rendering begins after the audio renderer has transitioned to the start state by the call to StartAudioRenderer(). For this reason, this function might return a value larger than 0 even immediately after the call to StartAudioRenderer().

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Note
You can also determine the number of elapsed frames by counting how many times the nn::os::SystemEvent object specified in nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer(AudioRendererHandle*, nn::os::SystemEvent*, const AudioRendererParameter&, void*, size_t) has been signaled. However, the signal state does not change if an audio frame is created at the time of signaling, so you may not be able to get the accurate number of elapsed frames. If you want to get the accurate number of elapsed frames, use this function.

◆ OpenAudioRenderer() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer ( AudioRendererHandle *  outHandle,
const AudioRendererParameter &  parameter,
void *  workBuffer,
size_t  workBufferSize 
)
noexcept

Gets the audio renderer.

Parameters
[out]outHandleAudio renderer handle.
[in]parameterParameters.
[in]workBufferThe work buffer.
[in]workBufferSizeThe work buffer size.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNoAudioDeviceFound must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInsufficientBuffer must be handled.
Precondition
  • outHandle != nullptr.
  • nn::audio::IsValidAudioRendererParameter(parameter) == true.
  • workBuffer != nullptr.
  • workBuffer is aligned to nn::os::MemoryPageSize.
  • workBufferSize is an integer multiple of nn::os::MemoryPageSize.
  • workBufferSize >= nn::audio::GetAudioRendererWorkBufferSize(parameter).
Postcondition
  • Stores a valid handle to *outHandle.
  • nn::audio::GetAudioRendererState(handle) == nn::audio::AudioRendererState_Stopped.

Details
AudioRenderer is in the stopped state immediately after this function is called.

NX Platform Only:
The following combinations of devices and rendering modes may be used for rendering on the NX platform.
  • nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_AudioCoprocessor and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution Rendering is executed in the audio DSP. Rendering is executed automatically within the system.
  • nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_ManualExecution The nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() function is called and rendering is executed in the thread. Rendering will not be executed unless nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() is called.
Windows Platform Only:
The following combinations of devices and rendering modes may be used for rendering on the Windows platform. - nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution      Rendering is executed automatically by the thread created within the library. - nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_ManualExecution      The nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() function is called and rendering is executed in the thread. Rendering will not be executed unless nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() is called.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ OpenAudioRenderer() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer ( AudioRendererHandle *  outHandle,
nn::os::SystemEvent *  pOutSystemEvent,
const AudioRendererParameter &  parameter,
void *  workBuffer,
size_t  workBufferSize 
)
noexcept

Gets the audio renderer and initializes the synchronization object for notification purposes.

Parameters
[out]outHandleAudio renderer handle.
[out]pOutSystemEventSystemEvent for synchronization.
[in]parameterParameters.
[in]workBufferThe work buffer.
[in]workBufferSizeThe work buffer size.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNoAudioDeviceFound must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultInsufficientBuffer must be handled.
Precondition
  • outHandle != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsValidAudioRendererParameter(parameter) == true.
  • workBuffer != nullptr.
  • workBuffer is aligned to nn::os::MemoryPageSize.
  • workBufferSize is an integer multiple of nn::os::MemoryPageSize.
  • workBufferSize >= nn::audio::GetAudioRendererWorkBufferSize(parameter).
Postcondition
  • Stores a valid handle to *outHandle.
  • *pOutSystemEvent is initialized.
  • nn::audio::GetAudioRendererState(handle) == nn::audio::AudioRendererState_Stopped.

Details
pOutSystemEvent is initialized to nn::os::EventClearMode_AutoClear. pOutSystemEvent is in the signaled state each time the audio renderer begins rendering an audio frame.

Warning
The nn::os::SystemEvent class object specified for pOutSystemEvent must call nn::os::DestroySystemEvent( pOutSystemEvent->GetBase() ) after nn::audio::CloseAudioRenderer() has been called. Failure to make this call could cause the application to stop responding.

AudioRenderer is in the stopped state immediately after this function is called.

The audio coprocessor executes rendering if nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_AudioCoprocessor is specified as the device for rendering. The type of coprocessor that executes the processing depends on the platform. If nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu, rendering will be executed in the CPU. The type of thread that executes the processing depends on the platform and specified rendering mode.

NX Platform Only:
The following combinations of devices and rendering modes may be used for rendering on the NX platform.
  • nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_AudioCoprocessor and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution Rendering is executed in the audio DSP. Rendering is executed automatically within the system.
  • nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_ManualExecution The nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() function is called and rendering is executed in the thread. Rendering will not be executed unless nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() is called.
Windows Platform Only:
The following combinations of devices and rendering modes may be used for rendering processing on the Windows platform. - nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution      Rendering is executed automatically by the thread created within the library. - nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu and nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_ManualExecution      The nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() function is called and rendering is executed in the thread. Rendering will not be executed unless nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() is called.

◆ CloseAudioRenderer()

void nn::audio::CloseAudioRenderer ( AudioRendererHandle  handle)
noexcept

Frees the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleAudio renderer handle.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.
  • nn::audio::GetAudioRendererState(handle) == nn::audio::AudioRendererState_Stopped.
Postcondition
  • handle becomes invalid.

Details
After control returns from this function, AudioRenderer does not access the working buffer.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

noexcept

Starts rendering with the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleAudio renderer handle.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.

  • handle is a valid object.

◆ StopAudioRenderer()

void nn::audio::StopAudioRenderer ( AudioRendererHandle  handle)
noexcept

Stops rendering with the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleAudio renderer handle.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.
  • nn::audio::GetAudioRendererState(handle) == nn::audio::AudioRendererState_Started.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetAudioRendererState(handle) == nn::audio::AudioRendererState_Stopped.

Details
Even when this function is called, the internal parameters remain as they are. When you call nn::audio::StartAudioRenderer() again, playback resumes according to the stored parameters.

Examples
