◆ RequestUpdateAudioRenderer()

Result nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer ( AudioRendererHandle  handle,
const AudioRendererConfig *  pConfig 
)
noexcept

Updates the parameters for Voice objects bound to the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleAudio renderer handle.
[in]pConfigAudioRendererConfig.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultInvalidUpdateInfo must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultNoMemoryPoolEntry must be handled.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.

Details
All settings associated with the audio renderer are applied to the audio renderer that has already been obtained with the specified handle.

With nn::audio, calling this function causes the "data handled by the audio renderer" to be applied to the audio renderer. Any changes made to the data handled by the audio renderer are not applied until this function is called. "Data handled by the audio renderer" includes the following types.

  • VoiceType
  • WaveBuffer
  • SubMixType
  • FinalMixType
  • SplitterType
  • CircularBufferSinkType
  • DeviceSinkType
  • MemoryPoolType
  • Various effects (BufferMixerType, DelayType, ReverbType, AuxType)

In addition to the operations on these types, the data handled by the audio renderer also includes information set by functions like nn::audio::SetPerformanceFrameBuffer() that take AudioRendererConfig as an argument. Calling this function applies such information to the audio renderer.

If nn::audio::ResultInvalidUpdateInfo is returned, the content of the passed pConfig is in an invalid state. When you call this function, because it is not thread-safe and can inadvertently corrupt the region referenced by pConfig, determine whether access to data managed by the audio renderer has been prohibited.

Note
This function is not thread-safe. During this function call, do not perform any prohibited operations linked to the "data handled by the audio renderer" for any audio renderers specified by handle or pConfig.

This function cannot be called on the same handle using multiple AudioRendererConfig instances. If nn::os::SystemEvent is specified when the nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer() function is called, this function is in the non-signaled state when it is called.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ GetAudioRendererWorkBufferSize()

size_t nn::audio::GetAudioRendererWorkBufferSize ( const AudioRendererParameter &  parameter)
noexcept

Gets the size of the working buffer required to open an audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]parameterParameters.
Returns
Returns the working buffer size.
Precondition
  • nn::audio::IsValidAudioRendererParameter(parameter) == true.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetAudioRendererRenderingTimeLimit()

Result nn::audio::SetAudioRendererRenderingTimeLimit ( AudioRendererHandle  handle,
int  limitPercent 
)
noexcept

Sets the upper limit on the rendering time allocated to the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleThe audio renderer handle.
[in]limitPercentThe upper limit on the rendering time allocated to the audio renderer. The unit is percent.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.
  • limitPercent >= 0 && limitPercent <= 100.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetAudioRendererRenderingTimeLimit(handle) == limitPercent.

Details
Specifies as a percentage the upper limit on the rendering time allocated to the audio renderer. The default is 100%. The rendering time is the time used for the rendering of audio by the audio renderer. For example, assume that three milliseconds have been allocated for rendering in each audio frame and the upper limit for the rendering time has been set to 50%. In this case, there is a time limit of 1.5 milliseconds for rendering in each audio frame. If the rendering time exceeds the limit, frames will be dropped. The value that can be specified depends on the platform. If an unsupported value has been specified, the function will return nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed.

NX Platform Only:
On the NX platform, limitPercent can be set to any value between and 0% and 100%. The audio renderer performs rendering in the audio DSP. This audio DSP is shared with some of the encoding and decoding processes of the nn::codec namespace. These encoding and decoding processes on the audio DSP have lower priority than the audio renderer, so depending on the processing load of the audio renderer, sometimes encoding and decoding may not take place. Use this function to limit the rendering time of the audio renderer if you need to make sure that encoding and decoding will be performed on the audio DSP even when the audio renderer is operating. For more information about the DSP resources assigned to the application, see DSP Resource Limitations.
The encoding and decoding processes of the nn::codec namespace use the audio DSP as follows.
  • nn::codec::HardwareOpusDecoder
Windows Platform Only:
On the Windows platform, limitPercent can be set to any value between and 0% and 100%. However, the specified value does not indicate the actual upper limit on rendering time.
Note
This function is not thread-safe. During this function call, do not perform any operations on "data handled by the audio renderer" linked to the audio renderer specified by handle.

◆ GetAudioRendererRenderingTimeLimit()

int nn::audio::GetAudioRendererRenderingTimeLimit ( AudioRendererHandle  handle)
noexcept

Gets the upper limit on the rendering time allocated to the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleThe audio renderer handle.
Returns
Returns the upper limit on the rendering time allocated to the audio renderer. The unit is percent.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.

Details
Gets a percentage value representing the upper limit on the rendering time allocated to the audio renderer. For more information about the rendering time, see nn::audio::SetAudioRendererRenderingTimeLimit().

Note
This function is not thread-safe. During this function call, do not perform any operations on "data handled by the audio renderer" linked to the audio renderer specified by handle.

◆ ExecuteAudioRendererRendering()

Result nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering ( AudioRendererHandle  handle)
noexcept

Executes rendering processing with the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleThe audio renderer handle.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.

Details
When calling nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer() and the rendering mode is set to nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_ManualExecution (execute rendering manually), the audio renderer executes audio rendering for one frame. If nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution (execute rendering automatically), rendering is not executed and nn::audio::ResultNotSupported() is returned.

When calling nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer() and specifying nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_Cpu as the rendering device, rendering is executed in the thread that called this function. This function does not return control to caller until it has finished rendering processing. This function requires processing time depending on the content of the requested rendering processing.

In the current release, audio renderers selected nn::audio::AudioRendererRenderingDevice_AudioCoprocessor are not supported as devices for rendering.

Audio renderers using manual rendering processing may not use the following features.

  • Voice drop
  • Specifying the upper limit on the rendering time allocated to the audio renderer
  • Using nn::audio::DeviceSinkType to play back the rendering results
    • You can get the rendering results by using nn::audio::CircularBufferSinkType. For more information, see nn::audio::CircularBufferSinkType.

If nn::os::SystemEvent is specified when the nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer() function is called, this function will change to the signaled state after rendering processing is complete.

Note
This function is thread-safe except when used simultaneously with the following functions.
  • nn::audio::StartAudioRenderer()
  • nn::audio::StopAudioRenderer()
  • nn::audio::CloseAudioRenderer()
  • nn::audio::GetAudioRendererState()
  • nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering()
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp.

◆ GetAudioRendererRenderingDevice()

AudioRendererRenderingDevice nn::audio::GetAudioRendererRenderingDevice ( AudioRendererHandle  handle)
noexcept

Gets the device used by the audio renderer for rendering.

Parameters
[in]handleThe audio renderer handle.
Returns
The device used by the audio renderer for rendering.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.

◆ GetAudioRendererExecutionMode()

AudioRendererExecutionMode nn::audio::GetAudioRendererExecutionMode ( AudioRendererHandle  handle)
noexcept

Gets the rendering mode of the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]handleThe audio renderer handle.
Returns
The rendering mode of the audio renderer.
Precondition
  • handle is a valid object.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxDelay()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxDelay ( nn::TimeSpan  delayTimeMax,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the size of the buffer required for using nn::audio::AuxDelayType.

Parameters
[in]delayTimeMaxThe maximum delay time that can be set with nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set for the nn::audio::AuxType using nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to specify for nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Returns
Returns the size of the buffer. [byte]
Precondition
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

◆ InitializeAuxDelay()

void nn::audio::InitializeAuxDelay ( AuxDelayType *  pOutDelay,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
nn::TimeSpan  delayTimeMax,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Initializes nn::audio::AuxDelayType.

Parameters
[out]pOutDelayPointer to the nn::audio::AuxDelayType to initialize.
[in]bufferThe work buffer to use with nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size, in bytes, of the work buffer specified for buffer.
[in]delayTimeMaxThe maximum delay time that can be set with nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate of the sample that will be the input for nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe number of channels in the sample that will be the input for nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxDelay(delayTimeMax, sampleRate, channelCountMax).
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
For sampleRate, specify the sample rate of the nn::audio::AuxType on which pOutDelay processes effects. Use nn::audio::GetAuxSampleRate() to get the sample rate. For channelCountMax, specify the maximum number of input channels that will be specified for pOutDelay.

◆ GetAuxDelayChannelCountMax()

int nn::audio::GetAuxDelayChannelCountMax ( const AuxDelayType *  pDelay)
noexcept

Gets the maximum number of channels that can be set for AuxDelayType.

Parameters
[in]pDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Returns
Returns the maximum value for the number of channels that can be set.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.

◆ GetAuxDelayInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetAuxDelayInputOutput ( int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
const AuxDelayType *  pDelay,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the input/output channel indexes for nn::audio::AuxDelayType.

Parameters
[out]outInputThe array from where to get the indexes of the input channels set in pDelay.
[out]outOutputThe array from where to get the indexes of the output channels set in pDelay.
[out]pOutCountThe number of channel indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]pDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.

Details
Gets the array of channel indexes specified by nn::audio::SetAuxDelayInputOutput().

◆ SetAuxDelayInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetAuxDelayInputOutput ( AuxDelayType *  pOutDelay,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the input/output channel indexes for nn::audio::AuxDelayType

Parameters
[out]pOutDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]inputArray of input channel indexes to set in pOutDelay.
[in]outputArray of output channel indexes to set in pOutDelay
[in]countThe number of channel indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • pOutDelay is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
The input samples specified for inBuffer with the nn::audio::ProcessAuxDelay() function are expected to be block-interleaved. This function specifies the channels to which to apply the effect processing performed by nn::audio::ProcessAuxDelay().

The AuxDelayType input is processed on the assumption that input channels are in the following order. Be careful not to get the order wrong when you set input.

  • For 2 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight.
  • For 4 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight.
  • For 6 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight, FrontCenter, LowFrequency.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutDelay while calling this function.

◆ GetAuxDelayTimeMax()

nn::TimeSpan nn::audio::GetAuxDelayTimeMax ( const AuxDelayType *  pDelay)
noexcept

Gets the maximum delay time that can be set for AuxDelayType.

Parameters
[in]pDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Returns
Returns the maximum value that can be set for the delay time.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.

◆ GetAuxDelayParameters()

DelayParameterSet nn::audio::GetAuxDelayParameters ( const AuxDelayType *  pDelay)
noexcept

Gets the nn::audio::AuxDelayType effect parameters.

Parameters
[in]pDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Returns
outParameterSet Returns the effect parameters to set.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • pOutDelay is initialized.

◆ SetAuxDelayParameters()

void nn::audio::SetAuxDelayParameters ( AuxDelayType *  pOutDelay,
const DelayParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::AuxDelayType effect parameters.

Parameters
[out]pOutDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]pParameterSetThe effect parameter to set to nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • pOutDelay is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(0) <= pParameterSet->delayTime && pParameterSet->delayTime <= nn::audio::GetAuxDelayTimeMax().
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->inGain && pParameterSet->inGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->feedbackGain && pParameterSet->feedbackGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->dryGain && pParameterSet->dryGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->channelSpread && pParameterSet->channelSpread <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->lowPassAmount && pParameterSet->lowPassAmount <= 1.0f.

Details
For more information about the meanings of the parameters, see Delay Parameters in the Audio Effects documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutDelay while calling this function.

◆ ProcessAuxDelay()

void nn::audio::ProcessAuxDelay ( AuxDelayType *  pOutDelay,
int32_t *  outBuffer,
const int32_t *  inBuffer,
const uint32_t  samplesPerFrame 
)
noexcept

Executes the nn::audio::AuxDelayType effect process.

Parameters
[out]pOutDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
[in]inBufferBuffer that stores the sample data for implementing effects.
[out]outBufferBuffer that stores the effect processing results.
[in]samplesPerFrameNumber of samples per audio frame.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • pOutDelay is initialized.
  • inBuffer != nullptr.
  • outBuffer != nullptr.

Details
Call this function to execute the actual effect processing.

The contents of the buffer specified for inBuffer are subjected to effect processing, and the results are sent to outBuffer. The sample data in inBuffer is expected to be block interleaved. In other words, specify a buffer to the sample data obtained by the nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() function. A number of samples equivalent to one frame of one channel for block interleaving are set for samplePerFrame. If this value was obtained by nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer(), it will be identical to the AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount value.

This function is executed by the calling thread. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutDelay while calling this function.

◆ ResetAuxDelay()

void nn::audio::ResetAuxDelay ( AuxDelayType *  pOutDelay)
noexcept

Initializes the delay component of the nn::audio::AuxDelayType effect.

Parameters
[in]pOutDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • pOutDelay is initialized.

Details
Calling this function clears the state of the work buffer managed by nn::audio::AuxDelayType and then destroys and reinitializes the delay component. However, the effect parameters specified by the nn::audio::SetAuxDelayParameters() function are retained. Call this function to disable the prior effect processing input and start new effect processing.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutDelay while calling this function.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxI3dl2Reverb()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxI3dl2Reverb ( int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the size of the buffer required to use nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.

Parameters
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set for nn::audio::AuxType which uses nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to specify for nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
Returns
Returns the size of the buffer. [byte]
Precondition
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

◆ InitializeAuxI3dl2Reverb()

void nn::audio::InitializeAuxI3dl2Reverb ( AuxI3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Initializes nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbPointer to the nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType to initialize.
[in]bufferWork buffer used for nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size, in bytes, of the work buffer specified for buffer.
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate of the input sample for nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe number of channels of the input sample for nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxI3dl2Reverb(sampleRate, channelCountMax).
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
For sampleRate, specify the nn::audio::AuxType sample rate for which pOutReverb will perform effect processing. Use nn::audio::GetAuxSampleRate() to get the sample rate. For channelCountMax, specify the maximum number of input channels that will be specified for pOutReverb.

  • pReverb is initialized.

◆ SetAuxI3dl2ReverbInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetAuxI3dl2ReverbInputOutput ( AuxI3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the input/output channel indexes for nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
[in]inputArray of input channel indexes to set in pOutReverb.
[in]outputArray of output channel indexes to set in pOutReverb.
[in]countThe number of channel indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
The input samples specified for inBuffer using nn::audio::ProcessAuxI3dl2Reverb() are expected to be block interleaved. This function specifies the channels to which to apply the effects processed by nn::audio::ProcessAuxI3dl2Reverb().

The AuxI3dl2ReverbTyp input is processed on the assumption that the input channels are in the following order. Be careful not to get the order wrong when you set input.

  • For 2 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight.
  • For 4 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight.
  • For 6 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight, FrontCenter, LowFrequency.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ SetAuxI3dl2ReverbParameters()

void nn::audio::SetAuxI3dl2ReverbParameters ( AuxI3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
const I3dl2ReverbParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType effect parameters.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
[in]pParameterSetEffect parameters to set for nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->roomGain && pParameterSet->roomGain <= 0.0f.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->roomHfGain && pParameterSet->roomHfGain <= 0.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->lateReverbDecayTime && pParameterSet->lateReverbDecayTime <= 20.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->lateReverbHfDecayRatio && pParameterSet->lateReverbHfDecayRatio <= 2.0f.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->reflectionsGain && pParameterSet->reflectionsGain <= 1000.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->reflectionsDelayTime && pParameterSet->reflectionsDelayTime <= 0.3f.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->reverbGain && pParameterSet->reverbGain <= 2000.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->reverbDelayTime && pParameterSet->reverbDelayTime <= 0.1f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->reverbDiffusion && pParameterSet->reverbDiffusion <= 100.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->reverbDensity && pParameterSet->reverbDensity <= 100.0f.
  • 20.0f <= pParameterSet->hfReference && pParameterSet->hfReference <= 20000.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->dryGain && pParameterSet->dryGain <= 1.0f.

Details
For more information about the meanings of the parameters, see I3dl2 Reverb Parameters in the Audio Effects documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ GetAuxI3dl2ReverbParameters()

I3dl2ReverbParameterSet nn::audio::GetAuxI3dl2ReverbParameters ( const AuxI3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb)

◆ ProcessAuxI3dl2Reverb()

void nn::audio::ProcessAuxI3dl2Reverb ( AuxI3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
int32_t *  outBuffer,
const int32_t *  inBuffer,
const uint32_t  samplesPerFrame 
)
noexcept

Executes the nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType effect processing.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
[in]inBufferBuffer that stores the sample data for implementing effects.
[out]outBufferBuffer that stores the effect processing results.
[in]samplesPerFrameNumber of samples per audio frame.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • inBuffer != nullptr.
  • outBuffer != nullptr.

Details
Call this function to execute the actual effect processing.

The contents of the buffer specified for inBuffer are subjected to effect processing, and the results are sent to outBuffer. The sample data in inBuffer is expected to be block interleaved. In other words, specify a buffer to the sample data obtained by the nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() function. A number of samples equivalent to one frame of one channel for block interleaving are set for samplePerFrame. If this value was obtained by nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer(), it will be identical to the AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount value.

This function is executed by the calling thread. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ ResetAuxI3dl2Reverb()

void nn::audio::ResetAuxI3dl2Reverb ( AuxI3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb)
noexcept

Initializes the reverberation element of the nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType effect.

Parameters
[in]pOutReverbPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.

Details
Calling this function clears the state of the work buffer managed by nn::audio::AuxI3dl2ReverbType, destroys the reverberation element, and then initializes. However, the effect parameters specified by the nn::audio::SetAuxI3dl2ReverbParameters() function are retained. Call this function to disable the prior effect processing input and start new effect processing.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ InitializeAuxLightLimiter()

void nn::audio::InitializeAuxLightLimiter ( AuxLightLimiterType *  pOutEffect,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
nn::TimeSpan  lookAheadTimeMax,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Initializes nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutEffectPointer to the nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType to initialize.
[in]bufferWork buffer used for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size, in bytes, of the work buffer specified for buffer.
[in]lookAheadTimeMaxMaximum look-ahead time that can be set with nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]sampleRateSample rate of the sample entered in nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels of the input sample for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
Precondition
  • pOutEffect != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxLightLimiter(lookAheadTimeMax, sampleRate, channelCountMax).
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= lookAheadTimeMax && lookAheadTimeMax < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Postcondition
  • pOutEffect is initialized.

Details
For sampleRate, specify the sample rate of the nn::audio::AuxType to be the subject of the effect processing performed by pOutEffect. Use nn::audio::GetAuxSampleRate() to get the sample rate. For channelCountMax, specify the maximum number of input channels to specify for pOutEffect.

◆ SetAuxLightLimiterInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetAuxLightLimiterInputOutput ( AuxLightLimiterType *  pOutEffect,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the input and output channel indexes for nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType.

Parameters

[in]outputArray of indexes of the output channels to set for pOutEffect.
[in]countThe number of channel indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pOutEffect != nullptr.
  • pOutEffect is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
The input samples specified for inBuffer using nn::audio::ProcessAuxLimiter() are expected to be block interleaved. This function specifies the channels to which to apply the effect processing performed by nn::audio::ProcessAuxLightLimiter().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutEffect during the call to this function.

◆ SetAuxLightLimiterParameters()

void nn::audio::SetAuxLightLimiterParameters ( AuxLightLimiterType *  pOutEffect,
const LightLimiterParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType effect parameters.

Parameters
[in]pOutEffectPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType.
[in]pParameterSetThe effect parameters set for nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType.
Precondition
  • pOutEffect != nullptr.
  • pOutEffect is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= pParameterSet->attackTime && pParameterSet->attackTime < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= pParameterSet->releaseTime && pParameterSet->releaseTime < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= pParameterSet->lookAheadTime && pParameterSet->lookAheadTime <= nn::audio::GetAuxLightLimiterLookAheadTimeMax(pOutEffect).
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->threshold.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->inputGain.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->outputGain.

◆ ProcessAuxLightLimiter()

void nn::audio::ProcessAuxLightLimiter ( AuxLightLimiterType *  pOutEffect,
int32_t *  outBuffer,
const int32_t *  inBuffer,
const uint32_t  samplesPerFrame 
)
noexcept

Processes the nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType effect.

Parameters
[out]pOutEffectPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType.
[out]outBufferBuffer that stores the effect processing results.
[in]inBufferBuffer that stores the sample data for implementing effects.
[in]samplesPerFrameNumber of samples per audio frame.
Precondition
  • pOutEffect != nullptr.
  • pOutEffect is initialized.
  • inBuffer != nullptr.
  • outBuffer != nullptr.

Details
Call this function to execute the actual effect processing.

The contents of the buffer specified for inBuffer are subjected to effect processing, and the results are sent to outBuffer. The sample data in inBuffer is expected to be block interleaved. In other words, specify a buffer to the sample data obtained by the nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() function. A number of samples equivalent to one frame of one channel for block interleaving are set for samplePerFrame. If this value was obtained by nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer(), it will be identical to the AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount value.

This function is executed by the calling thread. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutEffect during the call to this function.

◆ ResetAuxLightLimiter()

void nn::audio::ResetAuxLightLimiter ( AuxLightLimiterType *  pOutEffect)
noexcept

Initializes the internal state of the nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType effect.

Parameters
[in]pOutEffectPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType.
Precondition
  • pOutEffect != nullptr.
  • pOutEffect is initialized.

Details
Calling this function clears and reinitializes the state of the work buffer managed by nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType. However, the effect parameters set by the nn::audio::AuxLightLimiterType() function are retained. Call this function to disable the prior effect processing input and start new effect processing.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutEffect during the call to this function.

◆ InitializeAuxLimiter()

void nn::audio::InitializeAuxLimiter ( AuxLimiterType *  pOutLimiter,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
nn::TimeSpan  attackTimeMax,
nn::TimeSpan  releaseTimeMax,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Initializes nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutLimiterPointer to the nn::audio::AuxLimiterType to initialize.
[in]bufferWork buffer used for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size, in bytes, of the work buffer specified for buffer.
[in]attackTimeMaxMaximum attack time that can be set with nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]releaseTimeMaxMaximum release time that can be set with nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]sampleRateSample rate of the sample entered in nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels of the input sample for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
Precondition
  • pOutLimiter != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxLimiter "nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxLimiter(attackTime, sampleRate, channelCountMax)"
  • (nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(0)" < attackTimeMax) && (attackTimeMax <= nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(300)").
  • (nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(0)" < releaseTimeMax) && (releaseTimeMax <= nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(300)").
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
For sampleRate, specify the nn::audio::AuxType sample rate for which pOutLimiter will perform effect processing. Use nn::audio::GetAuxSampleRate() to get the sample rate. For channelCountMax, specify the maximum number of input channels that will be specified for pOutLimiter.

◆ SetAuxLimiterInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetAuxLimiterInputOutput ( AuxLimiterType *  pLimiter,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the input/output channel index for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.

Parameters
[out]pLimiterPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]inputThe array of the index of the input channel set for the pOutLimiter.
[in]outputThe array of the index of the output channel set for pOutLimiter.
[in]countThe number of channel indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pLimiter != nullptr.
  • pLimiter is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
The input samples specified for inBuffer using nn::audio::ProcessAuxLimiter() are expected to be block interleaved. This function specifies the channel to which to apply the effect processing performed by nn::audio::ProcessAuxLimiter().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pLimiter while calling this function.

◆ GetAuxLimiterInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetAuxLimiterInputOutput ( int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
const AuxLimiterType *  pLimiter,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the input/output channel index for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.

Parameters
[out]outInputThe array for which to get the index of the input channels set for pLimiter.
[out]outOutputThe array for which to get the index of the output channels set for pLimiter.
[out]pOutCountThe number of channel indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]pLimiterPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pLimiter != nullptr.
  • pLimiter is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.

Details
Gets the channel index array specified by nn::audio::SetAuxLimiterInputOutput().

◆ SetAuxLimiterParameters()

void nn::audio::SetAuxLimiterParameters ( AuxLimiterType *  pOutLimiter,
const LimiterParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Gets the nn::audio::AuxLimiterType effect parameters.

Parameters
[in]pOutLimiterPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]pParameterSetEffect parameters to set for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
Precondition
  • pOutLimiter != nullptr.
  • pOutLimiter is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(0)" < pLimiterParamSet->attackTime && pLimiterParamSet->attackTime <= GetAuxLimiterAttackTimeMax "GetAuxLimiterAttackTimeMax(pOutLimiter)".
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(0)" < pLimiterParamSet->releaseTime && pLimiterParamSet->releaseTime <= GetAuxLimiterReleaseTimeMax "GetAuxLimiterReleaseTimeMax(pOutLimiter)".
  • 0 < pLimiterParamSet->threshold <= std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max().

Details
pParameterSet->threshold is a value corresponding to the int32_t type audio sample value handled by AuxEffect. For example, if you specify 32767, nn::audio::AuxLimiterType works to make sure that the amplitude does not exceed this value.

◆ GetAuxLimiterParameters()

LimiterParameterSet nn::audio::GetAuxLimiterParameters ( const AuxLimiterType *  pLimiter)
noexcept

Gets the nn::audio::AuxLimiterType effect parameters.

Parameters
[in]pLimiterPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
Returns
Returns the effect parameters.
Precondition
  • pOutLimiter != nullptr.
  • pOutLimiter is initialized.

◆ GetAuxLimiterChannelCountMax()

Returns
Returns the maximum value for the number of channels that can be set.

  • pLimiter != nullptr.
  • pLimiter is initialized.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxLimiter()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxLimiter ( nn::TimeSpan  attackTimeMax,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the size of the buffer required to use nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.

Parameters
[in]attackTimeMaxMaximum attack time that can be set with nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set for nn::audio::AuxType which uses nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to specify for nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
Returns
Returns the size of the buffer. [byte]
Precondition
  • (nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(0)" < attackTimeMax) && (attackTimeMax <= nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(300)").
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

◆ ProcessAuxLimiter()

void nn::audio::ProcessAuxLimiter ( AuxLimiterType *  pOutLimiter,
int32_t *  outBuffer,
const int32_t *  inBuffer,
const uint32_t  samplesPerFrame 
)
noexcept

Executes the nn::audio::AuxLimiterType effect processing.

Parameters
[out]pOutLimiterPointer to the initialized nn::audio::AuxLimiterType.
[out]outBufferBuffer that stores the effect processing results.
[in]inBufferBuffer that stores the sample data for implementing effects.
[in]samplesPerFrameNumber of samples per audio frame.
Precondition
  • pOutLimiter != nullptr.
  • pOutLimiter is initialized.
  • inBuffer != nullptr.
  • outBuffer != nullptr.

Details
Call this function to execute the actual effect processing.

The contents of the buffer specified for inBuffer are subjected to effect processing, and the results are sent to outBuffer. The sample data in inBuffer is expected to be block interleaved. In other words, specify a buffer to the sample data obtained by the nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() function. A number of samples equivalent to one frame of one channel for block interleaving are set for samplePerFrame. If this value was obtained by nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer(), it will be identical to the AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount value.

This function is executed by the calling thread. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutLimiter while calling this function.

◆ ResetAuxLimiter()

void nn::audio::ResetAuxLimiter ( AuxLimiterType *  pOutLimiter)
noexcept

Initializes the internal state of the nn::audio::AuxLimiterType effect.

Parameters
[in]pOutLimiterPointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxDelayType.
Precondition
  • pOutLimiter != nullptr.
  • pOutLimiter is initialized.

Details
Calling this function clears the state of the work buffer managed by nn::audio::AuxLimiterType and reinitializes. However, the effect parameters specified by the nn::audio::SetAuxLimiterParameters() function are retained. Call this function to disable the prior effect processing input and start new effect processing.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutLimiter while calling this function.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxReverb()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxReverb ( int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the size of buffer required for using nn::audio::AuxReverbType.

Parameters
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set for the nn::audio::AuxType that will use nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to specify for nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
Returns
Returns the size of the buffer. [byte]
Precondition
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

◆ InitializeAuxReverb()

void nn::audio::InitializeAuxReverb ( AuxReverbType *  pOutReverb,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Initializes nn::audio::AuxReverbType.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbPointer to the nn::audio::AuxReverbType to initialize.
[in]bufferThe work buffer to use with nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size, in bytes, of the work buffer specified for buffer.
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate for the samples that will serve as input to nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe number of channels for the samples that will serve as input to nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxReverb(sampleRate, channelCountMax).
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
For sampleRate, specify the nn::audio::AuxType sample rate for which pOutReverb will perform effect processing. Use nn::audio::GetAuxSampleRate() to get the sample rate. For channelCountMax, specify the maximum number of input channels that will be specified for pOutReverb.

◆ GetAuxReverbInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetAuxReverbInputOutput ( int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
const AuxReverbType *  pReverb,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the nn::audio::AuxReverbType input/output channel indexes.

Parameters
[out]outInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input channels set in pReverb.
[out]outOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output channels set in pReverb.
[out]pOutCountThe number of channel indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]pReverbA pointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.

Details
