◆ SetAuxReverbInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetAuxReverbInputOutput ( AuxReverbType *  pOutReverb,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::AuxReverbType input/output channel indexes.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbA pointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
[in]inputArray of input channel indexes to set in pOutReverb.
[in]outputArray of output channel indexes to set in pOutReverb.
[in]countThe number of channel indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
The input samples specified for inBuffer by the nn::audio::ProcessAuxReverb() function are expected to be block-interleaved. This function specifies the channels to which to apply the effect processing performed by nn::audio::ProcessAuxReverb().

The AuxReverbType input is processed on the assumption that input channels are in the following order. Be careful not to get the order wrong when you set input.

  • For 2 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight.
  • For 4 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight.
  • For 6 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight, FrontCenter, LowFrequency.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ GetAuxReverbParameters()

ReverbParameterSet nn::audio::GetAuxReverbParameters ( const AuxReverbType *  pReverb)

Gets the nn::audio::AuxReverbType effect parameter.

Parameters
[in]pReverbA pointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
Returns
outParameterSet Returns the effect parameters to set.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.

◆ SetAuxReverbParameters()

void nn::audio::SetAuxReverbParameters ( AuxReverbType *  pOutReverb,
const nn::audio::ReverbParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::AuxReverbType effect parameter.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbA pointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
[in]pParameterSetThe effect parameter to set to nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_SmallRoom || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_LargeRoom || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_Hall || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_Cavern || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_NoEarlyReflection
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->earlyGain && pParameterSet->earlyGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->predelayTimeMilliSeconds && pParameterSet->predelayTimeMilliSeconds <= 300.0f.
  • pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_Room || pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_Hall || pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_MetalCorridor || pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_Cavern || pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_MaximumDelay
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->lateGain && pParameterSet->lateGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->decayTimeSeconds && pParameterSet->decayTimeSeconds <= 20.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->highFreqDecayRatio && pParameterSet->highFreqDecayRatio <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->coloration && pParameterSet->coloration <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->reverbGain && pParameterSet->reverbGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->outGain && pParameterSet->outGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->dryGain && pParameterSet->dryGain <= 1.0f.

Details
For more information about the meanings of the parameters, see Reverb Parameters in the Audio Effects documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ ProcessAuxReverb()

void nn::audio::ProcessAuxReverb ( AuxReverbType *  pOutReverb,
int32_t *  outBuffer,
const int32_t *  inBuffer,
const uint32_t  samplesPerFrame 
)
noexcept

Executes the nn::audio::AuxReverbType effect processing.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbA pointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
[in]inBufferBuffer that stores the sample data for implementing effects.
[out]outBufferBuffer that stores the effect processing results.
[in]samplesPerFrameNumber of samples per audio frame.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • inBuffer != nullptr.
  • outBuffer != nullptr.

Details
Call this function to execute the actual effect processing.

The contents of the buffer specified for inBuffer are subjected to effect processing, and the results are sent to outBuffer. The sample data in inBuffer is expected to be block interleaved. In other words, specify a buffer to the sample data obtained by the nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() function. A number of samples equivalent to one frame of one channel for block interleaving are set for samplePerFrame. If this value was obtained by nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer(), it will be identical to the AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount value.

This function is executed by the calling thread. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ ResetAuxReverb()

void nn::audio::ResetAuxReverb ( AuxReverbType *  pOutReverb)
noexcept

Initializes the reverberation component of the nn::audio::AuxReverbType effect.

Parameters
[in]pOutReverbA pointer to an initialized nn::audio::AuxReverbType.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.

Details
Calling this function clears the state of the work buffer managed by nn::audio::AuxReverbType, destroys the reverberation component, and then re-initializes. The effect parameter specified by the nn::audio::SetAuxReverbParameters() is retained. Call this function to disable the prior effect processing input and start new effect processing.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ GetActiveAudioOutputDeviceName()

void nn::audio::GetActiveAudioOutputDeviceName ( AudioDeviceName *  pOutDeviceName)
noexcept

Gets the name of the device to which audio is currently being output.

Parameters
[in]pOutDeviceNameBuffer for getting the device name.
Precondition
  • pDeviceName != nullptr.

Details
Gets the name of the device to which audio is being output at the time that this function is called. You can determine the timing of a switch in the output line from one device to another by checking the nn::os::SystemEvent registered in nn::audio::AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForOutput(). If the audio output line is switched during the call to this function, the function will return the name of the device to which audio was output prior to the switch. By checking whether the nn::os::SystemEvent object registered in nn::audio::AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForOutput() has been signaled after this function has been called, you can determine whether the output line was changed during the call.

The name returned to pOutDeviceName must be a kind of name that can be obtained by the nn::audio::ListAudioOutputDeviceName() function. Note that the names that are returned will differ depending on the platform. For the specific lists of output devices that can be used with each platform, see the description in audio Libraryin NintendoSDK Documents.

NX Platform Only:
  • The processing for this function can take time, so after the device name has been obtained for the first time, we recommend calling this function only when the event is signaled.
Windows Platform Only:
  • This function is not supported in the Windows environment. Nothing is written to pOutDeviceName.
Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ GetActiveAudioDeviceName()

void nn::audio::GetActiveAudioDeviceName ( AudioDeviceName *  pOutDeviceName)
noexcept

This function is deprecated.

Please check the details for usage conditions and substitute functions.

Deprecated:
This function has been deprecated. We recommend using the nn::audio::GetActiveAudioOutputDeviceName() function instead.

Gets the name of the device to which audio is currently being output.

Parameters
[in]pOutDeviceNameBuffer for getting the device name.
Precondition
  • pDeviceName != nullptr.

Details
Gets the name of the device to which audio is being output at the time that this function is called. You can determine the timing of a switch in the output line from one device to another by checking the nn::os::SystemEvent registered in nn::audio::AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForOutput(). If the audio output line is switched during the call to this function, the function will return the name of the device to which audio was output prior to the switch. By checking whether the nn::os::SystemEvent object registered in nn::audio::AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForOutput() has been signaled after this function has been called, you can determine whether the output line was changed during the call.

The named returned to pOutDeviceName is always some name that can be obtained using nn::audio::ListAudioDeviceName(). Note that the names that are returned will differ depending on the platform.

NX Platform Only:
  • The processing for this function can take time, so after the device name has been obtained for the first time, we recommend calling this function only when the event is signaled.
Windows Platform Only:
  • This function is not supported in the Windows environment. Nothing is written to pOutDeviceName.

◆ AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForOutput()

nn::Result nn::audio::AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForOutput ( nn::os::SystemEvent *  pOutSystemEvent)
noexcept

Gets events that provide notification of the occurrence of audio output device events.

Parameters
[out]pOutSystemEventThe nn::os::SystemEvent signaled when the event occurs.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutSystemEvent != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
Postcondition
  • pOutSystemEvent is initialized.

Details
pOutSystemEvent is initialized as an event that is signaled when an audio output device event occurs. pOutSystemEvent is signaled every time an audio output device event occurs. The platform determines what kinds of event notifications can be received.

pOutSystemEvent is initialized to nn::os::EventClearMode_AutoClear.

You cannot call this function more than once. Calls after the first call return a failure and SystemEvent will not be initialized.

NX Platform Only:
  • In the NX environment, switches in the audio output line and changes in the number of output channels can be received as events. By waiting for this event to be signaled and then calling the nn::audio::GetActiveAudioOutputDeviceName() function, you can get the name of the device to which the audio output has been switched. Note, however, that there a possibility of the audio output line being switched again while nn::audio::GetActiveAudioOutputDeviceName() is getting the device name. For more information, see nn::audio::GetActiveAudioOutputDeviceName().
In the same way, by waiting for this event to be signaled and then calling the nn::audio::GetActiveAudioDeviceChannelCountForOutput() function, you can get the number of audio output channels after the change. Note, however, that there a possibility that the number of output channels will be changed again by a user operation while the nn::audio::GetActiveAudioDeviceChannelCountForOutput() function is getting the output channel count. For more information, see the description of nn::audio::GetActiveAudioDeviceChannelCountForOutput().
Windows Platform Only:
  • This function is not supported in the Windows environment. pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForInput()

nn::Result nn::audio::AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForInput ( nn::os::SystemEvent *  pOutSystemEvent)
noexcept

Gets events that provide notification of the occurrence of events of the device that is the source of the audio input.

Parameters
[out]pOutSystemEventThe nn::os::SystemEvent signaled when the event occurs.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOperationFailed must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutSystemEvent != nullptr.
  • pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.
Postcondition
  • pOutSystemEvent is initialized.

Details
pOutSystemEvent is initialized as an event that is signaled when an event occurs in the device that is the source of the audio input. pOutSystemEvent is signaled every time an event occurs in the device that is the source of the audio input. The platform determines what kinds of event notifications can be received.

pOutSystemEvent is initialized to nn::os::EventClearMode_AutoClear.

You cannot call this function more than once. Calls after the first call return a failure and SystemEvent will not be initialized.

NX Platform Only:
  • In the NX environment, the switching of the device that is the source of the audio input can be received as an event.
Windows Platform Only:
  • This function is not supported in the Windows environment. pOutSystemEvent is not initialized.

◆ GetActiveAudioDeviceChannelCountForOutput()

int nn::audio::GetActiveAudioDeviceChannelCountForOutput ( )
noexcept

Gets the number of channels output from the audio output device.

Returns
Returns the number of output channels.

Details
When this function is called, gets the number of channels output from the audio output device.

NX Platform Only:
  • In the NX environment, you can determine whether the number of channels has changed by checking whether the nn::os::SystemEvent object registered in nn::audio::AcquireAudioDeviceNotificationForOutput() has been signaled after this function was called. The processing for this function can take time, so after the channel count has been obtained for the first time, we recommend calling this function only when the event is signaled.
Windows Platform Only:
  • This function is not supported in the Windows environment. Always returns 0.
Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ ListAudioOutputDeviceName()

int nn::audio::ListAudioOutputDeviceName ( AudioDeviceName *  outDeviceNames,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the supported device list for the platform.

Parameters
[out]outDeviceNamesBuffer for getting the device name.
[in]countThe number of AudioDeviceName that can be obtained with outDeviceNames.
Returns
Returns the number of devices obtained by outDeviceNames.
Precondition
  • outDeviceNames != nullptr.
  • 0 <= count.
Postcondition
  • For a return value of n, device names are written from outDeviceNames[0] to outDeviceNames[n–1].

Details
The devices that are output by audio are different depending on the platform that executes the application. Of the devices connected to the platform executing the application, this function only gets the list of output devices that can be used by the NintendoSDK.

For the specific lists of output devices that can be used with each platform, see the description in audio Libraryin NintendoSDK Documents.

The outDeviceNames obtained by this function can be used to set the master output volume for each device using nn::audio::SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume().

Windows Platform Only:
  • In the Windows environment, this function returns the names and quantity of devices connected to the PC.
Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ ListAudioDeviceName()

int nn::audio::ListAudioDeviceName ( AudioDeviceName *  outDeviceNames,
int  count 
)
noexcept

This function is deprecated.

Please check the details for usage conditions and substitute functions.

Deprecated:
This function has been deprecated. We recommend using the nn::audio::ListAudioOutputDeviceName() function instead, which has the same features.

Gets the supported device list for the platform.

Parameters
[out]outDeviceNamesBuffer for getting the device name.
[in]countThe number of AudioDeviceName that can be obtained with outDeviceNames.
Returns
Returns the number of devices obtained by outDeviceNames.
Precondition
  • outDeviceNames != nullptr.
  • 0 <= count.
Postcondition
  • For a return value of n, device names are written from outDeviceNames[0] to outDeviceNames[n–1].

Details
The devices that are output by audio are different depending on the platform that executes the application. Of the devices connected to the platform executing the application, this function only gets the list of output devices that can be used by the NintendoSDK.

Windows Platform Only:
  • In the Windows environment, this function returns the names and quantity of devices connected to the PC.

◆ SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume()

void nn::audio::SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume ( const AudioDeviceName *  pDeviceName,
float  volume 
)
noexcept

Sets the volume for the output destination device.

Parameters
[in]pDeviceNameName of the device supported by the platform.
[in]volumeVolume value to be configured.
Precondition
  • pDeviceName != nullptr.
  • pDeviceName is included among the devices obtained by nn::audio::ListAudioDeviceName().
  • nn::audio::AudioDeviceOutputVolumeMin <= volume<= nn::audio::AudioDeviceOutputVolumeMax.
Postcondition
  • volume == nn::audio::GetAudioDeviceOutputVolume(pDeviceName).

Details
Sets the volume for each output destination device. If you have prepared audio output using nn::audio::OpenDefaultAudioOut(), or prepared a SinkType for audio output devices by specifying MainAudioOut in nn::audio::AddDeviceSink(), the audio is sent to the standard output destinations, based on the operating state of the application and the platform. This function provides the feature for setting the volume separately for these different output destinations.

The purpose of this function is to set the volume individually for each device, so do not use this function for device-independent volume controls. To configure device-independent volume settings, consider using the nn::audio::SetAudioOutVolume() function for audio output, and the nn::audio::SetFinalMixVolume() function for the audio renderer.

For pDeviceName, you can specify a device obtained by nn::audio::ListAudioOutputDeviceName(). For the specific lists of output devices that can be used for each platform, see Features > Audio Library section in NintendoSDK documents.

If multiple outputs such as audio renderer and audio out exist in the device specified by pDeviceName, it applies the volume to all of the input results.

If this function was not called even once, the initial value is set to 1.0f regardless of the device.

The volume settings for this function are only effective internally for the application that called the function. It does not affect the behavior of the system.

Windows Platform Only:
  • This function is not supported in the Windows environment. The call to this function always succeeds, but it does not alter the behavior of the application.
Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ GetAudioDeviceOutputVolume()

float nn::audio::GetAudioDeviceOutputVolume ( const AudioDeviceName *  pDeviceName)
noexcept

Gets the volume of the output destination device.

Parameters
[in]pDeviceNameName of the output destination device that gets the volume.
Returns
Returns the volume set for the device specified by pDeviceName.
Precondition
  • pDeviceName != nullptr.
  • pDeviceName is included among the devices obtained by nn::audio::ListAudioDeviceName().

Details
This function gets the volume for each output destination device set by nn::audio::SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume(). For more information, see nn::audio::SetAudioDeviceOutputVolume().

Windows Platform Only:
  • This function is not supported in the Windows environment. Always returns the default value of 1.0f.
Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ SetAudioDeviceMapping()

Result nn::audio::SetAudioDeviceMapping ( const char *  virtualName,
const AudioDeviceName *  pDeviceName 
)
noexcept

Assigns an actual audio device to a virtual audio device.

Parameters
[in]virtualNameVirtual audio device name.
[in]pDeviceNameActual audio device.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultNotFound must be handled.
  • nn::audio::ResultNotSupported must be handled.
Precondition
  • virtualName != nullptr.
  • pDeviceName != nullptr.

Details
This function can only be used in a PC development environment. ResultNotSupported is returned, and nothing else happens when this function is used in other environments.

The only value that can be set for virtualName is MainAudioOut. MainAudioOut functions as a 5.1 channel, 48-kHz audio output device. For pDeviceName, you can specify a device obtained by nn::audio::ListAudioOutputDeviceName(). If the number of channels for the device set with pDeviceName is not 5.1, audio output will be downmixed.

This function must be called before you use any nn::audio functions.

◆ AddBufferMixer() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddBufferMixer ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Adds BufferMixer to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[out]pBufferMixerAn uninitialized BufferMixer object.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that is adding pBufferMixer.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is uninitialized.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • pBufferMixer is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pBufferMixer are not configured.

Details
Adds the effect to mix to pFinalMix and initializes pBufferMixer. When this function is called, pBufferMixer is associated with pFinalMix, which makes it possible to perform effect operations on mix buffers managed by pFinalMix. Use pBufferMixer to perform all future operations on BufferMixerType. For a list of functions that can be used with BufferMixerType, see the BufferMixerType reference.

The mix buffers that can be used by pBufferMixer during the mix process are the mix buffers that are managed by the instance of FinalMixType specified for pFinalMix. For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.
nn::audio
Namespace for the audio library.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) If this warning message appears, use the nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer() function to check whether the affected instance of the effect has been removed from SubMixType or FinalMixType.

Immediately after an effect is added to pFinalMix, input/output mix buffers are not connected to pBufferMixer, and pBufferMixer transitions to an enabled state. Use the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput() function to specify the indices of the input/output mix buffers to which to apply the effect.

If the process for adding the effect fails and the function returns nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource, this usually indicates that the number of effects currently being used exceeds the maximum number of effects specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount. Delete one of the other effects or increase the number specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ AddBufferMixer() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddBufferMixer ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Adds BufferMixer to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[out]pBufferMixerAn uninitialized BufferMixer object.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to which the effect is being added.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is uninitialized.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • pBufferMixer is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pBufferMixer are not configured.

Details
Adds the effect to mix to pSubMix and initializes pBufferMixer. Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::AddBufferMixer(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, BufferMixerType* pBufferMixer, FinalMixType* pFinalMix.

◆ RemoveBufferMixer() [1/2]

void nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes BufferMixer from FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pBufferMixerThe BufferMixer added to pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that added pBufferMixer.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsBufferMixerRemovable(pBufferMixer) == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pBufferMixer is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. This function calls the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerEnabled() function to disable BufferMixer before removing that instance of BufferMixer and then calls the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to notify the audio renderer that BufferMixer has been disabled. After the notification is sent, it may take up to two audio frames for the audio renderer to completely stop using the effect. Use the nn::audio::IsBufferMixerRemovable() function to determine if an effect can be safely removed.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveBufferMixer() [2/2]

void nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes BufferMixer from SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pBufferMixerThe BufferMixer added to pSubMix.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType that added pBufferMixer.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsBufferMixerRemovable(pBufferMixer) == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
  • pBufferMixer is added to pSubMix.
Postcondition
  • pBufferMixer is uninitialized.

Details
Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, BufferMixerType* pBufferMixer, FinalMixType* pFinalMix).

◆ GetBufferMixerInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetBufferMixerInputOutput ( const BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the input/output relationship of the mixing process set in BufferMixer.

Parameters
[in]pBufferMixerThe initialized BufferMixer added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]outInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pBufferMixer.
[out]outOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output mix buffers set in pBufferMixer.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.

Details
Gets the input/output buffer relationship for the mix process set to the specified instance of BufferMixer. The indices of the source input mix buffers are stored in outInput, and the indices of the output mix buffers are stored in outOutput. outInput and outOutput can store up to count indices. The actual number of mix buffer indexes that are stored in outInput and outOutput is returned to pOutCount.

This function gets the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput() function. If this function is called on an instance of BufferMixer for which the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput() function has not been called, nothing will be stored in outInput and outOutput, and a value of 0 will be stored in pOutCount. If the number of input/output mix buffer indices set in pBufferMixer is greater than the value specified for count, outInput and outOutput will only store up to count of the mix buffer indices.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pBufferMixer while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ SetBufferMixerInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput ( BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the input/output relationship of the mixing process performed by BufferMixer.

Parameters
[out]pBufferMixerThe initialized BufferMixer added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers set in pBufferMixer.
[in]outputThe array of indexes of output mix buffers set in pBufferMixer.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • 0 < count && count <= MixBufferCountMax.

Details
Sets the input/output relationship of the mixing process performed by BufferMixer. The mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the input array are set as the input mix buffers, and the mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the output array are set as the output mix buffers. For example, if you specified input[] = {0, 1, 2} and output[] = {3, 4, 5} for the parameters, the following three types of input/output buffer relationships for SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers for which pBufferMixer was added would be configured, and the mix process would be performed according to this input/output buffer relationship.

  • Input mix buffer 0 is associated with output mix buffer 3.
  • Input mix buffer 1 is associated with output mix buffer 4.
  • Input mix buffer 2 is associated with output mix buffer 5.


The mix process is performed in the order in which the buffers are specified in input and output. In the preceding example, the buffers would be mixed in the specified numerical order. Volume can also be specified for the mix. Use the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerVolume() function to set the mix volume.

The same mix buffer indices can be specified for both input and output. For example, if you specified input[] = {0, 1, 2}, output[] = {0, 1, 2}, and count = 3 for the parameters, the volume would be set for mix buffers 0, 1, and 2, and those mix buffers would be written back to the same location.

Make sure that the mix buffer indices specified for input and output in this function are the indices of mix buffers managed by an instance of SubMixType or <FinalMixType for which pBufferMixer was added.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pBufferMixer while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ GetBufferMixerVolume()

float nn::audio::GetBufferMixerVolume ( const BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
int  index 
)
noexcept

Gets the volume setting for each input/output relationship of BufferMixer.

Parameters
[in]pBufferMixerThe initialized BufferMixer added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]indexIndex of the input/output relationship.
Returns
Returns the volume.
Precondition
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • 0 <= index && index <= nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax.

Details
Gets the volume set using the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerVolume() function. Returns an initial value of 0.0f for combinations of pBufferMixer and index for which the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerVolume() function has not been called.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pBufferMixer while calling this function.

◆ SetBufferMixerVolume()

void nn::audio::SetBufferMixerVolume ( BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
int  index,
float  volume 
)
noexcept

Sets the volume for each input/output relationship of BufferMixer.

Parameters
[in]pBufferMixerThe initialized BufferMixer added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]indexIndex of the input/output relationship.
[in]volumeThe volume to set for the mix process specified by index.
Precondition
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
  • 0 <= index && index <= nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax.
  • 0.0f <= volume && volume <= 2.0f.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetBufferMixerVolume(pBufferMixer, index) == volume.

Details
Sets the volume for the mix processes corresponding to the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput() function. index is an index in the input and output arrays specified in the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput() function.

For example, if you specified input[] = {0, 1, 2}, output[] = {3, 4, 5}, and count = 3 to define the input/output buffer relationship when calling the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput() function on an instance of BufferMixer, and then specified index = 0 and volume = 0.5f when calling the nn::audio::SetBufferMixerVolume() function, mix buffer 0 would be mixed into mix buffer 3 with a volume setting of 0.5f.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pBufferMixer while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ IsBufferMixerEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsBufferMixerEnabled ( const BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer)
noexcept

Determines whether BufferMixer is enabled.

Parameters
[in]pBufferMixerBufferMixer.
Returns
Returns true if enabled, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pBufferMixer while calling this function.

◆ SetBufferMixerEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetBufferMixerEnabled ( BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Sets whether a BufferMixer is enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]pBufferMixerBufferMixer.
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Precondition
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::IsBufferMixerEnabled(pBufferMixer) == enable.

Details
When a BufferMixer is disabled, all of the mix processes for the input/output buffer relationship configured for pBufferMixer are terminated.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pBufferMixer while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ IsBufferMixerRemovable()

bool nn::audio::IsBufferMixerRemovable ( const BufferMixerType *  pBufferMixer)
noexcept

Determines whether BufferMixer can be safely removed.

Parameters
[in]pBufferMixerBufferMixer.
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pBufferMixer != nullptr.
  • pBufferMixer is initialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before calling the nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer() function, use this function to check whether the instance of BufferMixer that you want to remove is no longer being used. Note the following.

  • The use of effects is not stopped immediately after disabling them using theSetBufferMixerEnabled() function.
  • After an effect is disabled using the SetBufferMixerEnable() function, it can take up to two audio frames for calls to the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to be completed.
  • Do not call the RemoveBufferMixer() function during this time.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pBufferMixer while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForDelay()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForDelay ( nn::TimeSpan  delayTimeMax,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the work buffer size required for the renderer to use DelayType.

Parameters
[in]delayTimeMaxThe maximum delay time that can be set with DelayType.
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set in the SubMixType or FinalMixType that is adding DelayType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to use.
Returns
Returns the buffer size required for using DelayType.
Precondition
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
The required memory for DelayType depends on the values configured for the delay time, sampling rate, and number of channels. Use this function to calculate the required memory for DelayType based on the specified values for these parameters.

For sampleRate, specify the sampling rate set for the instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType to which DelayType was added using the nn::audio::AddDelay() function. Use the nn::audio::GetSubMixSampleRate() function to get the sampling rate for SubMixType, and use the nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate() function to get the sampling rate for FinalMixType.

For channelCountMax, specify the number of channels supported by DelayType.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ AddDelay() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddDelay ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
DelayType *  pDelay,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
nn::TimeSpan  delayTimeMax,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a DelayType object to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[out]pDelayAn uninitialized DelayType object.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory region to use for DelayType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMix to which the effect is being added.
[in]delayTimeMaxValue for the maximum delay time that can be set.
[in]channelCountMaxValue for the maximum number of channels that can be set.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForDelay(delayTimeMax, sampleRate, channelCountMax). (sampleRate is the sample rate set in pFinalMix. You can get it using nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate().)
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Postcondition
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • pDelay is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pDelay are not configured.

Details
Adds the DelayType effect, which plays back the input audio with a delay, to pFinalMix and initializes pDelay. When this function is called, pDelay is associated with pFinalMix, which makes it possible to perform effect operations on mix buffers managed by pFinalMix. Use pDelay to perform all future operations on DelayType. For a list of functions that can be used with DelayType, see the DelayType reference.

DelayType requires a work buffer to process the effect. Allocate a buffer that is at least equal to the value returned by the nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForDelay() in size, and specify that buffer and its size for buffer and bufferSize. The memory region specified for buffer must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType. Also, the instance of nn::audio::MemoryPoolType that contains the memory region specified for buffer must be in the attached state.

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) For delayTimeMax, specify the maximum delay time that can be set while pDelay is being used. After doing this, you can use the nn::audio::SetDelayTime() function at any time to specify a delay time less than or equal to delayTimeMax. However, after changing the delay time setting, you must call the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() to notify the audio renderer of the change.

For channelCountMax, specify the number of channels supported by DelayType. The maximum number of channels that can be specified is the value specified for count in the nn::audio::SetDelayInputOutput() function. For more information, see nn::audio::SetDelayInputOutput().

Immediately after a delay is added, pDelay is not connected to the input/output mix buffers, and pDelay transitions to an enabled state. Use the nn::audio::SetDelayInputOutput() function to specify the indices of the input/output mix buffers to which to apply the effect.

If the process for adding the effect fails and the function returns nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource, this usually indicates that the number of effects currently being used exceeds the maximum number of effects specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount. Delete one of the other effects or increase the number specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ AddDelay() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddDelay ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
DelayType *  pDelay,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
SubMixType *  pSubMix,
nn::TimeSpan  delayTimeMax,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a DelayType object to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[out]pDelayAn uninitialized DelayType object.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory region to use for DelayType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMix to which the effect is being added.
[in]delayTimeMaxValue for the maximum delay time that can be set.
[in]channelCountMaxValue for the maximum number of channels that can be set.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForDelay (delayTimeMax, GetSubMixSampleRate(pSubMix), channelCountMax).
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Postcondition
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • pDelay is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pDelay are not configured.

Details
Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::AddDelay(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, DelayType* pDelay, void* buffer, size_t bufferSize, FinalMixType* pFinalMix, nn::TimeSpan delayTimeMax, int channelCountMax).

◆ RemoveDelay() [1/2]

void * nn::audio::RemoveDelay ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
DelayType *  pDelay,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a DelayType object from FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pDelayThe DelayType added to pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that removes pDelay.
Returns
Returns the memory used for DelayType. (The memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddDelay().)
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsDelayRemovable(pDelay) == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pDelay is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. This function calls the nn::audio::SetDelayEnabled() function to disable DelayType before removing that instance of DelayType and then calls the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to notify the audio renderer that DelayType has been disabled. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, use the nn::audio::IsDelayRemovable() function to determine whether the audio renderer has completely stopped using the effect and the delay can be safely removed. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, it may take up to two audio frames for the audio renderer to completely stop using the effect.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveDelay() [2/2]

void * nn::audio::RemoveDelay ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
DelayType *  pDelay,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a DelayType object from SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pDelayThe DelayType object added to pSubMix.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType that removes pDelay.
Returns
Returns the memory used for DelayType. (The memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddDelay().)
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsDelayRemovable(pDelay) == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pDelay is uninitialized.

Details
Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::RemoveDelay(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, DelayType* pDelay, FinalMixType* pFinalMix).

◆ GetDelayInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetDelayInputOutput ( const DelayType *  pDelay,
int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the indexes of the DelayType input/output mix buffers.

Parameters
[in]pDelayThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]outInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pDelay.
[out]outOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output mix buffers set in pDelay.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.
Postcondition
  • Information for the number of indexes specified in pOutCount is written to outInput and outOutput.

Details
Gets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified DelayType effect. The indices of the source input mix buffers are stored in outInput, and the indices of the output mix buffers are stored in outOutput. outInput and outOutput can store up to count indices. The actual number of mix buffer indexes that are stored in outInput and outOutput is returned to pOutCount.

This function gets the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetDelayInputOutput() function. If this function is called on an instance of DelayType for which the nn::audio::SetDelayInputOutput() function has not yet been called, nothing will be stored in outInput and outOutput, and a value of 0 will be stored in pOutCount. Also see the description of the nn::audio::AddDelay() function. If the number of channels set to pDelay is greater than the value specified for count, outInput and outOutput will only store up to count of the mix buffer indices.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pDelay while calling this function.

◆ SetDelayInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetDelayInputOutput ( DelayType *  pDelay,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the DelayType input/output mix buffer indexes.

Parameters
[out]pDelayThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers to set in pDelay.
[in]outputThe array of indexes of output mix buffers to set in pDelay.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • count <= nn::audio::GetDelayChannelCountMax(pDelay).
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
Sets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified DelayType effect. The mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the input array are set as the input mix buffers, and the mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the output array are set as the output mix buffers. The same mix buffer indices can be specified for both input and output.

There are common rules for setting the input/output buffer relationship for each type of effect. For more information, see nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput().

The DelayType input is processed on the assumption that input channels are in the following order. Be careful not to get the order wrong when you set input.

  • For 2 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight.
  • For 4 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight.
  • For 6 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, FrontCenter, LowFrequency, RearLeft, RearRight.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pDelay while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ GetDelayLowPassAmount()

float nn::audio::GetDelayLowPassAmount ( const DelayType *  pDelay)
noexcept

Gets the low-pass filter parameter of the DelayType object.

Parameters
[in]pDelayThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns the low pass filter parameters.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pDelay while calling this function.

◆ SetDelayLowPassAmount()

void nn::audio::SetDelayLowPassAmount ( DelayType *  pDelay,
float  lowPassAmount 
)
noexcept

Sets the low-pass filter parameter of the DelayType object.

Parameters
[in]pDelayThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]lowPassAmountLow pass filter parameter.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.
  • 0.0f <= lowPassAmount && lowPassAmount <= 1.0f.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetDelayLowPassAmount(pDelay) == lowPassAmount.

Details
The following low-pass filter (LPF) transfer function process is applied during a delay effect.

LPF(z) = b0 / (1 – a1 * z^{-1})

a1 and b0 are calculated using the following equations.

a1 = 0.95 * lowPassAmount b0 = 1.0 – a1

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pDelay while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ IsDelayEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsDelayEnabled ( const DelayType *  pDelay)
noexcept

Determines whether the DelayType object is enabled.

Parameters
[in]pDelayThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if enabled, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pDelay while calling this function.

Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp.

◆ SetDelayEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetDelayEnabled ( DelayType *  pDelay,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Enables or disables the DelayType object.

Parameters
[in]pDelayThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::IsDelayEnabled(pDelay) == enable.

Details
When a delay effect is enabled, the effect is applied to the content of the input mix buffers and the resulting data is written to the output mix buffers according to the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetDelayInputOutput() function. When the effect is disabled, the contents of the input mix buffers are output as-is to the output mix buffers without applying the effect.

The values of parameters other than the enabled/disabled state are maintained before and after the SetDelayEnabled() function is called. However, if you specify true when calling the SetDelayEnabled() function, the internal state of pDelay is cleared. Any delay effect sounds that are still playing are cleared when you specify false.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pDelay while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ IsDelayRemovable()

bool nn::audio::IsDelayRemovable ( const DelayType *  pDelay)
noexcept

Determines whether DelayType object can be safely removed.

Parameters
[in]pDelayThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pDelay != nullptr.
  • pDelay is initialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before calling the nn::audio::RemoveDelay() function, use this function to check whether the instance of Delay that you want to remove is no longer being used. Note the following.

  • The use of effects does not stop immediately after disabling them using the nn::audio::SetDelayEnabled() function.
  • It can take up to two audio frames for the use of the effect to stop after the effect is disabled by nn::audio::SetDelayEnabled() and the call to nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() has completed.
  • Do not call the nn::audio::RemoveDelay() function during this time.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pDelay while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetDelayParameters()

DelayParameterSet nn::audio::GetDelayParameters ( const DelayType *  pDelay)
noexcept

Gets the nn::audio::DelayType effect parameters.

Parameters
[in]pDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::DelayType.
Returns
Returns the effect parameters.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • pOutDelay is initialized.

◆ SetDelayParameters()

void nn::audio::SetDelayParameters ( DelayType *  pOutDelay,
const DelayParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::DelayType effect parameters.

Parameters
[out]pOutDelayPointer to an initialized nn::audio::DelayType.
[in]pParameterSetThe effect parameter to set for nn::audio::DelayType.
Precondition
  • pOutDelay != nullptr.
  • pOutDelay is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMilliSeconds(0) <= pParameterSet->delayTime && pParameterSet->delayTime <= nn::audio::GetDelayTimeMax().
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->inGain && pParameterSet->inGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->feedbackGain && pParameterSet->feedbackGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->dryGain && pParameterSet->dryGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->channelSpread && pParameterSet->channelSpread <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->lowPassAmount && pParameterSet->lowPassAmount <= 1.0f.

Details
For more information about the meanings of the parameters, see Delay Parameters in the Audio Effects documentation. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutDelay while calling this function.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForReverb()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForReverb ( int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the work buffer size required for the renderer in order to use ReverbType.

Parameters
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set in the SubMixType or FinalMixType object that is adding ReverbType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to use.
Returns
Returns the buffer size required for using ReverbType.
Precondition
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
The required memory for ReverbType depends on the values configured for the sampling rate and number of channels. Use this function to calculate the required memory for ReverbType based on the specified values for these parameters.

For sampleRate, specify the sampling rate set for the instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType to which ReverbType was added using the nn::audio::AddReverb() function. Use the nn::audio::GetSubMixSampleRate() function to get the sampling rate for SubMixType, and use the nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate() function to get the sampling rate for FinalMixType.

For channelCountMax, specify the number of channels supported by ReverbType.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ AddReverb() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddReverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
ReverbType *  pReverb,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a ReverbType object to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pReverbAn uninitialized ReverbType object.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory region to use for ReverbType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that adds the effect.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels that can be set for pReverb.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForReverb(sampleRate, channelCountMax). (sampleRate is the sample rate set in pFinalMix. You can get it using nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate().)
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
Adds an instance of ReverbType to pFinalMix and initializes pReverb. The ReverbType effect emulates the echoing sounds that occur in closed spaces. When this function is called, pReverb is associated with pFinalMix, which makes it possible to perform effect operations on mix buffers managed by pFinalMix. All future operations on ReverbType should be performed via pReverb. For a list of functions that can be used with ReverbType, see the ReverbType reference.

ReverbType requires a work buffer to process the effect. Allocate a buffer that is at least equal to the value returned by the nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForReverb() in size, and specify that buffer and its size for buffer and bufferSize. The memory region specified for buffer must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType. Also, the instance of nn::audio::MemoryPoolType that contains the memory region specified for buffer must be in the attached state.

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) For channelCountMax, specify the number of channels supported by ReverbType. The maximum number of channels that can be specified here is the value specified for count in the nn::audio::SetReverbInputOutput() function. For more information, see nn::audio::SetReverbInputOutput().

Immediately after a reverb is added, pReverb is not connected to the input/output mix buffers, and pReverb transitions to an enabled state. Use the nn::audio::SetReverbInputOutput() function to specify the indices of the input/output mix buffers to which to apply the effect.

If the process for adding the effect fails and the function returns nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource, this usually indicates that the number of effects currently being used exceeds the maximum number of effects specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount. Delete one of the other effects or increase the number specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ AddReverb() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddReverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
ReverbType *  pReverb,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
SubMixType *  pSubMix,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a ReverbType object to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pReverbAn uninitialized ReverbType object.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory region to use for ReverbType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to which the effect is being added.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels that can be set for pReverb.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForReverb(GetSubMixSampleRate(pSubMix), channelCountMax).
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::AddReverb(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, ReverbType* pReverb, void* buffer, size_t bufferSize, FinalMixType* pFinalMix, int channelCount).

◆ RemoveReverb() [1/2]

void * nn::audio::RemoveReverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
ReverbType *  pReverb,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a ReverbType object from FinalMix.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pReverbThe ReverbType object added to pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that removes pReverb.
Returns
Returns the memory used for ReverbType. (The memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddReverb().)
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsReverbRemovable(pReverb) == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pReverb is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. This function calls the nn::audio::SetReverbEnabled() function to disable Reverb before removing that instance of Reverb and then calls the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to notify the audio renderer that Reverb has been disabled. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, use the nn::audio::IsReverbRemovable() function to determine whether the audio renderer has completely stopped using the effect and the reverb can be safely removed. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, it may take up to two audio frames for the audio renderer to completely stop using the effect.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveReverb() [2/2]

void * nn::audio::RemoveReverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
ReverbType *  pReverb,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a ReverbType object from SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pReverbThe ReverbType object added to pSubMix.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType that removes pReverb.
Returns
Returns the memory used for ReverbType. (The memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddReverb().)
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsReverbRemovable(pReverb) == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pReverb is uninitialized.

Details
Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::RemoveReverb(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, ReverbType* pReverb, FinalMixType* pFinalMix).

◆ GetReverbChannelCountMax()

Returns the maximum value for the number of channels that can be set.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

◆ SetReverbInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetReverbInputOutput ( ReverbType *  pReverb,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the ReverbType input/output mix buffer indexes.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers to set in pReverb.
[in]outputThe array of indexes of output mix buffers set in pReverb.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
Sets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified ReverbType effect. The mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the input array are set as the input mix buffers, and the mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the output array are set as the output mix buffers. The same mix buffer indices can be specified for both input and output.

There are common rules for setting the input/output buffer relationship for each type of effect. For more information, see nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput().

The ReverbType input is processed on the assumption that input channels are in the following order. Be careful not to get the order wrong when you set input.

  • For 2 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight.
  • For 4 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight.
  • For 6 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, FrontCenter, LowFrequency, RearLeft, RearRight.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ GetReverbInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetReverbInputOutput ( const ReverbType *  pReverb,
int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the indexes of the ReverbType input/output mix buffers.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized DelayType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]outInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pReverb.
[out]outOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output mix buffers set in pReverb.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.

Details
Gets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified ReverbType effect. The indices of the source input mix buffers are stored in outInput, and the indices of the output mix buffers are stored in outOutput. outInput and outOutput can store up to count indices. The actual number of mix buffer indexes that are stored in outInput and outOutput is returned to pOutCount.

This function gets the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetReverbInputOutput() function. If this function is called on an instance of ReverbType for which the nn::audio::SetReverbInputOutput() function has not yet been called, nothing will be stored in outInput and outOutput, and a value of 0 will be stored in pOutCount. Also see the description of the nn::audio::AddReverb() function. If the number of channels set to pReverb is greater than the value specified for count, outInput and outOutput will only store up to count of the mix buffer indices.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function.

◆ GetReverbEarlyMode()

ReverbType::EarlyMode nn::audio::GetReverbEarlyMode ( const ReverbType *  pReverb)
noexcept
