◆ SetReverbDryGain()

void nn::audio::SetReverbDryGain ( ReverbType *  pReverb,
float  gain 
)
noexcept

Sets the dry gain for the ReverbType object.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]gainDry gain.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • 0.0f <= gain <= 1.0f.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetReverbDryGain(pReverb) == gain.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ GetReverbParameters()

ReverbParameterSet nn::audio::GetReverbParameters ( const ReverbType *  pReverb)
noexcept

Gets the nn::audio::ReverbType effect parameter.

Parameters
[in]pReverbPointer to an initialized nn::audio::ReverbType.
Returns
Returns the effect parameters.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.

◆ SetReverbParameters()

void nn::audio::SetReverbParameters ( ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
const ReverbParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::ReverbType effect parameter.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbPointer to an initialized nn::audio::ReverbType.
[in]pParameterSetThe effect parameter to set for nn::audio::ReverbType.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_SmallRoom || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_LargeRoom || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_Hall || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_Cavern || pParameterSet->earlyMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::EarlyMode_NoEarlyReflection
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->earlyGain && pParameterSet->earlyGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->predelayTimeMilliSeconds && pParameterSet->predelayTimeMilliSeconds <= 300.0f.
  • pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_Hall || pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_MetalCorridor || pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_Cavern || pParameterSet->lateMode == nn::audio::ReverbType::LateMode_MaximumDelay
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->lateGain && pParameterSet->lateGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->decayTimeSeconds && pParameterSet->decayTimeSeconds <= 20.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->highFreqDecayRatio && pParameterSet->highFreqDecayRatio <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->coloration && pParameterSet->coloration <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->reverbGain && pParameterSet->reverbGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->outGain && pParameterSet->outGain <= 1.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->dryGain && pParameterSet->dryGain <= 1.0f.

Details
For more information about the meanings of the parameters, see Reverb Parameters in the Audio Effects documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

◆ IsReverbEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsReverbEnabled ( const ReverbType *  pReverb)
noexcept

Determines whether the ReverbType object is enabled.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if enabled, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function.

◆ SetReverbEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetReverbEnabled ( ReverbType *  pReverb,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Sets the ReverbType object to be enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::IsReverbEnabled(pReverb) == enable.

Details
When a reverb effect is enabled, the effect is applied to the content of the input mix buffers and the resulting data is written to the output mix buffers according to the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetReverbInputOutput() function. When the effect is disabled, the contents of the input mix buffers are output as-is to the output mix buffers without applying the effect.

The values of parameters other than the enabled/disabled state are maintained before and after the SetReverbEnabled() function is called. However, if you specify true when calling the SetReverbEnabled() function, the internal state of pReverb is cleared. If there is a reverberant sound even when false has been specified, that sound gets cleared.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ IsReverbRemovable()

bool nn::audio::IsReverbRemovable ( const ReverbType *  pReverb)
noexcept

Determines whether the ReverbType object can be safely removed.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before calling the nn::audio::RemoveReverb() function, use this function to check whether the instance of Reverb that you want to remove is no longer being used. Note the following.

  • The use of effects does not stop immediately after disabling them using the nn::audio::SetReverbEnabled() function.
  • After an effect is disabled using the nn::audio::SetReverbEnable() function, it can take up to two audio frames for calls to the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to be completed.
  • Do not call the nn::audio::RemoveReverb() function during this time.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer ( const AudioRendererParameter *  pParameter,
int  mixBufferFrameCount,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the work buffer size required for the renderer to use AuxType.

Parameters
[in]pParameterThe parameter used by the nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer() function to get the audio renderer belonging to the SubMixType or FinalMixType that is adding AuxType.
[in]mixBufferFrameCountThe number of audio frames to hold in AuxBuffer.
[in]channelCountMaxThe number of channels to store in AuxBuffer.
Returns
Returns the buffer size in bytes.
Precondition
  • pParameter != nullptr.
  • pParameter is initialized.
  • mixBufferFrameCount 1.
  • channelCountMax > 0.

Details
AuxType internally manages two buffers: SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer. SendBuffer is used to pass sample data from the audio renderer to the user, and ReturnBuffer is used in the reverse direction from the user to the audio renderer. This function returns the buffer size needed by these two buffers.

The audio renderer reads a certain number of samples from the ReturnBuffer per each audio frame. The number of samples = (AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount) × (the number for count specified by nn::audio::SetAuxInputOutput()). If insufficient samples were read, the output after effect processing may not be continuous, which may cause noise. Use nn::audio::WriteAuxReturnBuffer() periodically to write sample data to ReturnBuffer so that this number will not run low.

Passing a buffer of the size returned by this function to nn::audio::AddAux() internally buffers (mixBufferFrameCount × channelCountMax × AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount) number of samples. This allows samples for multiple audio frames corresponding to mixBufferFrameCount to be buffered. The user side gains some free time for effect processing. At the same time, the delay after being passed to SendBuffer and writing to ReturnBuffer, increases as the size of mixBufferFrameCount is increased.

The user must set an appropriate value to mixBufferFrameCount according to the needed effect processing.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ AddAux() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddAux ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
AuxType *  pAux,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
void *  pSendBuffer,
void *  pReturnBuffer,
size_t  sendReturnBufferSize 
)
noexcept

Adds an AuxType object to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[out]pAuxAn uninitialized AuxType object.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType to which the effect is being added.
[in]pSendBufferThe buffer used to store samples from the audio renderer.
[in]pReturnBufferThe buffer used to store the samples being returned to the audio renderer.
[in]sendReturnBufferSizeThe size, in bytes, of pSendBuffer and pReturnBuffer.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is uninitialized.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pSendBuffer != nullptr.
  • pSendBuffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • pReturnBuffer != nullptr.
  • pReturnBuffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • pReturnBuffer != pSendBuffer.
  • sendReturnBufferSize > 0.
Postcondition
  • pAux is initialized.
  • pAux is enabled.
  • The pAux input/output buffers are not configured.

Details
AuxType effects provide a way to add user-defined effects to the audio renderer. When this function is called, pAux is associated with pFinalMix and initialized, which makes it possible to perform effect operations on mix buffers managed by pFinalMix. All future operations on AuxType are routed through pAux. For a list of functions that can be used with AuxType, see the AuxType reference.

A similar effect exists in the form of CaptureType, but with AuxType, the user can change the sample data and write back to the audio renderer. Because buffering is performed for these write backs, the output after effect processing is delayed with AuxType.

pSendBuffer and pReturnBuffer are managed inside pAux and are used to transfer data back and forth with the audio renderer. The memory regions specified for pSendBuffer and pReturnBuffer must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType. Also, the instance of nn::audio::MemoryPoolType that contains the memory regions specified for pSendBuffer and pReturnBuffer must be in the attached state. For more information, see nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer().

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) Immediately after the effect is added, pAux is not connected to the input/output mix buffers, and pAux transitions to an enabled state. Use the nn::audio::SetAuxInputOutput() function to specify the indices of the input/output mix buffers to which to apply the effect.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ AddAux() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddAux ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
AuxType *  pAux,
SubMixType *  pSubMix,
void *  pSendBuffer,
void *  pReturnBuffer,
size_t  sendReturnBufferSize 
)
noexcept

Adds an AuxType object to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[out]pAuxAn uninitialized AuxType object.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to which the effect is being added.
[in]pSendBufferThe buffer used to store samples from the audio renderer.
[in]pReturnBufferThe buffer used to store the samples being returned to the audio renderer.
[in]sendReturnBufferSizeThe size, in bytes, of pSendBuffer and pReturnBuffer.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is uninitialized.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSendBuffer != nullptr.
  • pSendBuffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • pReturnBuffer != nullptr.
  • pReturnBuffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • pReturnBuffer != pSendBuffer.
  • sendReturnBufferSize > 0.
Postcondition
  • pAux is initialized.
  • pAux is enabled.
  • The pAux input/output buffers are not configured.

Details
Adds pAux to pSubMix and initializes pAux. Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::AddAux(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, AuxType* pAux, FinalMixType* pFinalMix, void* pSendBuffer, void* pReturnBuffer, size_t sendReturnBufferSize).

◆ RemoveAux() [1/2]

void nn::audio::RemoveAux ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
AuxType *  pAux,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes an AuxType object from FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pAuxThe AuxType object added to pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that removes pAux.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsAuxRemovable(pAux) == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pAux is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. This function calls the nn::audio::SetAuxEnabled() function to disable Aux before removing that instance of Aux and then calls the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to notify the audio renderer that Aux has been disabled. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, use the nn::audio::IsAuxRemovable() function to determine whether the audio renderer has completely stopped using the effect and the effect can be safely removed.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveAux() [2/2]

void nn::audio::RemoveAux ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
AuxType *  pAux,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes an AuxType object from SubMixType.

[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.

  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsAuxRemovable(pAux) == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::RemoveAux(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, AuxType* pAux, FinalMixType* pFinalMix).

◆ GetAuxChannelCountMax()

int nn::audio::GetAuxChannelCountMax ( const AuxType *  pAux)
noexcept

Gets the maximum number of channels that can be set for AuxType.

Parameters
[in]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns the maximum value for the number of channels that can be set.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.

◆ GetAuxInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetAuxInputOutput ( const AuxType *  pAux,
int8_t *  pOutInput,
int8_t *  pOutOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the indexes of the AuxType input/output mix buffers.

Parameters
[in]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]pOutInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pAux.
[out]pOutOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output mix buffers set in pAux.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in pOutInput and pOutOutput.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.
  • pOutInput != nullptr.
  • pOutOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.
Postcondition
  • Information for the number of indexes specified in pOutCount is written to pOutInput and pOutOutput.

Details
Gets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified AuxType effect. The indices of the source input mix buffers are stored in pOutInput, and the indices of the output mix buffers are stored in pOutOutput. pOutInput and pOutOutput can store up to count indices. Also, the number of mix buffer indices that are actually stored in pOutInput and pOutOutput is stored in pOutCount.

This function gets the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetAuxInputOutput() function. If this function is called on an instance of AuxType for which the nn::audio::SetAuxInputOutput() function has not yet been called, nothing will be stored in pOutInput and pOutOutput, and a value of 0 will be stored in pOutCount. Also see the description of the nn::audio::AddAux() function. If the number of channels set to pAux is greater than the value specified for count, pOutInput and pOutOutput will only store up to count of the mix buffer indices.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function.

◆ SetAuxInputOutput()

Result nn::audio::SetAuxInputOutput ( AuxType *  pAux,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
const int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the input/output buffer indexes for AuxType.

Parameters
[out]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers to set in pAux.
[in]outputThe array of indexes of output mix buffers set in pAux.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • 0 < count.
  • count <= (The number of mix buffers held by the attached SubMixType / FinalMixType when pAux was initialized).
  • count <= (The number of channels allowed if the size of the buffer was passed as pSendBuffer / pReturnBuffer when pAux was initialized).

Details
Sets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified AuxType effect. The mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the input array are set as the input mix buffers, and the mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the output array are set as the output mix buffers. The same mix buffer indices can be specified for both input and output.

There are common rules for setting the input/output buffer relationship for each type of effect. For more information, see nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ ReadAuxSendBuffer()

int nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer ( AuxType *  pAux,
int32_t *  pOutData,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Loads count number of samples from AuxType.

Parameters
[in]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]pOutDataBuffer used to load the specified number of sample arrays.
[in]countNumber of samples to load.
Returns
Returns the number of samples actually loaded.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.
  • pOutData != nullptr.
  • count >= 0.

Details
Loads the sample data from the SendBuffer managed by AuxType to pOutData. Specify a value of (number of channels) × (number of frame samples) units for count. For example, if one audio frame stores 240 samples, and you are loading sample data for three channels, set count = (240 × 3) × (number of required audio frames). Use the nn::audio::GetAuxSampleCount() function to get the number of sample frames.

The sample data is stored in pOutData in 32-bit Q15 format. Data loaded in pOutData is read with block interleaving. Take the preceding example where three channels of data are loaded to pOutData. This pOutData loads the sample data in the order of 240 samples of data for channel 1, 240 samples of data for channel 2, and then 240 samples of data for channel 3.

nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() returns 0 when the sample data in SendBuffer() is depleted. If this happens, nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() might be reading data faster than sample data is being passed to SendBuffer by the audio renderer. Adjust the balance between the frequency of data loads and the amount of delay as necessary by modifying the number of audio frames set for mixBufferFrameCount by nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer(), or by modifying the interval between calls to nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer(). For more information, see nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer(). Note that the total number of samples that did not have time to be processed and were lost can be obtained with the nn::audio::GetAuxBufferStatistics() function. For more information, see the function descriptions.

This function can be called at the same time as nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() or nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() without problem. However, this function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ WriteAuxReturnBuffer()

int nn::audio::WriteAuxReturnBuffer ( AuxType *  pAux,
const int32_t *  pData,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Writes count number of samples to AuxType.

Parameters
[out]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]pDataBuffer used to load the specified number of sample arrays.
[in]countNumber of samples to write.
Returns
Returns the actual number of samples that were written.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.
  • pData != nullptr.
  • count >= 0.

Details
Write sample data to the ReturnBuffer managed by AuxType. Specify a value of (number of channels) × (number of frame samples) units for count. For example, if one audio frame stores 240 samples, and you are writing sample data for three channels, set count = (240 × 3) × (number of required audio frames). Use the nn::audio::GetAuxSampleCount() function to get the number of sample frames.

The audio renderer expects the sample data passed from pData to be in 32-bit wide Q15 format. In addition, the data stored in pData is expected to be block-interleaved. Take the pData in the earlier example that writes three channels of data. This pData must have sample data stored in the order of 240 samples of data for channel 1, 240 samples of data for channel 2, and 240 samples of data for channel 3.

When the return value is less than the value passed by count, the sample data may be written to ReturnBuffer faster than the audio renderer reading sample data from ReturnBuffer. To balance the processing load and the amount of delay, the user must modify the buffer size of ReturnBuffer set in nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer(), and the frequency of nn::audio::WriteAuxReturnBuffer() calls. For more information, see nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer(). Note that the total number of samples that did not have time to be processed and for which noise may have occurred can be obtained with the nn::audio::GetAuxBufferStatistics() function. For more information, see the function descriptions.

This function can be called at the same time as nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() or nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() without problem. However, this function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ GetAuxSampleRate()

int nn::audio::GetAuxSampleRate ( const AuxType *  pAux)
noexcept

Gets the sample rate of the SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer managed by AuxType.

Parameters
[in]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns the sample rate.
Precondition
  • pAux is initialized.
  • pAux != nullptr.

Details
Returns the sampling rate set to the instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType to which pAux is connected.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function.

◆ GetAuxSampleCount()

int nn::audio::GetAuxSampleCount ( const AuxType *  pAux)
noexcept

Gets the maximum number of samples that can be held by the SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer objects managed by AuxType.

Parameters
[in]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns the number of samples.
Precondition
  • pAux is initialized.
  • pAux != nullptr.

Details
The maximum number of samples that can be stored in SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer is determined by the value set for sendReturnBufferSize in the nn::audio::AddAux() function when pAux was initialized. For more information, see nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForAuxSendReturnBuffer().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function.

Examples
HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ IsAuxEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsAuxEnabled ( const AuxType *  pAux)
noexcept

Determines whether AuxType is enabled.

Parameters
[in]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if enabled, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function.

Examples
HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetAuxEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetAuxEnabled ( AuxType *  pAux,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Sets whether a AuxType is enabled.

Parameters
[out]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Returns
Returns the execution result.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::IsAuxEnabled(pAux) == enable.

Details
When an aux effect is enabled, the contents of the input mix buffers are written to SendBuffer and the contents of ReturnBuffer are written to the output mix buffer according to the input/output buffer relationship configured using the nn::audio::SetAuxInputOutput() function. When the effect is disabled, the contents of the input mix buffers are output directly to the output mix buffers as-is without going through SendBuffer or ReturnBuffer.

Also, when pAux is disabled, the following data is destroyed.

  • Samples that the nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() function has not finished loading
  • Samples that the nn::audio::WriteAuxReturnBuffer() has finished writing but the audio renderer has not finished processing

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ IsAuxRemovable()

bool nn::audio::IsAuxRemovable ( const AuxType *  pAux)
noexcept

Determines whether AuxType can be safely removed.

Parameters
[in]pAuxThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pAux != nullptr.
  • pAux is initialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before calling the nn::audio::RemoveAux() function, use this function to check whether the instance of Aux that you want to remove is no longer being used. Note the following.

  • The use of effects does not stop immediately after disabling them using the nn::audio::SetAuxEnabled() function.
  • After an effect is disabled using the nn::audio::SetAuxEnable() function, it can take up to two audio frames for calls to the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to be completed.
  • Do not call the nn::audio::RemoveAux() function during this time.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pAux while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetAuxBufferStatistics()

AuxBufferStatistics nn::audio::GetAuxBufferStatistics ( const AuxType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Gets statistical information associated with the SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer managed by AuxType.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns statistical information associated with the SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer managed by AuxType.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
If there is no remaining space when the audio renderer AuxType tries to write sample data to the buffer managed by SendBuffer, the oldest sample data is overwritten and recorded sample data is lost. In addition, if there is no remaining readable space when reading sample data from the ReturnBuffer managed by the audio renderer AuxType, the old sample data that was already read will be read again, resulting in the output after effect processing to not be continuous and causing noise to occur. This function returns following statistical information associated with SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer.

  • Total number of samples for which nn::audio::ReadAuxSendBuffer() could not perform read processing and were lost.
  • Total number of samples for which nn::audio::WriteAuxReturnBuffer() could not perform write processing and may be subject to noise.

Each of the structure values returned by this function is updated not when nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is called, but rather when the audio renderer's rendering process is executed. In addition, each of the structure values returned by this function is reset to 0 by the nn::audio::ResetAuxBufferStatistics() function.

The upper limit of each of the structure values returned by this function is the std::int32_t type maximum value (std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max()). When this upper limit has been reached, the value does not change until it has been reset to 0 by the nn::audio::ResetAuxBufferStatistics() function.

Because the audio renderer does not write to SendBuffer or read from ReturnBuffer when nn::audio::IsAuxEnabled() is false, the total number of lost samples is not updated.

This function can be called at the same time as nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() or nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() without problem. However, this function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ ResetAuxBufferStatistics()

void nn::audio::ResetAuxBufferStatistics ( AuxType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Resets statistical information associated with the SendBuffer and ReturnBuffer managed by AuxType.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized AuxType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
This function can be called at the same time as nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() or nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() without problem. However, this function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForI3dl2Reverb()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForI3dl2Reverb ( int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the work buffer size required for the renderer to use I3dl2ReverbType.

Parameters
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set in the SubMixType or FinalMixType object that is adding I3dl2ReverbType.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to use.
Returns
Returns the buffer size required to use I3dl2ReverbType.
Precondition
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ AddI3dl2Reverb() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
I3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a I3dl2ReverbType object to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[out]pOutReverbAn uninitialized I3dl2ReverbType object.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory region to use for I3dl2ReverbType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that adds the effect.
[in]channelCountMaxValue for the maximum number of channels that can be set.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize => nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForI3dl2Reverb(sampleRate, channelCountMax). (sampleRate is the sample rate set in pFinalMix. You can get it using nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate().)
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Postcondition
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • pOutReverb is enabled.
  • The pOutReverb input/output buffers are not configured.

Details
Add I3dl2ReverbType that is a reverb based on Interactive 3D Audio Level 2 specifications to pFinalMix and initialize pOutReverb. Calling this function links pOutReverb to pFinalMix and makes it possible for pOutReverb to control the effects for the mix buffer managed by pFinalMix. Use pOutReverb to perform all future operations on I3dl2ReverbType. For a list of functions that can be used with I3dl2ReverbType, see the I3dl2ReverbType reference.

I3dl2ReverbType requires a work buffer to process the effect. Allocate a buffer that is at least equal to the size of the value returned by nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForI3dl2Reverb(), and specify that buffer and its size for buffer and bufferSize. The memory region specified for buffer must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType, and its nn::audio::MemoryPoolType must be attached.

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) For channelCountMax, specify the number of channels supported by I3dl2ReverbType. The maximum number of channels that can be specified is the value specified for count in the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput() function. For more information, see nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput().

Immediately after a delay is added, pOutReverb is not connected to the input/output mix buffers, and pOutReverb transitions to an enabled state. Use the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput() function to specify the indices of the input/output mix buffers to which to apply the effect.

If the process for adding the effect fails and the function returns nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource, this usually indicates that the number of effects currently being used exceeds the maximum number of effects specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount. Delete one of the other effects or increase the number specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ AddI3dl2Reverb() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
I3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
SubMixType *  pSubMix,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a I3dl2ReverbType object to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pOutReverbAn uninitialized I3dl2ReverbType object.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory region to use for I3dl2ReverbType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to which the effect is being added.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels that can be set for pOutReverb.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize => nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForI3dl2Reverb(sampleRate, channelCountMax).
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Postcondition
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • pOutReverb is enabled.
  • The pOutReverb input/output buffers are not configured.

Details
Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, I3dl2ReverbType* pOutReverb, void* buffer, size_t bufferSize, FinalMixType* pFinalMix, int channelCountMax).

◆ RemoveI3dl2Reverb() [1/2]

void * nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a ReverbType object from FinalMix.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pReverbThe I3dl2ReverbType object added to pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that removes pReverb.
Returns
Returns the memory used for ReverbType. (The memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb().)
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsI3dl2ReverbRemovable(pReverb) == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pReverb is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. This function calls the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbEnabled() function to disable Aux before removing that instance of Aux and then calls the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to notify the audio renderer that Aux has been disabled. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, use the nn::audio::IsI3dl2ReverbRemovable() function to determine whether the audio renderer has completely stopped using the effect and the effect can be safely removed. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, it may take up to two audio frames for the audio renderer to completely stop using the effect.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveI3dl2Reverb() [2/2]

void * nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a ReverbType object from SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pReverbThe I3dl2ReverbType object added to pSubMix.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType that removes pReverb.
Returns
Returns the memory used for I2DL2ReverbType. (The memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb().)
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsReverbRemovable(pReverb) == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pReverb is uninitialized.

Details
Except when called on an instance of SubMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, I3dl2ReverbType* pReverb, FinalMixType* pFinalMix).

◆ IsI3dl2ReverbRemovable()

bool nn::audio::IsI3dl2ReverbRemovable ( const I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb)
noexcept

Determines whether the I3dl2ReverbType object can be safely removed.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before calling the nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb() function, use this function to check whether the instance of pReverb that you want to remove is no longer being used. Note the following.

  • The use of effects does not stop immediately after disabling them using the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbEnabled() function.
  • After an effect is disabled using the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbEnable() function, it can take up to two audio frames for calls to the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function to be completed.
  • Do not call the nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb() function during this time.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

noexcept

Returns the maximum value for the number of channels that can be set.

◆ GetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput ( const I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb,
int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the I3dl2ReverbType input/output mix buffer indexes.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized I3dl2ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]outInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pReverb.
[out]outOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output mix buffers set in pReverb.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.

Details
Gets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified I3dl2ReverbType effect. The indices of the source input mix buffers are stored in outInput, and the indices of the output mix buffers are stored in outOutput. outInput and outOutput can store up to count indices. The actual number of mix buffer indexes that are stored in outInput and outOutput is returned to pOutCount.

This function gets the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput() function. If this function is called on an instance of I3dl2ReverbType for which the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput() function has not yet been called, nothing will be stored in outInput and outOutput, and a value of 0 will be stored in pOutCount. For more information, see nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb(). If the number of channels set to pReverb is greater than the value specified for count, outInput and outOutput will only store up to count of the mix buffer indices.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function.

◆ SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput ( I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the I3dl2ReverbType input/output mix buffer indexes.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized I3dl2ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers to set in pReverb.
[in]outputThe array of indexes of output mix buffers set in pReverb.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input and output.
Returns
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
Sets the input/output buffer relationship for the specified I3dl2ReverbType effect. The mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the input array are set as the input mix buffers, and the mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the output array are set as the output mix buffers. The same mix buffer indices can be specified for both input and output.

There are common rules for setting the input/output buffer relationship for each type of effect. For more information, see nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput().

The I3dl2ReverbType input is processed on the assumption that input channels are in the following order. Be careful not to get the order wrong when you set input.

  • For 2 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight.
  • For 4 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, RearLeft, RearRight.
  • For 6 ch: FrontLeft, FrontRight, FrontCenter, LowFrequency, RearLeft, RearRight.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetI3dl2ReverbRoomGain()

void nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbRoomGain ( I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb,
float  room 
)
noexcept

Sets the room gain of the I3dl2ReverbType object.

Parameters

[in]roomThe room gain value to set (in millibels, more commonly called hundredths of a decibel ).
Precondition

  • pReverb is initialized.
  • -10000.0f <= room && room <= 0.0f.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Parameters

Returns
Returns the room gain. The unit is mB (millibel, or one hundredth of a decibel).
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function.

◆ SetI3dl2ReverbRoomHfGain()

)

Sets the attenuation for high-frequency components, using low-frequency components as the basis, for the I3dl2ReverbType object.

Parameters

Precondition

  • pReverb is initialized.
  • -10000.0f <= roomHf && roomHf <= 0.0f.

Details

◆ GetI3dl2ReverbRoomHfGain()

Parameters

◆ SetI3dl2ReverbLateReverbDecayTime()

)

◆ SetI3dl2ReverbLateReverbHfDecayRatio()

void nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbLateReverbHfDecayRatio ( I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb,
float  hfDecayRatio 
)
noexcept

Sets the ratio of reverb time for high-frequency components as compared to reverb time for low-frequency components for the I3dl2ReverbType object.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized I3dl2ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]hfDecayRatioThe ratio of reverb time for high-frequency components as compared to reverb time for low-frequency components.
Returns
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.
  • 0.1f <= hfDecayRatio && hfDecayRatio <= 2.0f.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetI3dl2ReverbLateReverbHfDecayRatio()

float nn::audio::GetI3dl2ReverbLateReverbHfDecayRatio ( const I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb)
noexcept

Parameters

Returns
Returns the ratio of reverb time for high-frequency components as compared to reverb time for low-frequency components.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function.

◆ SetI3dl2ReverbParameters()

void nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbParameters ( I3dl2ReverbType *  pOutReverb,
const I3dl2ReverbParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the nn::audio::I3dl2ReverbType effect parameters.

Parameters
[out]pOutReverbPointer to an initialized nn::audio::I3dl2ReverbType.
[in]pParameterSetEffect parameters to set in nn::audio::I3dl2ReverbParameterSet.
Precondition
  • pOutReverb != nullptr.
  • pOutReverb is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->roomGain && pParameterSet->roomGain <= 0.0f.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->roomHfGain && pParameterSet->roomHfGain <= 0.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->lateReverbDecayTime && pParameterSet->lateReverbDecayTime <= 20.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->lateReverbHfDecayRatio && pParameterSet->lateReverbHfDecayRatio <= 2.0f.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->reflectionsGain && pParameterSet->reflectionsGain <= 1000.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->reflectionsDelayTime && pParameterSet->reflectionsDelayTime <= 0.3f.
  • -10000.0f <= pParameterSet->reverbGain && pParameterSet->reverbGain <= 2000.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->reverbDelayTime && pParameterSet->reverbDelayTime <= 0.1f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->reverbDiffusion && pParameterSet->reverbDiffusion <= 100.0f.
  • 0.1f <= pParameterSet->reverbDensity && pParameterSet->reverbDensity <= 100.0f.
  • 20.0f <= pParameterSet->hfReference && pParameterSet->hfReference <= 20000.0f.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->dryGain && pParameterSet->dryGain <= 1.0f.

Details
For more information about the meanings of the parameters, see I3dl2 Reverb Parameters in the Audio Effects documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ GetI3dl2ReverbParameters()

I3dl2ReverbParameterSet nn::audio::GetI3dl2ReverbParameters ( const I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb)

◆ LoadI3dl2ReverbPreset()

void nn::audio::LoadI3dl2ReverbPreset ( I3dl2ReverbParameterSet *  pOutParameter,
I3dl2ReverbType::Preset  preset 
)
noexcept

Gets the nn::audio::I3dl2ReverbType effect parameters comparable to a preset.

Parameters
[out]pOutParameterThe effect parameters to get.
[in]presetThe type of preset as defined in nn::audio::I3dl2ReverbType::Preset.
Precondition
  • pOutParameter != nullptr.

Details
Gets the effect parameters comparable to a preset that have been prepared in nn::audio::I3dl2ReverbType::Preset. By specifying the parameters obtained with this function in nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbParameters(), you can achieve an effect similar to nn::audio::I3dl2ReverbType::Preset.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutReverb while calling this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetI3dl2ReverbEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbEnabled ( I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Sets whether the I3dl2ReverbType is enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized I3dl2ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Returns
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

Details
When a reverb effect is enabled, the effect is applied to the content of the input mix buffers and the resulting data is written to the output mix buffers according to the input/output buffer relationship specified using the nn::audio::SetI3dl2ReverbInputOutput() function. When the effect is disabled, the contents of the input mix buffers are output as-is to the output mix buffers without applying the effect.

The values of parameters other than the enabled/disabled state are maintained before and after the SetI3dl2ReverbEnabled() function is called. However, if you specify true when calling the SetReverbEnabled() function, the internal state of pReverb is cleared. If there is a reverberant sound even when false has been specified, that sound gets cleared.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ IsI3dl2ReverbEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsI3dl2ReverbEnabled ( const I3dl2ReverbType *  pReverb)
noexcept

Determines whether I3dl2ReverbType is enabled.

Parameters
[in]pReverbThe initialized I3dl2ReverbType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if enabled.
Precondition
  • pReverb != nullptr.
  • pReverb is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pReverb while calling this function.

◆ AddBiquadFilter() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Adds a BiquadFilterType object to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[out]pBiquadFilterAn uninitialized BiquadFilterType.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType to which to add pBiquadFilter.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is uninitialized.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
  • pBiquadFilter is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pBiquadFilter are not configured.

Details
Add an effect that performs a BiquadFilter process to pFinalMix and initializes pBiquadFilter. Calling this function associates pBiquadFilter with pFinalMix and makes it possible to perform effect operations on the mix buffers managed by pFinalMix. Subsequent operations on BiquadFilterType are conducted via pBiquadFilter. For a list of the functions that operate on BiquadFilterType, see the description for BiquadFilterType.

For its biquad filter effect processes, pBiquadFilter can use the mix buffers managed by the FinalMixType specified by pFinalMix. For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) If this warning is displayed, check whether the effect instance causing the warning was already removed from SubMixType or FinalMixType by the nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter() function.

Immediately after addition to pFinalMix, the input/output mix buffers for pBiquadFilter are unconnected and pBiquadFilter is in the enabled state. Use the nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterInputOutput() function to specify the indexes of the input/output mix buffers.

If the process for adding the effect fails and the function returns nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource, this usually indicates that the number of effects currently being used exceeds the maximum number of effects specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount. Delete one of the other effects or increase the number specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ AddBiquadFilter() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Adds a BiquadFilterType object to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[out]pBiquadFilterAn uninitialized BiquadFilterType.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to which the effect is being added.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is uninitialized.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
  • pBiquadFilter is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pBiquadFilter are not configured.

Details
This function does the same thing as the nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, BiquadFilterType* pBiquadFilter, FinalMixType* pFinalMix) except when called on an instance of SubMixType.

◆ RemoveBiquadFilter() [1/2]

void nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a BiquadFilterType object from FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pBiquadFilterThe BiquadFilterType object added to pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType that added pBiquadFilter.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsBiquadFilterRemovable(pBiquadFilter) == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pBiquadFilter is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before you use this function to remove BiquadFilter, call nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterEnabled() to disable BiquadFilter and call nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() to notify the audio renderer that it has been disabled. After the notification is sent, it may take up to two audio frames for the audio renderer to completely stop using the effect. Use the nn::audio::IsBiquadFilterRemovable() function to determine whether the effect can be safely removed.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveBiquadFilter() [2/2]

void nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a BiquadFilterType object from SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pBiquadFilterThe BiquadFilterType object added to pSubMix.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType that added pBiquadFilter.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsBiquadFilterRemovable(pBiquadFilter) == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
  • pBiquadFilter has been added to pSubMix.
Postcondition
  • pBiquadFilter is uninitialized.

Details
This function does the same thing as the nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, BiquadFilterType* pBiquadFilter, FinalMixType* pFinalMix) except when called on an instance of SubMixType.

◆ GetBiquadFilterInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetBiquadFilterInputOutput ( const BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the input/output relationship of the mixing process set in BiquadFilterType.

Parameters
[in]pBiquadFilterThe initialized BiquadFilterType object added to the SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]outInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pBiquadFilter.
[out]outOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output mix buffers set in pBiquadFilter.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.

◆ SetBiquadFilterInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterInputOutput ( BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the input/output relationship of the mixing process performed by BiquadFilterType.

Parameters
[out]pBiquadFilterThe initialized BiquadFilterType object added to the SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers to set in pBiquadFilter.
[in]outputThe array of indexes of output mix buffers to set in pBiquadFilter.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • 0 < count && count <= nn::audio::BiquadFilterType::ChannelCountMax.

Details
The processing order of channels is undefined. Do not configure settings that depend on a certain processing order. For example, configuring settings like {0, 1} for input and { 1, 2 } for output to realize a multi-stage biquad filter is prohibited. If you want to realize this kind of process, add multiple BiquadFilterType objects to SubMixType and FinalMixType.

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ GetBiquadFilterParameter()

BiquadFilterParameter nn::audio::GetBiquadFilterParameter ( const BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter)
noexcept

Gets the BiquadFilterType parameter.

Parameters
[in]pBiquadFilterThe initialized BiquadFilterType object added to the SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns the parameters.
Precondition
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.

◆ SetBiquadFilterParameter()

void nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterParameter ( BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
const BiquadFilterParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Sets the BiquadFilterType parameter.

This function performs an internal process equivalent to nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterEnabled(parameter.enable).

Parameters
[in]pBiquadFilterThe initialized BiquadFilterType object added to the SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]parameterParameters
Precondition
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
Postcondition
  • GetBiquadFilterParameter(pBiquadFilter) == parameter.
  • IsBiquadFilterEnabled(pBiquadFilter) == parameter.enable

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ SetBiquadFilterEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterEnabled ( BiquadFilterType *  pBiquadFilter,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Sets BiquadFilterType as enabled or disabled.

If enabled, the biquad filter process is conducted based on the parameters set by functions like nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterParameter() and nn::audio::SetBiquadFilterInputOutput().

Parameters
[in]pBiquadFilterBiquadFilter
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Precondition
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.
Postcondition
  • IsBiquadFilterEnabled(pBiquadFilter) == enable.

If disabled, the data passes through without effect processing.

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Determines whether the BiquadFilterTyp object can be safely removed.

[in]pBiquadFilterBiquadFilter
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pBiquadFilter != nullptr.
  • pBiquadFilter is initialized.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForCapture()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForCapture ( const AudioRendererParameter *  pParameter,
int  mixBufferFrameCount,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the size of work buffer required by the renderer to use CaptureType.

Parameters
[in]pParameterThe parameter used when the nn::audio::OpenAudioRenderer() function gets the audio renderer of the SubMixType or FinalMixType to which CaptureType is being added.
[in]mixBufferFrameCountThe maximum number of audio frames that CaptureType will buffer.
[in]channelCountMaxThe number of channels to store in CaptureType.
Returns
Returns the buffer size in bytes.
Precondition
  • pParameter != nullptr.
  • pParameter is initialized.
  • mixBufferFrameCount 1.
  • channelCountMax > 0.

Details
CaptureType uses a buffer when delivering sample data from the audio renderer to the user. This function returns the buffer size required for that process.

When the buffer size returned by this function is passed to the nn::audio::AddCapture() function, samples equal in number to (mixBufferFrameCount * channelCountMax * AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount) will be internally buffered. In other words, mixBufferFrameCount audio frames of samples can be buffered, providing some temporal leeway to the user in getting the samples. On the other hand, when mixBufferFrameCount is larger, the required buffer size also increases.

The audio renderer writes samples to this buffer in every audio frame, with the number of samples equal to the value set at initialization time for AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount multiplied by the count specified by the nn::audio::SetCaptureInput() function. If the user is late reading the sample data, the data will be lost, so you must periodically call the nn::audio::ReadCaptureBuffer() function to get the sample data.

The user must set a value for mixBufferFrameCount that is appropriate for the required process of getting sample data.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ AddCapture() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddCapture ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
CaptureType *  pEffect,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize 
)
noexcept

Adds a CaptureType object to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[out]pEffectAn uninitialized CaptureType.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType to which the effect is being added.
[in]bufferThe buffer used to store samples from the audio renderer.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of the buffer, in bytes.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is uninitialized.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize > 0.
Postcondition
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pEffect is enabled.
  • The input buffer for pEffect is not set.

Details
Add a CaptureType effect that gets sample data to pFinalMix and initializes pEffect. Calling this function associates pEffect with pFinalMix and initializes pEffect, enabling effect operations to be performed on the mix buffers managed by pFinalMix. Subsequent operations on CaptureType are performed through pEffect. For a list of functions that can perform operations on CaptureType, see the description for CaptureType.

A similar effect exists in the form of AuxType, but unlike that effect, CaptureType does not provide a feature for writing sample data back to the audio renderer. Because CaptureType does not have this write-back feature, it does not affect output after effect processing. In other words, the delays to output after effect processing that occur with AuxType do not occur with CaptureType.

buffer is used as the buffer managed internally by pEffect for exchanging sample data with the audio renderer. The memory region specified for buffer must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType. Also, the instance of nn::audio::MemoryPoolType that contains the memory region specified for buffer must be in the attached state. For more information, see the description of nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForCapture().

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) Immediately after the effect is added, pEffect is enabled but not connected to an input mix buffer. Use the nn::audio::SetCaptureInput() function to set the index of the input mix buffer.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ AddCapture() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddCapture ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
CaptureType *  pEffect,
SubMixType *  pSubMix,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize 
)
noexcept

Adds a CaptureType object to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[out]pEffectAn uninitialized CaptureType.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to which the effect is being added.
[in]bufferThe buffer used to store samples from the audio renderer.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of the buffer, in bytes.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is uninitialized.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize > 0.
Postcondition
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pEffect is enabled.
  • The input buffer for pEffect is not set.

Details
Adds pEffect to pSubMix and initializes pEffect. Except for the fact that the target is SubMixType, the behavior of this function is the same as nn::audio::AddCapture(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, CaptureType* pEffect, FinalMixType* pFinalMix, void* buffer, size_t bufferSize).

◆ RemoveCapture() [1/2]

void nn::audio::RemoveCapture ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
CaptureType *  pEffect,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes the CaptureType object from FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pEffectThe CaptureType object added to FinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType to remove pEffect from.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsCaptureRemovable"nn::audio::IsCaptureRemovable(pEffect)" == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pEffect is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before you use this function to remove CaptureType, call nn::audio::SetCaptureEnabled() to disable the CaptureType object and call nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() to notify the audio renderer that the object has been disabled. After calling nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer(), use the nn::audio::IsCaptureRemovable() function to determine whether the audio renderer has completely stopped processing the effect and it can be safely removed.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveCapture() [2/2]
