CaptureType *  pEffect,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes the CaptureType object from SubMixType.

[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to remove pEffect from.

  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsCaptureRemovable"nn::audio::IsCaptureRemovable(pEffect)" == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pEffect is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Except for the fact that the target is SubMixType, the behavior of this function is the same as nn::audio::RemoveCapture(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, CaptureType* pEffect, FinalMixType* pFinalMix).

◆ GetCaptureChannelCountMax()

int nn::audio::GetCaptureChannelCountMax ( const CaptureType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Gets the maximum number of channels that can be set for CaptureType.

Parameters

Returns

  • pEffect is initialized.

Details

◆ GetCaptureInput()

void nn::audio::GetCaptureInput ( const CaptureType *  pEffect,
int8_t *  pOutInput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the CaptureType input buffer indexes.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]pOutInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pEffect.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in pOutInput.
[in]countThe length of the pOutInput array.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pOutInput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.
Postcondition
  • Information for the number of indexes specified in pOutCount is written to pOutInput.

Details
Gets the indexes of the input buffers for the CaptureType effect processing. The indexes of the mix buffers that serve as the input are stored in pOutInput. count is the upper limit for the number of indexes stored in pOutInput. The actual number of indexes stored in pOutInput is returned in pOutCount.

This function gets the input buffer indexes that were specified by the nn::audio::SetCaptureInput() function. If this function is called on CaptureType in the initial state where nn::audio::SetCaptureInput() has never been called, pOutCount returns 0 and no data is stored in pOutInput. For more information, see the description of the nn::audio::AddCapture() function. If the number of channels set for pEffect exceeds the number set for count, the count number of indexes is stored in pOutInput.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

◆ SetCaptureInput()

void nn::audio::SetCaptureInput ( CaptureType *  pEffect,
const int8_t *  input,
const int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the CaptureType input buffer indexes.

Parameters
[out]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers to set in pEffect.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • 0 < count.
  • count <= (The number of mix buffers held by the SubMixType or FinalMixType connected when pEffect was initialized).
  • count <= nn::audio::GetCaptureChannelCountMax(pEffect).

Details
Sets the mix buffers specified in the input array as the input.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ ReadCaptureBuffer()

int nn::audio::ReadCaptureBuffer ( CaptureType *  pEffect,
int32_t *  pOutData,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Reads count number of samples from CaptureType.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]pOutDataBuffer used to load the specified number of sample arrays.
[in]countThe number of samples to read.
Returns
Returns the number of samples actually read.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pOutData != nullptr.
  • count >= 0.

Details
Loads sample data from the buffer managed by CaptureType into pOutData. Specify a value of (number of channels) × (number of frame samples) units for count. For example, if one audio frame stores 240 samples, and you are loading sample data for three channels, set count = (240 × 3) × (number of required audio frames). Use the nn::audio::GetCaptureSampleCount() function to get the number of frame samples.

The sample data is stored in pOutData in 32-bit Q15 format. Data loaded in pOutData is read with block interleaving. Take the preceding example where three channels of data are loaded to pOutData. This pOutData loads the sample data in the order of 240 samples of data for channel 1, 240 samples of data for channel 2, and then 240 samples of data for channel 3.

If the sample data in the buffer is depleted, the nn::audio::ReadCaptureBuffer() function returns 0. If this happens, the nn::audio::ReadCaptureBuffer() function might be reading faster than the audio renderer is passing sample data to the buffer. Conversely, if the nn::audio::ReadCaptureBuffer() function reads slower than the audio renderer is passing sample data to the buffer, the writable buffer space might become depleted. If that happens, older sample data will be overwritten first, and recorded sample data will be lost. In either case, we recommend that the user adjust the balance between the read frequency and the amount of delay as needed, using the nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForCapture() function to increase the number of frames set for mixBufferFrameCount, and changing the interval between calls to nn::audio::ReadCaptureBuffer(). (For more information, see the description of the nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForCapture() function.) To get the cumulative number of samples that have been overwritten and lost, use the GetCaptureLostSampleCount() function. For more information, see the function descriptions.

This function can be called at the same time as nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() or nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() without problem. However, this function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ GetCaptureSampleRate()

int nn::audio::GetCaptureSampleRate ( const CaptureType *  pEffect)

Gets the sampling rate set to the instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType to which pEffect is connected.

◆ GetCaptureSampleCount()

int nn::audio::GetCaptureSampleCount ( const CaptureType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Gets the maximum number of samples that can be stored in the buffer managed by CaptureType.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns the number of samples.
Precondition
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.

Details
The maximum number of samples that can be stored in the buffer is determined by the bufferSize set by the nn::audio::AddCapture() function when pEffect was initialized. For more information, see the description of nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForCapture().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

◆ IsCaptureEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsCaptureEnabled ( const CaptureType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Determines whether CaptureType is enabled.

Parameters

Returns

  • pEffect is initialized.

Details

◆ SetCaptureEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetCaptureEnabled ( CaptureType *  pEffect,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Sets CaptureType as either enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Returns
Returns the execution result.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::IsCaptureEnabled(pEffect) == true.

Details
This function enables and disables the process of getting sample data. In either case, CaptureType has no effect on the output of the audio renderer.

When pEffect is disabled, samples that the nn::audio::ReadCaptureBuffer() function has not finished reading are destroyed.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ IsCaptureRemovable()

bool nn::audio::IsCaptureRemovable ( const CaptureType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Determines whether the CaptureType object can be safely removed.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Call this function before calling nn::audio::RemoveCapture() to confirm that the use of the CaptureType object targeted for removal has completely stopped. Note the following.

  • The use of an effect does not stop immediately after it has been disabled by the nn::audio::SetCaptureEnabled() function.
  • It can take up to two audio frames for the use of the effect to stop after it has been disabled by the nn::audio::SetCaptureEnabled() function and the call to nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() has completed.
  • Make sure that you do not call nn::audio::RemoveCapture() during this time.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetCaptureLostSampleCount()

int32_t nn::audio::GetCaptureLostSampleCount ( const CaptureType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Gets the cumulative number of samples that have been lost from the buffer managed by CaptureType.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
The cumulative number of lost samples.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
If there is no remaining space when the audio renderer tries to write sample data to the buffer managed by CaptureType, the oldest sample data is overwritten and recorded sample data is lost. This function gets the cumulative number of lost samples.

The value returned by this function is updated not when nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is called, but rather when the audio renderer's rendering process is executed. In addition, the value returned by this function is reset to 0 by the nn::audio::ResetCaptureLostSampleCount() function.

The upper limit of the values returned by this function is the std::int32_t-type maximum value std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max(). When this upper limit has been reached, the value does not change until it has been reset to 0 by the nn::audio::ResetCaptureLostSampleCount() function.

When nn::audio::IsCaptureEnabled() is false, the audio renderer does not write sample data to the buffer, so the cumulative number of lost samples does not get updated.

This function can be called at the same time as nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() or nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() without problem. However, this function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ ResetCaptureLostSampleCount()

void nn::audio::ResetCaptureLostSampleCount ( CaptureType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Resets the cumulative number of samples that have been lost from the buffer managed by CaptureType.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized CaptureType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
Resets the cumulative number of samples that have been lost from the buffer managed by CaptureType to 0.

This function can be called at the same time as nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() or nn::audio::ExecuteAudioRendererRendering() without problem. However, this function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForLightLimiter()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForLightLimiter ( nn::TimeSpan  lookAheadTimeMax,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Gets the work buffer size required for the renderer to use LightLimiterType.

Parameters
[in]lookAheadTimeMaxThe maximum look-ahead time that can be set with LightLimiterType.
[in]sampleRateThe sample rate set in the SubMixType or FinalMixType instance to which LightLimiterType is added.
[in]channelCountMaxThe maximum number of channels to use.
Returns
Returns the buffer size required to use LightLimiterType.
Precondition
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= lookAheadTimeMax && lookAheadTimeMax < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • (sampleRate == 32000) || (sampleRate == 48000).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).

Details
For LightLimiterType, the required memory size varies based on the maximum look-ahead time, the sample rate, and the number of channels that are set. By specifying these values, this function calculates the necessary memory size for operation of LightLimiterType.

For sampleRate, specify the sampling rate set for the instance is added by the nn::audio::AddLightLimiter() function. Use the nn::audio::GetSubMixSampleRate() function to get the sampling rate for SubMixType, and use the nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate() function to get the sampling rate for FinalMixType.

For channelCountMax, specify the number of channels supported by LightLimiterType.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ AddLightLimiter() [1/2]

Result nn::audio::AddLightLimiter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
nn::TimeSpan  lookAheadTimeMax,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a LightLimiterType object to FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[out]pEffectAn uninitialized LightLimiterType.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory to use for LightLimiterType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMix to which the effect is being added.
[in]lookAheadTimeMaxThe maximum value that can be set for the look-ahead time.
[in]channelCountMaxValue for the maximum number of channels that can be set.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForLightLimiter(lookAheadTimeMax, sampleRate, channelCountMax). (sampleRate is the sample rate set in pFinalMix. You can get it using nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate().)
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= lookAheadTimeMax && lookAheadTimeMax < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Postcondition
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pEffect is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pEffect are not set.

Details
Adds a LightLimiterType effect that performs a light limiter process to pFinalMix, and initializes pEffect. Calling this function links pEffect with pFinalMix and makes it possible to perform effect operations on the mix buffers managed by pFinalMix. Subsequent operations on LightLimiterType are performed through pEffect. For a list of functions that perform operations on LightLimiterType, see the description of LightLimiterType.

LightLimiterType requires a work buffer for the effect processing. Allocate a buffer that is at least as large as the value returned by the nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForLightLimiter() function, and pass that to buffer and bufferSize. The memory region specified for buffer must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType. Also, the instance of nn::audio::MemoryPoolType that contains the memory region specified for buffer must be in the attached state.

Only one instance of each type of effect can be added to a single SubMixType or FinalMixType. A single instance of an effect cannot be added to multiple instances of SubMixType or FinalMixType. The following warning message is displayed if an initialized effect that has already been added to an instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType is added to the same instance or another instance of SubMixType or FinalMixType again.

[nn::audio] Warning: The passed effect is already initialized. Please confirm if (address for effect instance) is a valid effect object.

("address for effect instance" is the address of the instance of the effect that you attempted to add.) For lookAheadTimeMax, specify the maximum look-ahead time that can be set while pEffect is being used. After the addition, you can use the nn::audio::SetLightLimiterLookAheadTime() function at any time to change the look-ahead time, providing the time is no greater than lookAheadTimeMax. However, after changing the delay time setting, you must call the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() to notify the audio renderer of the change.

For channelCountMax, specify the number of channels supported by LightLimiterType. The number of channels specified here corresponds to the maximum value that can be specified for the count parameter of the nn::audio::SetLightLimiterInputOutput() function. For more information, see the description of nn::audio::SetLightLimiterInputOutput().

Immediately after the addition, pEffect is not connected to the input/output mix buffers and is enabled. Use the nn::audio::SetLightLimiterInputOutput() function to set the indexes of the input/output mix buffers.

If the process for adding the effect fails and the function returns nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource, this usually indicates that the number of effects currently being used exceeds the maximum number of effects specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount. Delete one of the other effects or increase the number specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.effectCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ AddLightLimiter() [2/2]

Result nn::audio::AddLightLimiter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
SubMixType *  pSubMix,
nn::TimeSpan  lookAheadTimeMax,
int  channelCountMax 
)
noexcept

Adds a LightLimiterType object to SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[out]pEffectAn uninitialized LightLimiterType.
[in]bufferPointer to the memory to use for LightLimiterType.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of memory specified by buffer.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMix to which the effect is being added.
[in]lookAheadTimeMaxThe maximum value that can be set for the look-ahead time.
[in]channelCountMaxValue for the maximum number of channels that can be set.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is uninitialized.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForLightLimiter(lookAheadTimeMax, sampleRate, channelCountMax). (sampleRate is the sample rate specified for pSubMix. You can get it using nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate().)
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= lookAheadTimeMax && lookAheadTimeMax < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • (channelCountMax == 1) || (channelCountMax == 2) || (channelCountMax == 4 ) || (channelCountMax == 6).
Postcondition
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pEffect is enabled.
  • The input/output buffers for pEffect are not set.

Details
This function operates on SubMixType, but otherwise it works the same as nn::audio::AddLightLimiter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, LightLimiterType* pEffect, void* buffer, size_t bufferSize, FinalMixType* pFinalMix, nn::TimeSpan lookAheadTimeMax, int channelCountMax.

◆ RemoveLightLimiter() [1/2]

void* nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a LightLimiterType object from FinalMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pEffectThe LightLimiterType object added to pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType to remove pEffect from.
Returns
Returns the memory used for LightLimiterType (the memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()).
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsLightLimiterRemovable "nn::audio::IsLightLimiterRemovable(pEffect)" == true.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pEffect is uninitialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before you use this function to remove pEffect, call nn::audio::SetLightLimiterEnabled() to disable pEffect and call nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() to notify the audio renderer that it has been disabled. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, use the nn::audio::IsLightLimiterRemovable() function to determine whether the audio renderer has completely stopped using the effect and the effect can be safely removed. After calling the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function, it may take up to two audio frames for the audio renderer to completely stop using the effect.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AddBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBiquadFilter()
  • nn::audio::AddBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::RemoveBufferMixer()
  • nn::audio::AddDelay()
  • nn::audio::RemoveDelay()
  • nn::audio::AddReverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveReverb()
  • nn::audio::AddI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::RemoveI3dl2Reverb()
  • nn::audio::AddAux()
  • nn::audio::RemoveAux()
  • nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter()
  • nn::audio::AddCapture()
  • nn::audio::RemoveCapture()

Also, do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ RemoveLightLimiter() [2/2]

void* nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Removes a LightLimiterType object from SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pEffectThe LightLimiterType object added to pSubMix.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType to remove pEffect from.
Returns
Returns the memory used for LightLimiterType (the memory passed to buffer when initialized by nn::audio::AddLightLimiter()).
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsLightLimiterRemovable "nn::audio::IsLightLimiterRemovable(pEffect)" == true.
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
Postcondition
  • pEffect is uninitialized.

Details
This function operates on SubMixType, but otherwise it works the same as RemoveLightLimiter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, LightLimiterType* pEffect, FinalMixType* pFinalMix).

◆ GetLightLimiterInputOutput()

void nn::audio::GetLightLimiterInputOutput ( const LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
int8_t *  outInput,
int8_t *  outOutput,
int *  pOutCount,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Gets the indexes of the LightLimiterType input/output mix buffers.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[out]outInputThe array from which to get the indexes of the input mix buffers set in pEffect.
[out]outOutputThe array from which to get the indexes of the output mix buffers set in pEffect.
[out]pOutCountThe number of mix buffer indexes obtained in outInput and outOutput.
[in]countLength of the outInput and outOutput arrays.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • outInput != nullptr.
  • outOutput != nullptr.
  • pOutCount != nullptr.
  • count > 0.
Postcondition
  • Information for the number of indexes specified in pOutCount is written to outInput and outOutput.

Details
Gets the input/output relationship of effect processing by LightLimiterType. The indices of the source input mix buffers are stored in outInput, and the indices of the output mix buffers are stored in outOutput. outInput and outOutput can store up to count indices. The actual number of mix buffer indexes that are stored in outInput and outOutput is returned to pOutCount.

This function gets the input/output relationship specified by the nn::audio::SetLightLimiterInputOutput() function. If this function is called on an instance of LightLimiterType in the initial state where nn::audio::SetLightLimiterInputOutput() has never been called, nothing is stored in outInput and outOutput, and a value of 0 is returned to pOutCount. Also see the description of the nn::audio::AddLightLimiter() function. If the number of channels set for pEffect is greater than the value specified for count, outInput and outOutput store only count number of indexes.

For more information about the SubMixType and FinalMixType mix buffers, see Mix Buffers in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

◆ SetLightLimiterInputOutput()

void nn::audio::SetLightLimiterInputOutput ( LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
const int8_t *  input,
const int8_t *  output,
int  count 
)
noexcept

Sets the LightLimiterType input/output mix buffer indexes.

Parameters
[out]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]inputThe array of indexes of input mix buffers to set in pEffect.
[in]outputThe array of indexes of output mix buffers to set in pEffect.
[in]countThe number of mix buffer indexes stored in input and output.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • input != nullptr.
  • output != nullptr.
  • count <= nn::audio::GetLightLimiterChannelCountMax "nn::audio::GetLightLimiterChannelCountMax(pEffect)".
  • (count == 1) || (count == 2) || (count == 4) || (count == 6).

Details
Sets the input/output relationship for effect processing by LightLimiterType. The mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the input array are set as the input mix buffers, and the mix buffers corresponding to the indices specified for the output array are set as the output mix buffers. The same mix buffer indices can be specified for both input and output.

There are common rules for setting the input/output buffer relationship for each type of effect. For more information, see nn::audio::SetBufferMixerInputOutput().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ IsLightLimiterEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsLightLimiterEnabled ( const LightLimiterType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Determines whether LightLimiterType is enabled.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if enabled, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

◆ SetLightLimiterEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetLightLimiterEnabled ( LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
bool  enable 
)
noexcept

Sets whether LightLimiterType is enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]enabletrue to enable, or false to disable.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::IsLightLimiterEnabled "nn::audio::IsLightLimiterEnabled(pEffect)" == enable.

Details
When enabled, the effect processing is performed on the contents of the input mix buffers and written to the output mix buffers according to the input/output relationship specified by the nn::audio::SetLightLimiterInputOutput() function. When the effect is disabled, the contents of the input mix buffers are output as is to the output mix buffers without applying the effect.

Other parameters retain their values after the SetLightLimiterEnabled() function is called, but the internal state of pEffect is cleared if true has been specified for the enable parameter.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ IsLightLimiterRemovable()

bool nn::audio::IsLightLimiterRemovable ( const LightLimiterType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Determines whether the LightLimiterType object can be safely removed.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns true if possible.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
An effect can only be removed if the audio renderer has completely stopped using that effect. Before calling the nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter() function, use this function to check whether the instance of pEffect that you want to remove is no longer being used. Note the following.

  • The use of an effect does not stop immediately after it has disabled by the nn::audio::SetLightLimiterEnabled() function.
  • It can take up to two audio frames for the use of the effect to stop after the effect has been disabled by nn::audio::SetLightLimiterEnabled() and the call to nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() has completed.
  • Do not call the nn::audio::RemoveLightLimiter() function during this time.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetLightLimiterThreshold()

float nn::audio::GetLightLimiterThreshold ( const LightLimiterType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Gets the threshold of LightLimiterType.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Returns the threshold.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
For the threshold, 1.0f is treated as the full range. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function.

float  value 
)

Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • 0.0f <= value.
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetLightLimiterThreshold "nn::audio::GetLightLimiterThreshold(pEffect)" == value.

Details
For the threshold, 1.0f is treated as the full range. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

noexcept

◆ SetLightLimiterParameters()

void nn::audio::SetLightLimiterParameters ( LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
const LightLimiterParameterSet *  pParameterSet 
)
noexcept

Sets the LightLimiterType effect parameters.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]pParameterSetThe effect parameters to set for LightLimiterType.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • pParameterSet != nullptr.
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= pParameterSet->attackTime && pParameterSet->attackTime < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0) <= pParameterSet->releaseTime && pParameterSet->releaseTime < nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()).
  • nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds "nn::TimeSpan::FromMicroSeconds(0)" <= pParameterSet->lookAheadTime && pParameterSet->lookAheadTime <= GetLightLimiterLookAheadTimeMax "nn::audio::GetLightLimiterLookAheadTimeMax(pEffect)".
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->threshold.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->inputGain.
  • 0.0f <= pParameterSet->outputGain.

Details
For more information about the meanings of the LightLimiter parameters, see Audio Effects. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ IsLightLimiterStatisticsEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsLightLimiterStatisticsEnabled ( const LightLimiterType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Determines whether the LightLimiterType feature for getting statistics is enabled.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Returns
Whether the LightLimiterType feature for getting statistics is enabled or disabled.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
The default return value is false. To enable the feature for getting statistics, call the SetLightLimiterStatisticsEnabled() function.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ SetLightLimiterStatisticsEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetLightLimiterStatisticsEnabled ( LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
bool  isEnabled 
)
noexcept

Switches between enabling and disabling the LightLimiterType feature for getting statistics.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]isEnabledWhether the LightLimiterType feature for getting statistics is enabled or disabled.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
The feature for getting statistics is disabled by default. If you want to get statistics, use this function to enable the feature. When the feature is enabled, the audio rendering processing load increases due to the calculating and writing of statistics.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ GetLightLimiterChannelStatistics()

void nn::audio::GetLightLimiterChannelStatistics ( LightLimiterChannelStatistics *  pOutStatistics,
const LightLimiterType *  pEffect,
int  channel 
)
noexcept

Gets statistics for each channel resulting from the LightLimiterType processing.

Parameters
[out]pOutStatisticsThe statistics for the specified channel resulting from the LightLimiterType processing.
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
[in]channelThe index of the channel to get information about.
Precondition
  • pOutStatistics != nullptr.
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.
  • 0 <= channel < nn::audio::GetLightLimiterChannelCountMax(pEffect).

Details
The starting point of the segment of statistics is either the point immediately after the initialization of the effect, or the point when the statistics were last reset. As a result, the statistics includes information about multiple audio frames. To reset the statistics, call the ResetLightLimiterStatistics() function.

LightLimiterChannelStatistics::inputPeak represents the peak value of the input signal. In other words, this is the value when amplitude of the input signal processed by LightLimiterType is at its maximum absolute value. The full range is treated as 1.0f.

LightLimiterChannelStatistics::gainControlMin is the minimum value of the ratio of the input signal amplitude to the output signal amplitude. Said another way, it is the ratio of the amplitudes of the input and output signals when the greatest limiting is applied to the signal by LightLimiterType. If limiting is not applied to the signal, the value 1.0f is returned. If limiting is applied to the signal, some positive value less than 1.0f is returned.

If either IsLightLimiterEnabled() or IsLightLimiterStatisticsEnabled() is false, the statistics are not updated.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ ResetLightLimiterStatistics()

void nn::audio::ResetLightLimiterStatistics ( LightLimiterType *  pEffect)
noexcept

Resets the statistics resulting from the LightLimiterType processing.

Parameters
[in]pEffectThe initialized LightLimiterType added to SubMixType or FinalMixType.
Precondition
  • pEffect != nullptr.
  • pEffect is initialized.

Details
Resets the value obtained with the GetLightLimiterChannelStatistics() function to the initial value. This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pEffect during the call to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp.

◆ AcquireFinalMix()

bool nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
FinalMixType *  pOutFinalMix,
int  bufferCount 
)
noexcept

Initializes FinalMixType and adds it to the AudioRendererConfig.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when getting the audio renderer that will add FinalMixType.
[out]pOutFinalMixThe FinalMixType structure.
[in]bufferCountThe number of FinalMixType buffers.
Returns
Returns true if the FinalMixType is available, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • The AudioRenderer associated with pOutConfig is stopped.
  • pOutFinalMix != nullptr.
  • bufferCount > 0 && bufferCount <= nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax.

Details
FinalMixType manages the remix buffer that stores the data that will become the final output from the audio renderer.

The total number of mix buffers that can be used by a single audio renderer is nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount. This function gets bufferCount mix buffers of the nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount total mix buffers and initializes them as management targets for pOutFinalMix. A single audio renderer never manages more than nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount mix buffers. After specifying the required number of mix buffers for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount, assign them as needed to instances of SubMixType and FinalMixType. For more information about mix buffers, see Audio Library in NintendoSDK Documents.

A single FinalMixType can store up to nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax mix buffers.

Only one FinalMixType can be retrieved per AudioRendererConfig.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ ReleaseFinalMix()

void nn::audio::ReleaseFinalMix ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireFinalMix() initializes pFinalMix.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType structure.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • The AudioRenderer associated with pOutConfig is stopped.
  • pOutFinalMix != nullptr.

Details
nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetFinalMixVolume()

float nn::audio::GetFinalMixVolume ( const FinalMixType *  pFinalMix)
noexcept

Gets the volume of the FinalMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType structure.
Returns
Returns the volume.
Precondition
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.

◆ SetFinalMixVolume()

void nn::audio::SetFinalMixVolume ( FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
float  volume 
)
noexcept

Sets the volume for the FinalMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMixType structure.
[in]volumeVolume.
Precondition
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.
  • nn::audio::FinalMixType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::FinalMixType::GetVolumeMax().

Details
Immediately after initialization, the volume of the FinalMixType is 1.0f.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pFinalMix while calling this function.

Note
Audio cutoff may occur depending on the set volume value. If audio cutoff occurs, verify that the volume is within appropriate values.

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetFinalMixNodeId()

NodeId nn::audio::GetFinalMixNodeId ( const FinalMixType *  pFinalMix)
noexcept

Gets the ID of the FinalMixType in the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pFinalMixFinalMixType
Returns
Returns NodeId.
Precondition
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.

Details
NodeId is a numeric value that uniquely identifies the VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType objects registered to the audio renderer. The various NodeId objects are never duplicated within a single audio renderer. A NodeId is assigned for each instance of each added VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType.

◆ GetFinalMixSampleRate()

int nn::audio::GetFinalMixSampleRate ( const FinalMixType *  pFinalMix)
noexcept

Gets the sample rate of the FinalMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pFinalMixFinalMixType
Returns
Returns the sample rate.
Precondition
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix is initialized.

Details
The FinalMixType sample rate is determined when the audio renderer is initialized, and is specified using the nn::audio::AudioRendererParemter.sampleRate value. The sample rate obtained with this function must match this value specified during initialization.

◆ AcquireMemoryPool()

bool nn::audio::AcquireMemoryPool ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
MemoryPoolType *  pOutPool,
void *  address,
size_t  size 
)
noexcept

Gets a memory pool for an audio renderer.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig.
[out]pOutPoolMemory pool.
[in]addressThe address to the memory managed by the memory pool.
[in]sizeThe size of the memory managed by the memory pool.
Returns
Returns true if the retrieval process succeeds.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutPool != nullptr.
  • address != Created internally when nullptr is specified..
  • address is aligned to MemoryPoolType::AddressAlignment.
  • size is aligned to MemoryPoolType::SizeGranularity.
  • The memory space passed by address and size does not include any regions used by other memory pools.

Details
Resource data that is accessed directly by an audio renderer must be contained in the memory region specified for the memory pool. For the list of resource data that needs to be included in this memory pool, see nn::audio::MemoryPoolType.

When the audio renderer accesses any of these types of memory, this function gets the memory pool and calls the nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool() to attach the memory pool to the audio renderer. Do not access the memory managed by a memory pool while that memory pool is in the attached state. However, you can use the nn::audio::CopyMemoryPoolData() function if you need to work on the data contained in a memory pool while it is still attached. For more information, see nn::audio::CopyMemoryPoolData().

While using a memory pool, the memory region specified using the address and size parameters is never overwritten.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AcquireMemoryPool(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, MemoryPoolType* pOutPool, void* address, size_t size)
  • nn::audio::ReleaseMemoryPool(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, MemoryPoolType* pPool)
  • nn::audio::GetReleasedMemoryPoolCount(const AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, and CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp.

◆ ReleaseMemoryPool()

void nn::audio::ReleaseMemoryPool ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
MemoryPoolType *  pPool 
)
noexcept

Deletes a memory pool that was created for an audio renderer.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig.
[in]pPoolMemory pool.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pPool is initialized.
  • nn::audio::IsMemoryPoolAttached(pPool) == false.
  • pPool is not currently transitioning to the attached or detached state.

Details
Removes the specified memory pool (pPool) from the audio renderer. Before calling this function, use the nn::audio::IsMemoryPoolAttached() function to check whether the memory pool can be deleted.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::AcquireMemoryPool(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, MemoryPoolType* pOutPool, void* address, size_t size)
  • nn::audio::ReleaseMemoryPool(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, MemoryPoolType* pPool)
  • nn::audio::GetReleasedMemoryPoolCount(const AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, and CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp.

◆ RequestAttachMemoryPool()

bool nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool ( MemoryPoolType *  pPool)
noexcept

Attaches a memory pool to an audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pPoolMemory pool.
Returns
Returns true on success.
Precondition
  • pPool != nullptr.
  • pPool is initialized.

Details
Requests attachment of all of the memory managed by pPool to the audio renderer.

This function has the following behaviors based on the state of pPool.

  • If nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState(pPool) == MemoryPoolType::State_Detached, this function transitions pPool to the request attachment state (State_RequestAttach) and returns true. pPool in the request attach state transitions to the attached state (State_Attached) the next time nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is called.
  • If nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState(pPool) == MemoryPoolType::State_RequestDetach, this function transitions pPool to the attached state (State_Attached) and returns true. This behavior is equivalent to canceling detachment requests using nn::audio::RequestDetachMemoryPool().
  • If nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState(pPool) is in another state , this function returns false without performing any operation on pPool.

For more information about each state, see nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState() and the Memory Pool documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not manipulate pPool during calls to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, and CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp.

◆ RequestDetachMemoryPool()

bool nn::audio::RequestDetachMemoryPool ( MemoryPoolType *  pPool)
noexcept

Detaches a memory pool from an audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pPoolMemory pool.
Returns
Returns true on success.
Precondition
  • pPool != nullptr.
  • pPool is initialized.

Details
Requests detachment of all of the memory managed by pPool from the audio renderer.

This function has the following behaviors based on the state of pPool.

  • If nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState(pPool) == MemoryPoolType::State_Attached, this function transitions pPool to the request detachment state (State_RequestDetach)) and returns true. pPool in the request attach state transitions to the detached state (State_Detached) the next time nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is called.
  • If nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState(pPool) == MemoryPoolType::State_RequestAttach this function transitions pPool to the detached state (State_Detached) and returns true. This behavior is equivalent to canceling attachment requests using nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool().
  • If nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState(pPool) is in another state , this function returns false without performing any operation on pPool.

For more information about each state, see nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState() and the Memory Pool documentation.

When nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is called for memory pools in the request detach state (State_RequestDetach), the system checks whether the data being used is included in the resource data directly referenced by the audio renderer. The memory pool only transitions to the detached state (State_Detached) if the check results indicate that there is no data that is currently being used. For the data considered as "resource data directly referenced by the audio renderer," see the description of nn::audio::MemoryPoolType. If the resources in the memory pool are being used by the audio renderer, the detachment will not complete, and the memory remains in the request detach state (State_RequestDetach). If detachment does not complete as expected, check that the various data described in "resource data directly referenced by the audio renderer" in the nn::audio::MemoryPoolType is not included in pPool, and whether they are being used by the audio renderer.

The request detach state is maintained until detachment is complete. For this reason, after this function has been called nn::audio determines whether pPool can transition to the detached state every time nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is called, and transitions as soon as possible.

Use the nn::audio::IsMemoryPoolAttached() or nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState() function to check whether the transition to the detached state is complete.

Memory space held in an attached memory pool can be used for loading files by nn::fs and can be overwritten by nn::audio::CopyMemoryPoolData(). However, writing to a region at the same time that is being accessed by the audio renderer can cause noise and unstable behavior. To access the memory space held in a memory pool, either use this function to detach the memory pool beforehand, or avoid accessing memory spaces while they are being used by the audio renderer.

If the audio renderer that added the attached memory pool is destroyed by nn::audio::CloseAudioRenderer(), it automatically performs a process internally that is equivalent to detaching the memory pool. As a result, there is no need to explicitly detach or remove the memory pool when the audio renderer is destroyed. Note, however, that each MemoryPoolType instance loses its association with the audio renderer as soon as the audio renderer is destroyed, so the states will not correctly correspond to the true states. To be specific, if the audio renderer is destroyed while a memory pool is in the attached state, nn::audio::IsMemoryPoolAttached() continues to return true and nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState() continues to return State_Attached, but the region used by pPool can be safely reused.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not manipulate pPool during calls to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, and CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp.

◆ IsMemoryPoolAttached()

bool nn::audio::IsMemoryPoolAttached ( const MemoryPoolType *  pPool)
noexcept

Determines whether a memory pool is currently attached.

Parameters
[in]pPoolMemory pool.
Returns
Returns true if the memory pool is attached or false if the memory pool is detached.
Precondition
  • pPool != nullptr.
  • pPool is initialized.

Details
Returns true when this function is called for memory pools that were attached using the nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool() function. Be careful because true is returned immediately at the point where calling nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool() is complete before nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() finishes transitioning to the attached state. Returns false for memory pools that were detached using the nn::audio::RequestDetachMemoryPool() function after all processes using the corresponding memory region specified for pPool are complete. Use this function to check whether a memory pool can be deleted before calling the nn::audio::ReleaseMemoryPool() function.

In addition to this function, you can also get the state of the memory pool from the nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState() function. Returns true if the memory pool is in the State_RequestAttach, State_Attached, or State_RequestDetach state. For more information about each state, see nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState() and the Memory Pool documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not manipulate pPool during calls to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, and CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp.

◆ GetMemoryPoolState()

MemoryPoolType::State nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolState ( const MemoryPoolType *  pPool)
noexcept

Gets the memory pool state.

Parameters
[in]pPoolMemory pool.
Returns
Returns an enumerated type representing the state of the memory pool.
Precondition
  • pPool != nullptr.
  • pPool is initialized.

Details
Gets the state of the memory pool specified by nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool() or nn::audio::RequestDetachMemoryPool(). The meaning of each state is as follows.

  • State_RequestAttach indicates the state where calling nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool() is complete and attachment is requested. Memory pools in this state will transition to State_Attached during the next nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer().
  • State_Attached is the state where attachment is complete.
  • State_RequestAttach indicates the state where calling nn::audio::RequestAttachMemoryPool() is complete and detachment is requested. Memory pools in this state transition to State_Detached when nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is next called so long as pPool is not in use by the audio renderer.
  • State_Detached is the state where detachment is complete. Memory pools are in this state immediately after initialization by nn::audio::AcquireMemoryPool().

For more information about each state, see Memory Pool documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not manipulate pPool during calls to this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetReleasedMemoryPoolCount()

int nn::audio::GetReleasedMemoryPoolCount ( const AudioRendererConfig *  pConfig)
noexcept

Gets the number of memory pools that can be retrieved.

Parameters
[in]pConfigAudioRendererConfig.
Returns
Returns the number of memory pools.
Precondition
  • pConfig != nullptr.
  • pConfig is initialized.

Details
The number of memory pools is determined by the nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter settings used when pConfig is initialized. Although up to the number of memory pools returned by this function can be retrieved, overall performance efficiency increases as the number of memory pools used decreases. If the number of memory pools is still too small, consider reorganizing your resource data.

While this function is being used, nn::audio partially locks access to pConfig. Note that the following functions, which use the same pConfig, may become blocked.

  • nn::audio::AcquireMemoryPool(AudioRendererConfig* pConfig, MemoryPoolType* pOutPool, void* address, size_t size)
  • nn::audio::ReleaseMemoryPool(AudioRendererConfig* pConfig, MemoryPoolType* pPool)
  • nn::audio::GetReleasedMemoryPoolCount(const AudioRendererConfig* pConfig)

Gets the address of a memory region managed by a memory pool.

Returns
Returns the address.
Precondition
  • pPool != nullptr.
  • pPool is initialized.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not manipulate pPool during calls to this function.

Examples
AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp.

size_t nn::audio::GetMemoryPoolSize ( const MemoryPoolType *  pPool)
noexcept

Gets the size of a memory region managed by a memory pool.

◆ CopyMemoryPoolData()

void* nn::audio::CopyMemoryPoolData ( const MemoryPoolType *  pPool,
void *  dst,
const void *  src,
size_t  size 
)
noexcept

Reads or writes data to a memory region managed by a memory pool.

Parameters
[in]pPoolMemory pool.
[out]dstThe memory to which to copy the data.
[in]srcThe memory from which to copy data.
[in]sizeThe size of the data to copy (in bytes).
Returns
Returns dst.
Precondition
  • pPool != nullptr.
  • pPool is initialized.
  • One or both of the memory regions specified by dst and src are contained within pPool.
  • dst != nullptr.
  • src != nullptr.
  • The dst and src memory regions do not overlap at all.

Details
This function provides safe access to memory pools that are in the attached state. This function makes it possible to overwrite the data in a buffer contained in a WaveBuffer object returned by the nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer() function, for example, even if the corresponding memory pool is still attached. Even when using this function, however, do not attempt operations on memory regions in attached memory pools that are currently being used by an audio renderer.

◆ SetPerformanceFrameBuffer()

void* nn::audio::SetPerformanceFrameBuffer ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize 
)
noexcept

Sets a starting address to output performance information to.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig object initialized when you get the audio renderer to get performance information.
[in]bufferThe memory space to which the audio renderer writes performance information.
[in]bufferSizeThe size of the region specified for buffer.
Returns
The address that was set for buffer the last time this function was called.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • config is initialized.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.

Details
Sets the address of the region specified for buffer. Audio renderers output performance information to this buffer. If a buffer has already been set and a new region is specified for buffer, the function returns the address of the region specified for buffer the last time the function was called.

The audio renderer writes data to the region specified for buffer during calls to the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function. Do not access buffer during calls to nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer().

If you specify nullptr for buffer, no data will be output. By default, nullptr is specified for buffer, therefore nn::audio::SetPerformanceFrameBuffer() will not output data unless this function specifies some other value than nullptr.

The value returned by this function refers to the starting address of the performance frame. Cast this address to nn::audio::PerformanceFrameHeader* to use and parse the performance frame. nn::audio::PerformanceInfo has been prepared to make this process easier.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceFrameBuffer(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, void* buffer, size_t bufferSize)
  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, const VoiceType* pVoice)
  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, const SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, const FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • nn::audio::ClearPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig)
Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForPerformanceFrames()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForPerformanceFrames ( const AudioRendererParameter &  parameter)
noexcept

Gets the required size for the memory region to which performance information will be written.

Parameters
[in]parameterThe parameter used when getting the audio renderer that will get the performance information.
Returns
The size of memory required to output the performance information.
Precondition
  • parameter != nullptr.

Details
At the time this is obtained, the audio renderer is holding x frames worth of performance information, where x is the number of frames specified by nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.performanceFrameCount. The performance information being held by the audio renderer is written to the memory region specified by the nn::audio::SetPerformanceFrameBuffer() function. This function calculates and returns the size of the memory region that nn::audio::SetPerformanceFrameBuffer() should have. For parameter, specify the parameter that was specified when the audio renderer was opened.

Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp.

◆ SetPerformanceDetailTarget() [1/3]

void nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
const VoiceType *  pVoice 
)
noexcept

Sets the target VoiceType for which to get detailed performance information.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig object initialized when you get the audio renderer to get performance information.
[in]pVoiceThe VoiceType to set as the target.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • config is initialized.
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
PerformanceDetail is not available until a value is specified by this function. Only one instance of the target can be set, regardless of whether the type is VoiceType, SubMixType, or FinalMixType. The target is replaced by reconfiguring the setting and calling nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget() again.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceFrameBuffer(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, void* buffer, size_t bufferSize)
  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, const VoiceType* pVoice)
  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, const SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • nn::audio::SetPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, const FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • nn::audio::ClearPerformanceDetailTarget(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig)
Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForPolyphaseResampler()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForPolyphaseResampler ( int  inputSampleRate,
int  outputSampleRate,
int  channelCount,
bool  isHighQuality 
)
noexcept

Determines the size of the buffer required for the polyphase resampler.

Parameters
[in]inputSampleRateInput sample rate.
[in]outputSampleRateOutput sample rate.
[in]channelCountNumber of channels.
[in]isHighQualityThe sound quality flag. (Specify true to use a 32 tap filter for internal processing, or false to use a 16 tap filter.)
Precondition
  • channelCount > 0.
  • channelCount <= PolyphaseResamplerType::ChannelCountMax.
  • inputSampleRate > 0.
  • outputSampleRate > 0.
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate >= PolyphaseResamplerType::GetConversionRatioMin().
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate <= PolyphaseResamplerType::GetConversionRatioMax().
Returns
Returns the required buffer size.

◆ CalculatePolyphaseResamplerActualOutputSampleRate()

double nn::audio::CalculatePolyphaseResamplerActualOutputSampleRate ( int  inputSampleRate,
int  outputSampleRate 
)
noexcept

Calculates the actual output sample rate for the polyphase resampler.

Parameters
[in]inputSampleRateInput sample rate.
[in]outputSampleRateOutput sample rate.
Precondition
  • inputSampleRate > 0.
  • outputSampleRate > 0.
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate >= PolyphaseResamplerType::GetConversionRatioMin().
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate <= PolyphaseResamplerType::GetConversionRatioMax().
Returns
Returns the actual output sample rate. The result might not be an integer value.

Details
The polyphase resampler works most efficiently when the ratio of input and output sample rates is a rational expression where the denominator and the numerator are both positive integers of 255 or less. If the values for inputSampleRate and outputSampleRate do not satisfy this condition, the polyphase resampler converts the output sample rate to the nearest value that satisfies this condition and then performs its process. This function calculates the actual output sample rate based on the input sample rate.

◆ GetPolyphaseResamplerOutputSampleCount()

int nn::audio::GetPolyphaseResamplerOutputSampleCount ( const PolyphaseResamplerType *  pResampler,
int  inputSampleCount 
)
noexcept

Calculates the maximum number of output samples that will be obtained from the polyphase resampler process based on the number of input samples.

Parameters
[in]pResamplerPointer to the PolyphaseResamplerType structure.
[in]inputSampleCountNumber of input samples.
Returns
Returns the maximum number of output samples.
Precondition
  • pResampler != nullptr.
  • pResampler has been initialized by the nn::audio::InitializePolyphaseResampler() function.

Details
This function returns the maximum number of output samples for which output buffer space must be allocated. Note that because the system internally allocates a prescribed amount of space as a margin of error, the value returned by this function may not necessarily match the number of samples obtained from the actual process. The actual number of output samples is the value obtained upon calling the nn::audio::ProcessPolyphaseResamplerBuffer() function.

◆ InitializePolyphaseResampler()

Result nn::audio::InitializePolyphaseResampler ( PolyphaseResamplerType *  pResampler,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
int  inputSampleRate,
int  outputSampleRate,
int  channelCount,
bool  isHighQuality,
float  gain 
)
noexcept

Initializes the polyphase resampler.

Parameters
[out]pResamplerPointer to the PolyphaseResamplerType structure.
[out]bufferThe work buffer.
[in]bufferSizeSize of the buffer.
[in]inputSampleRateInput sample rate.
[in]outputSampleRateOutput sample rate.
[in]channelCountNumber of channels.
[in]isHighQualityThe sound quality flag. (Specify true to use a 32 tap filter for internal processing, or false to use a 16 tap filter.)
[in]gainThe gain. (A value in the range of 0.0f to 1.0f. If the specified value is out of range, it will be clamped internally.)
Precondition
  • pResampler != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • inputSampleRate > 0.
  • outputSampleRate > 0.
  • bufferSize >= GetRequiredBufferSizeForPolyphaseResampler().
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate >= PolyphaseResamplerType::GetConversionRatioMin().
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate <= PolyphaseResamplerType::GetConversionRatioMax().
  • channelCount > 0.
  • channelCount <= PolyphaseResamplerType::ChannelCountMax.
Postcondition
  • pResampler is initialized.

◆ ProcessPolyphaseResamplerBuffer()

Result nn::audio::ProcessPolyphaseResamplerBuffer ( PolyphaseResamplerType *  pResampler,
int *  pOutputSampleCount,
int16_t *  pOutputBuffer,
size_t  outputBufferSize,
const int16_t *  pInputBuffer,
int  inputSampleCount 
)
noexcept

Uses the polyphase resampler to convert the frequency.

Parameters
[in,out]pResamplerPointer to the PolyphaseResamplerType structure.
[out]pOutputSampleCountNumber of output samples.
[out]pOutputBufferOutput buffer.
[in]outputBufferSizeSize of the output buffer.
[in]pInputBufferInput buffer.
[in]inputSampleCountNumber of input samples.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultInsufficientBuffer must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutputBuffer != nullptr.
  • pInputBuffer != nullptr.
  • pResampler != nullptr.
  • pResampler has been initialized by the nn::audio::InitializePolyphaseResampler() function.
Postcondition
  • *pOutputSampleCount data with changed frequency is written to pOutputBuffer.

  • channelCount <= ResamplerType::ChannelCountMax.

Returns the required buffer size.

◆ GetResamplerOutputSampleCount()

int nn::audio::GetResamplerOutputSampleCount ( const ResamplerType *  pResampler,
int  inputSampleCount 
)
noexcept

Calculates the maximum number of output samples that will be obtained from the resampler process based on the number of input samples.

Parameters
[in]pResamplerPointer to the ResamplerType structure.
[in]inputSampleCountNumber of input samples.
Returns
Returns the maximum number of output samples.
Precondition
  • pResampler != nullptr.
  • pResampler has been initialized by the nn::audio::InitializeResampler() function.

Details
This function returns the maximum number of output samples for which output buffer space must be allocated. Note that because the system internally allocates a prescribed amount of space as a margin of error, the value returned by this function may not necessarily match the number of samples obtained from the actual process. The actual number of output samples is the value obtained upon calling the nn::audio::ProcessResamplerBuffer() function.

◆ InitializeResampler()

Result nn::audio::InitializeResampler ( ResamplerType *  pResampler,
void *  buffer,
size_t  bufferSize,
int  inputSampleRate,
int  outputSampleRate,
int  channelCount 
)
noexcept

Initializes the resampler.

Parameters
[out]pResamplerPointer to the ResamplerType structure.
[out]bufferWork buffer.
[in]bufferSizeSize of the buffer.
[in]inputSampleRateInput sample rate.
[in]outputSampleRateOutput sample rate.
[in]channelCountNumber of channels.
Precondition
  • pResampler != nullptr.
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • inputSampleRate > 0.
  • outputSampleRate > 0.
  • bufferSize >= nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForResampler(<var>channelCount</var>).
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate >= ResamplerType::GetConvertRatioMin().
  • outputSampleRate / inputSampleRate <= ResamplerType::GetConvertRatioMax().
Postcondition
  • pResampler is initialized.

Result nn::audio::ProcessResamplerBuffer ( ResamplerType *  pResampler,
int *  pOutputSampleCount,
int16_t *  pOutputBuffer,

  • pInputBuffer != nullptr.
  • pResampler != nullptr.
  • pResampler has been initialized by the nn::audio::InitializeResampler() function.
