◆ AddDeviceSink()

Result nn::audio::AddDeviceSink ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
DeviceSinkType *  pOutSink,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
const int8_t *  input,
int  inputCount,
const char *  name 
)
noexcept

Initializes a sink for the audio output device.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig.
[out]pOutSinkPointer to a Sink structure.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMix structure.
[in]inputThe array of indexes for the mix buffers that serve as input to the Sink object.
[in]inputCountNumber of indices of mix buffers that serve as input for the sink.
[in]nameName of the audio output device.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • The AudioRenderer associated with pOutConfig is stopped.
  • The operating mode of the AudioRenderer object linked to pOutConfig is nn::audio::AudioRendererExecutionMode_AutoExecution.
  • pOutSink != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • input != nullptr.
  • 0 < inputCount && inputCount <= nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax.
  • inputCount <= nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pFinalMix).
  • name is a valid object.

Details
Used to output the content of mix buffers to audio output devices. The content is output for the mix buffers whose indexes were specified by input. For N number of audio output device channels:

  • If inputCount > N, channels input[0] through input[N – 1] are applied to the output.
  • If inputCount < N, input[0] through input[inputCount – 1] is applied to the output. Output is silent for channels from the inputCount position onward.

DeviceSink may perform downmixing depending on the platform. For more information, see Sink in the Audio Renderer documentation.

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ RemoveDeviceSink()

void nn::audio::RemoveDeviceSink ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
DeviceSinkType *  pSink,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Finalizes a sink for the audio output device.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig.
[out]pSinkPointer to a Sink structure.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMix structure.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • The AudioRenderer associated with pOutConfig is stopped.
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.

Details
Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ SetDownMixParameter()

void nn::audio::SetDownMixParameter ( DeviceSinkType *  pSink,
const DeviceSinkType::DownMixParameter *  pParameter 
)
noexcept

Sets the parameter to use for downmixing.

Parameters
[in]pSinkThe audio output device for which to set the parameter.
[in]pParameterThe parameter value to set.
Precondition
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pSink is initialized.
  • pParameter != nullptr.

Details
nn::audio has a system default downmixing process. When the number of channels for the audio output devices is set to two-channel or monaural output, this default process downmixes the output from 6 channels to 2 channels for all audio outputs on the platform and for the audio renderer. For more information about the downmixing calculations performed at this time, see DeviceSinkType in the Audio Renderer documentation.

But the audio renderer also has a process for application-specific downmixing. When application-specific downmixing is enabled, each audio renderer can downmix using any specified coefficient instead of the system default process. However, this process is specific to each audio renderer, so PerformanceEntryType_Sink for nn::audio::PerformanceEntry takes longer to process.

This function sets the parameter to use for application-specific downmixing. For application-specific downmixing to work, you must enable the process using nn::audio::SetDownMixParameterEnabled() in addition to setting the parameter using this function. For more information about the relationship between the value specified by pParameter and the calculation performed for downmixing, see the DeviceSinkType section in the Audio Renderer documentation.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSink while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ GetDownMixParameter()

void nn::audio::GetDownMixParameter ( DeviceSinkType::DownMixParameter *  pOutParameter,
const DeviceSinkType *  pSink 
)
noexcept

Gets the parameter to use for downmixing.

Parameters
[out]pOutParameterA pointer to the location of the parameter.
[in]pSinkThe audio output device for which to set the parameter.
Precondition
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pSink is initialized.
  • pParameter != nullptr.

Details
Gets the parameter set by nn::audio::SetDownMixParameter(). If no value is specified, by default all nn::audio::DeviceSinkType::DownMixParameter::coeff[] take 0.0f.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSink while calling this function.

◆ SetDownMixParameterEnabled()

void nn::audio::SetDownMixParameterEnabled ( DeviceSinkType *  pSink,
bool  enabled 
)
noexcept

Sets whether to enable application-specific downmixing.

Parameters
[in]pSinkThe audio output device to set.
[in]enabledSet this parameter to true to enable.
Returns
Precondition
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pSink is initialized.

Details
To enable application-specific downmixing, call this function with enabled set to true. Setting this parameter to false enables the system default downmixing process. For more information about the different downmixing calculations, see nn::audio::SetDownMixParameter() and DeviceSinkType in the Audio Renderer documentation.

The default is false.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSink while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp.

◆ IsDownMixParameterEnabled()

bool nn::audio::IsDownMixParameterEnabled ( const DeviceSinkType *  pSink)
noexcept

Get whether application-specific downmixing is enabled or disabled.

Parameters
[in]pSinkThe audio output device to set.
Returns
Returns true if enabled.
Precondition
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pSink is initialized.

Details
Application-specific downmixing can be enabled and disabled using the nn::audio::SetDownMixParameterEnabled() function.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSink while calling this function.

◆ AddCircularBufferSink()

Result nn::audio::AddCircularBufferSink ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
CircularBufferSinkType *  pOutSink,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix,
const int8_t *  input,
int  inputCount,
void *  buffer,
size_t  size,
SampleFormat  sampleFormat 
)
noexcept

Initializes Sink for a circular buffer.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig.
[out]pOutSinkPointer to a Sink structure.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMix structure.
[in]inputThe array of indexes for the mix buffers that serve as input to the Sink object.
[in]inputCountNumber of indices of mix buffers that serve as input for the sink.
[in]bufferAddress of the output destination buffer.
[in]sizeSize of the buffer specified for buffer.
[in]sampleFormatThe sample format of the sample data written to the buffer.
Returns
Returns a nn::Result that represents the process result.
  • nn::audio::ResultOutOfResource must be handled.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutSink != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.
  • input != nullptr.
  • 0 < inputCount && inputCount <= nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax.
  • inputCount <= nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pFinalMix).
  • buffer != nullptr.
  • buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • sampleFormat == SampleFormat_PcmInt16.

Details
The Sink for the circular buffer is used to output the contents of the mix buffers to the specified memory. The array specified for input is an array of indexes for mix buffers managed by the FinalMixType specified by pFinalMix. To get the waveforms that are the final output to the audio renderer device associated with pOutConfig, specify the same array as was specified for the input parameter of nn::audio::DeviceSinkType.

The sample data is output to the memory space specified by buffer and size. The output sample data will be formatted in the format specified by sampleFormat. If inputCount > 1, sample data that was block interleaved to the buffer will be output. For more information, see nn::audio::ReadCircularBufferSink().

Note
  • sampleFormat only supports SampleFormat_PcmInt16 in the current release.
  • The memory region specified for buffer must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType.
  • Also, the instance of nn::audio::MemoryPoolType that contains the memory region specified for buffer must be in the attached state.

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, and AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp.

◆ RemoveCircularBufferSink()

void nn::audio::RemoveCircularBufferSink ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
CircularBufferSinkType *  pSink,
FinalMixType *  pFinalMix 
)
noexcept

Finalizes a sink for a circular buffer.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig.
[out]pSinkPointer to a Sink structure.
[in]pFinalMixThe FinalMix structure.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pFinalMix != nullptr.

Details
Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetRequiredBufferSizeForCircularBufferSink()

size_t nn::audio::GetRequiredBufferSizeForCircularBufferSink ( const AudioRendererParameter *  pParameter,
int  inputCount,
int  frameCount,
SampleFormat  sampleFormat 
)
noexcept

Gets the buffer size required for the circular buffer Sink.

Parameters
[in]pParameterThe AudioRendererParameter object that is specified when you get the audio renderer to which the circular buffer Sink is added.
[in]inputCountThe number of indexes for the mixed buffer that is used as input to the circular buffer Sink.
[in]frameCountThe number of audio frames maintained by the circular buffer Sink.
[in]sampleFormatThe sample format output by the circular buffer Sink.
Returns
Returns the buffer size required for the circular buffer Sink for the specified settings.
Precondition
  • pParameter != nullptr.
  • 0 < inputCount && inputCount <= nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax.
  • 0 < frameCount.
  • sampleFormat == SampleFormat_PcmInt16.

Details
inputCount specifies the number of mixed buffers for specifying input for the circular buffer Sink. (This number corresponds to the value specified for the inputCount parameter of nn::audio::AddCircularBufferSink().) frameCount specifies the length of buffers stored in the circular buffer Sink as a number of audio frames. The length of one audio frame is equivalent to the number of samples specified in AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount. sampleFormat specifies the format of the sample output by the circular buffer Sink. (sampleFormat only supports SampleFormat_PcmInt16 in the current release.)

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, and AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp.

◆ ReadCircularBufferSink()

size_t nn::audio::ReadCircularBufferSink ( CircularBufferSinkType *  pSink,
void *  pOutBuffer,
size_t  bufferSize 
)
noexcept

Load sample data from the circular buffer Sink.

Parameters
[in]pSinkpSink with audio renderer added.
[out]pOutBufferLoading destination buffer.
[in]bufferSizeSize of the buffer specified in pOutBuffer.
Returns
Returns the size of the sample data that was read by pOutBuffer.
Precondition
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pSink is initialized.
  • pOutBuffer != nullptr.

Details
Load the sample data stored in pSink to pOutBuffer. The circular buffer Sink controls each of the "positions that have already been written by the audio buffer" and the "positions loaded by this function." This function loads sample data that has not completed loading to pOutBuffer while it references these positions, using bufferSize as the maximum. If the data already written to pSink is smaller than bufferSize, only data already written will be loaded to pOutBuffer. In any case, the size of the sample data that was actually loaded to pOutBuffer will be the return value.

The data loaded to pOutBuffer will be the sample format specified by sampleFormat when pSink is initialized by nn::audio::AddCircularBufferSink(). In addition, the sample data will be block interleaved for each mix buffer. In other words, the number of samples for one audio frame will be stored for each mix buffer specified as an index by nn::audio::AddCircularBufferSink().

For example, for an audio renderer obtained by specifying AudioRendererParameter.sampleCount = 240, if pSink was initialized by nn::audio::AddCircularBufferSink() with index[] = {0, 1, 2} and sampleFormat = SampleFormat_PcmInt16, the sample data stored in pOutBuffer is stored in the following order: (240 samples of 16-bit signed integer PCM sample data for FinalMix mix buffer index 0), (240 samples of 16-bit signed integer PCM sample data for FinalMixM mix buffer index 1), and (240 samples of 16-bit signed integer PCM sample data for FinalMix mix buffer index 2).

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSink while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, and AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp.

◆ GetSinkNodeId() [1/2]

NodeId nn::audio::GetSinkNodeId ( const DeviceSinkType *  pSink)
noexcept

Gets the ID of the DeviceSinkType in the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pSinkPointer to a DeviceSinkType structure.
Returns
Returns NodeId.
Precondition
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pSink is initialized.

Details
NodeId is a numeric value that uniquely identifies the VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType objects registered to the audio renderer. The various NodeId objects are never duplicated within a single audio renderer. A NodeId is assigned for each instance of each added VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType.

◆ GetSinkNodeId() [2/2]

NodeId nn::audio::GetSinkNodeId ( const CircularBufferSinkType *  pSink)
noexcept

Gets the ID of the CircularBufferSinkType object in the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pSinkPointer to a CircularBufferSinkType structure.
Returns
Returns NodeId.
Precondition
  • pSink != nullptr.
  • pSink is initialized.

Details
NodeId is a numeric value that uniquely identifies the VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType objects registered to the audio renderer. The various NodeId objects are never duplicated within a single audio renderer. A NodeId is assigned for each instance of each added VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType.

◆ AcquireSplitter()

bool nn::audio::AcquireSplitter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SplitterType *  pOutSplitter,
int  sampleRate,
int  sourceChannelCount,
int  destinationCount 
)
noexcept

Initializes a SplitterType object and adds it to AudioRendererConfig.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when getting the audio renderer that will add SplitterType.
[out]pOutSplitterPointer to an uninitialized SplitterType structure.
[in]sampleRateSampling rate specified for pOutSplitter.
[in]sourceChannelCountThe number of channels specified to pOutSplitter from the input source VoiceType / SubMixType.
[in]destinationCountThe total number of SubMixType and FinalMixType objects used for pOutSplitter output.
Returns
Returns true if the Splitter is available, or false if not.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutSplitter != nullptr.
  • sampleRate > 0.
  • sourceChannelCount >= 1.
  • destinationCount >= 1.
Postcondition
  • pOutSplitter is initialized.

Details
SplitterType provides a feature to distribute sample data from the input source to multiple output destinations. Use sampleRate to specify the sample rate of the sample data distributed by pOutSplitter. This distribution process does not perform sample rate conversion. For that reason, the sample rate of the output destination specified by nn::audio::SetSplitterDestination() must be identical to the sample rate specified by the sampleRate function.

The number of VoiceType channels or SubMixType mix buffers that are used as the input source for pOutSplitter is specified in sourceChannelCount.

destinationCount specifies the total number of SubMixType and FinalMixType objects connected to pOutSplitter. SplitterType can have up to the number of output destinations specified in destinationCount, and maintain individual mix volumes for each output destination. The various output destinations are identified by the index specified by destinationIndex in nn::audio::SetSplitterDestination(), and this destinationIndex is defined by destinationCount as 0 <= destinationIndex < destinationCount.

The total number of SplitterType objects that can be added is the number specified by nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.splitterCount when the audio renderer is initialized. In addition, the total number of channels that can be output from all SplitterType objects is the number specified by the nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.splitterSendChannelCount function. When this function adds one SplitterType object, (sourceChannelCount * destinationCount) channels are used.

If this function returns false, there may be an insufficient number of nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.splitterCount or nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.splitterSendChannelCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireSplitter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSplitter, int sampleRate, int sourceChannelCount, int destinationCount)
  • ReleaseSplitter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSplitter)
  • SetSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex)

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutConfig or pOutSplitter while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ ReleaseSplitter()

void nn::audio::ReleaseSplitter ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SplitterType *  pOutSplitter 
)
noexcept

Deletes AudioRendererConfig from SplitterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig used when adding pOutSplitter.
[out]pOutSplitterSplitterType to delete.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutSplitter != nullptr.
  • pOutSplitter is initialized.

Details
nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireSplitter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSplitter, int sampleRate, int sourceChannelCount, int destinationCount)
  • ReleaseSplitter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSplitter)
  • SetSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex)

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutConfig or pOutSplitter while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ SetSplitterDestination() [1/2]

void nn::audio::SetSplitterDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SplitterType *  pOutSource,
int  destinationIndex,
SubMixType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Specifies the SubMix as one output destination for SplitterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig used when adding pOutSplitter.
[out]pOutSourceSplitterType that specifies the output destinations.
[in]destinationIndexpOutSource output destination index.
[in]pDestinationThe SubMixType specified as the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • 0 <= destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSplitterDestinationCount(pOutSource).
  • pOutSource != nullptr.
  • pOutSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::GetSplitterSampleRate(pOutSource) == nn::audio::GetSubMixSampleRate(pDestination).

Details
SplitterType can have a number of output destinations equivalent to the value specified by the destinationCount parameter in the nn::audio::AcquireSplitter() function. This function specifies pDestination as the destinationIndex number output destination of the pOutSource. SplitterType does not perform sample rate conversion. For this reason, the sample rate of the output destination specified for pDestination must be identical to the sample rate obtained with nn::audio::GetSplitterSampleRate(pOutSource).

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireSplitter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSplitter, int sampleRate, int sourceChannelCount, int destinationCount)
  • ReleaseSplitter(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSplitter)
  • SetSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex)

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutConfig or pOutSplitter while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ SetSplitterDestination() [2/2]

void nn::audio::SetSplitterDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SplitterType *  pOutSource,
int  destinationIndex,
FinalMixType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Specifies FinalMixMix as one output destination for SplitterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig used when adding pOutSplitter.
[out]pOutSourceSplitterType that specifies the output destinations.
[in]destinationIndexpOutSource output destination index.
[in]pDestinationThe FinalMixType specified as the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutSource is initialized.
  • pOutSource != nullptr.
  • 0 <= destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSplitterDestinationCount(pOutSource).
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::GetSplitterSampleRate(pOutSource) == nn::audio::GetFinalMixSampleRate(pDestination).

Details
The features of this function are identical to nn::audio::SetSplitterDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, SubMixType* pDestination) except for the fact that the pDestination type is nn::audio::FinalMixType. For more information, see the API Reference. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ ClearSplitterDestination()

void nn::audio::ClearSplitterDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SplitterType *  pOutSource,
int  destinationIndex 
)
noexcept

Clears the output destination specified for SplitterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigAudioRendererConfig used when adding pOutSplitter.
[out]pOutSourceThe SplitterType structure.
[in]destinationIndexpOutSource output destination index.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutSplitter != nullptr.
  • pOutSplitter is initialized.
  • 0 <= destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSplitterDestinationCount(pOutSource).

Details
For the operations on pOutConfig this function is thread-safe, but for the operations on pOutSource it is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSource while calling this function.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited. For more information, see RequestUpdateAudioRenderer().

◆ SetSplitterMixVolume() [1/2]

void nn::audio::SetSplitterMixVolume ( SplitterType *  pOutSource,
int  destinationIndex,
SubMixType *  pDestination,
float  volume,
int  sourceChannelIndex,
int  destinationChannelIndex 
)
noexcept

Sets the mix volume for the output destinations from SplitterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutSourceThe SplitterType that sets the volume.
[in]destinationIndexOutput destination index that pDestination is connected to.
[in]pDestinationSubMixType set as the output destination.
[in]volumeVolume to configure.
[in]sourceChannelIndexThe number of VoiceType channels or SubMixType mix buffer index for the input source.
[in]destinationChannelIndexThe index of the output destination SubMixType mix buffer.
Precondition
  • pOutSource is initialized.
  • pOutSource != nullptr.
  • 0 <= destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSplitterDestinationCount(pOutSource).
  • The number destinationIndex output destination of pOutSource is connected to pDestination.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::SplitterType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::SplitterType::GetVolumeMax.
  • 0 <= sourceChannelIndex && souceChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetSplitterSourceChannelCount(pOutSouce).
  • 0 <= destinationChannelIndex && destinationChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetSubMixBufferCount(pDestination).

Details
The default value for all mix volume is 0.0f.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pOutSource while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Note
Audio cutoff may occur depending on the set volume value. If audio cutoff occurs, verify that the volume is within appropriate values. If a negative volume value is set, the phase of the waveform is inverted.
Examples
AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ SetSplitterMixVolume() [2/2]

void nn::audio::SetSplitterMixVolume ( SplitterType *  pOutSource,
int  destinationIndex,
FinalMixType *  pDestination,
float  volume,
int  sourceChannelIndex,
int  destinationChannelIndex 
)
noexcept

Sets the mix volume for the output destinations from SplitterType.

Parameters
[out]pOutSourceThe SplitterType that sets the volume.
[in]destinationIndexOutput destination index that pDestination is connected to.
[in]pDestinationFinalMixType set as the output destination.
[in]volumeVolume to configure.
[in]sourceChannelIndexThe number of VoiceType channels or SubMixType mix buffer index for the input source.
[in]destinationChannelIndexThe index of the output destination FinalMixType mix buffer.
Precondition
  • pOutSource is initialized.
  • pOutSource != nullptr.
  • 0 <= destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSplitterDestinationCount(pOutSource).
  • The number destinationIndex output destination of pOutSource is connected to pDestination.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::SplitterType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::SplitterType::GetVolumeMax().
  • 0 <= sourceChannelIndex && souceChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetSplitterSourceChannelCount(pOutSouce).
  • 0 <= destinationChannelIndex && destinationChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pDestination).

Details
The features of this function are identical to nn::audio::SetSplitterMixVolume(SplitterType* pOutSource, int destinationIndex, SubMixType* pDestination, float volume, int sourceChannelIndex, int destinationChannelIndex) except for the fact that the pDestination type is nn::audio::FinalMixType. For more information, see the API Reference. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetSplitterMixVolume() [1/2]

float nn::audio::GetSplitterMixVolume ( const SplitterType *  pSource,
int  destinationIndex,
const SubMixType *  pDestination,
int  sourceChannelIndex,
int  destinationChannelIndex 
)
noexcept

Gets the mix volume for the output destinations from SplitterType.

Parameters
[in]pSourceSplitterType that gets the volume.
[in]destinationIndexOutput destination index that pDestination is connected to.
[in]pDestinationSubMixType set as the output destination.
[in]sourceChannelIndexThe number of VoiceType channels or SubMixType mix buffer index for the input source.
[in]destinationChannelIndexThe index of the output destination SubMixType mix buffer.
Returns
Returns the mix volume.
Precondition
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • 0 <= destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSplitterDestinationCount(pSource).
  • The number destinationIndex output destination of pSource is connected to pDestination.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • 0 <= sourceChannelIndex && souceChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetSplitterSourceChannelCount(pSouce).
  • 0 <= destinationChannelIndex && destinationChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pDestination).

Details
Gets the mix volume set by nn::audio::SetSplitterMixVolume(SplitterType* pSource, int destinationIndex, SubMixType* pDestination, float volume, int sourceChannelIndex, int destinationChannelIndex).

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSplitter while calling this function.

◆ GetSplitterMixVolume() [2/2]

float nn::audio::GetSplitterMixVolume ( const SplitterType *  pSource,
int  destinationIndex,
const FinalMixType *  pDestination,
int  sourceChannelIndex,
int  destinationChannelIndex 
)
noexcept

Gets the mix volume for the output destinations from SplitterType.

Parameters
[in]pSourceSplitterType that gets the volume.
[in]destinationIndexOutput destination index that pDestination is connected to.
[in]pDestinationFinalMixType set as the output destination.
[in]sourceChannelIndexThe number of VoiceType channels or SubMixType mix buffer index for the input source.
[in]destinationChannelIndexThe index of the output destination FinalMixType mix buffer.
Returns
Returns the mix volume.
Precondition
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • 0 <= destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSplitterDestinationCount(pSource).
  • The number destinationIndex output destination of pSource is connected to pDestination.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • 0 <= sourceChannelIndex && souceChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetSplitterSourceChannelCount(pSouce).
  • 0 <= destinationChannelIndex && destinationChannelIndex <= nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pDestination).

Details
With the exception that pDestination is type nn::audio::FinalMixType, this function works the same as nn::audio::GetSplitterMixVolume(const SplitterType* pSource, int destinationIndex, const SubMixType* pDestination, int sourceChannelIndex, int destinationChannelIndex). For more information, see the API Reference.

Returns the number of channels.

  • pSource is initialized.

Gets the number of input channels from the input source specified for pSource. This value is identical to the value specified in the sourceChannelCount parameter of nn::audio::AcquireSplitter(). For nn::audio::SetSplitterMixVolume() and nn::audio::GetSplitterMixVolume(), the value specified for the value specified for the destinationIndex parameter must be smaller than the value obtained with this function.

  • pSource is initialized.

For nn::audio::SetSplitterDestination(), nn::audio::SetSplitterMixVolume(), and nn::audio::GetSplitterMixVolume(), the value specified for the value specified for the destinationIndex parameter must be smaller than the value obtained with this function.

◆ GetSplitterSampleRate()

int nn::audio::GetSplitterSampleRate ( const SplitterType *  pSource)
noexcept

Gets the sample rate specified by SplitterType.

Parameters
[in]pSourceThe SplitterType that gets the sample rate.
Returns
Returns the sample rate.
Precondition
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.

Details
Gets the sample rate specified for pSource. This value is identical to the value specified in the sampleRate parameter of nn::audio::AcquireSplitter(). The SubMixType or FinalMixType specified as the output destination for SplitterType must have the same sample rate as the value obtained by this function.

◆ AcquireSubMix()

bool nn::audio::AcquireSubMix ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SubMixType *  pOutSubMix,
int  sampleRate,
int  bufferCount 
)
noexcept

Initializes a SubMixType object and adds it to AudioRendererConfig.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when getting the audio renderer that will add SubMixType.
[out]pOutSubMixThe SubMixType structure.
[in]sampleRateThe SubMixType sample rate.
[in]bufferCountThe number of SubMixType mix buffers.
Returns
Returns true if the SubMixType is available, or false if not.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutSubMix != nullptr.
  • sampleRate == 32000 || sampleRate == 48000.
  • 0 < bufferCount && bufferCount <= nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax.

Details
SubMixType gets the output from an instance of VoiceType or another instance of SubMixType and applies a mix process to that output.

The total number of mix buffers that can be used by a single audio renderer is nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount. This function gets bufferCount mix buffers of the nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount total mix buffers and initializes them as management targets for pOutSubMix. A single audio renderer never manages more than nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount mix buffers. After specifying the required number of mix buffers for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount, assign them as needed to instances of SubMixType and FinalMixType. For more information about mix buffers, see Audio Library in NintendoSDK Documents.

A single SubMixType can store up to nn::audio::MixBufferCountMax mix buffers.

If this function returns false, one of the following two things has occurred.

  • The audio renderer does not have enough mix buffers available. Increase the value specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.mixBufferCount.
  • The number of instances of SubMixType obtained exceeds the number specified during initialization. Try increasing the value specified for nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.subMixCount.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSource)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ ReleaseSubMix()

void nn::audio::ReleaseSubMix ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SubMixType *  pSubMix 
)
noexcept

Releases the SubMixType object from AudioRendererConfig.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType structure.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutSubMix != nullptr.

Details
nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSource)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ SetSubMixDestination() [1/3]

bool nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SubMixType *  pSource,
FinalMixType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Sets the FinalMixType to which SubMixType will be output.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pSourceThe SubMixType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe FinalMixType that is the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.

Details
Connects the instance of SubMixType specified for pSource to the instance of FinalMixType specified for pDestination. After this connection is configured, any mix buffer managed by pSource can be mixed into a mix buffer managed by pDestination. Use the nn::audio::SetSubMixMixVolume() function to specify the pDestination mix buffer into which to mix the pSource mix buffer. Use the nn::audio::SetSubMixVolume() function to specify a volume value to apply to all mix volumes from pSource.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSource)

In the current release, the sampling rate of the instance of SubMixType specified for pSource must be the same as the instance of FinalMixType specified for pDestination. This restriction will be removed in a future release.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSubMix while calling this function. Also, calling this function at the same time as RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ SetSubMixDestination() [2/3]

bool nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SubMixType *  pSource,
SubMixType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Sets the SubMixType to which SubMixType will be output.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pSourceThe SubMixType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe SubMixType that is the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.

Details
Except when SubMixType is specified for pDestination, this function works the same as nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination).

◆ SetSubMixDestination() [3/3]

void nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SubMixType *  pSource,
SplitterType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Specifies the SplitterType to which SubMixType will be output.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pSourceThe SubMixType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe SplitterType that is the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.

Details
Specify the SplitterType as the output destination to output the sample data stored by pSource to multiple SubMixType and FinalMixType objects. Note that because the SplitterType does not perform sample rate conversion, output is only possible to SubMixType and FinalMixType objects that have the same sample rate.

◆ ClearSubMixDestination()

void nn::audio::ClearSubMixDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
SubMixType *  pSource 
)
noexcept

Clears the output destination specified for SubMixType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireSubMix() initializes pSubMix.
[in]pSourceThe SubMixType structure.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.

Details
For the operations on pOutConfig this function is thread-safe, but for the operations on pSource it is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSource while calling this function.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited. For more information, see RequestUpdateAudioRenderer().

  • pSubMix is initialized.

Details

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSubMix while calling this function.

Examples
AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ GetSubMixVolume()

float nn::audio::GetSubMixVolume ( const SubMixType *  pSubMix)
noexcept

Gets the volume of the SubMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType structure.
Returns
Returns the volume.
Precondition
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.

Details
Gets the volume set using the nn::audio::SetSubMixVolume() function.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSubMix while calling this function.

◆ SetSubMixVolume()

void nn::audio::SetSubMixVolume ( SubMixType *  pSubMix,
float  volume 
)
noexcept

Sets the volume for the SubMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pSubMixThe SubMixType structure.
[in]volumeVolume.
Precondition
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.
  • nn::audio::SubMixType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::SubMixType::GetVolumeMax().

Details
The volume specified in this function is applied to the output of all instances of SubMixType and FinalMixType connected to pSubMix. Use the nn::audio::SetSubMixMixVolume() function to set the volume for individual mix buffers.

This function can be called at any time, including when the audio renderer is running.

SubMix has a volume value of 1.0f immediately after initialization.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSubMix while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Note
Audio cutoff may occur depending on the set volume value. If audio cutoff occurs, verify that the volume is within appropriate values. If a negative volume value is set, the phase of the waveform is inverted.

◆ SetSubMixMixVolume() [1/2]

void nn::audio::SetSubMixMixVolume ( SubMixType *  pSource,
FinalMixType *  pDestination,
float  volume,
int  sourceIndex,
int  destinationIndex 
)
noexcept

Sets the mix volume for the SubMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pSourceThe SubMixType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe FinalMixType that is the output destination.
[in]volumeMix volume
[in]sourceIndexThe mix buffer index for the input.
[in]destinationIndexThe mix buffer index for the output.
Precondition
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination(pSource, pDestination) has been run for pSource and pDestination.
  • nn::audio::SubMixType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::SubMixType::GetVolumeMax().
  • 0 <= sourceIndex && sourceIndex < nn::audio::GetSubMixBufferCount(pSource).
  • 0 <= destinationIndex && destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pDestination).
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetSubMixMixVolume(pSource, pDestination, sourceIndex, destinationIndex) == volume.

Details
Sets the volume specified for volume when mixing the contents of the mix buffer of index sourceIndex in the instance of SubMixType specified for pSource to the mix buffer of index destinationIndex in the instance of FinalMixType specified for pDestination.

This function can be called at any time, including when the audio renderer is running.

Before calling this function, pSource and pDestination must be connected using the nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination() function.

The mix volume values immediately after calling nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination() are all 0.0f.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSource while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Note
Audio cutoff may occur depending on the set volume value. If audio cutoff occurs, verify that the volume is within appropriate values.
Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.

◆ GetSubMixMixVolume() [1/2]

float nn::audio::GetSubMixMixVolume ( const SubMixType *  pSource,
const FinalMixType *  pDestination,
int  sourceIndex,
int  destinationIndex 
)
noexcept

Gets the mix volume of the SubMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pSourceThe SubMixType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe FinalMixType that is the output destination.
[in]sourceIndexThe mix buffer index for the input.
[in]destinationIndexThe mix buffer index for the output.
Returns
Returns the mix volume for the specified sourceIndex and destinationIndex.
Precondition
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination(pSource, pDestination) has been run for pSource and pDestination.
  • 0 <= sourceIndex && sourceIndex < nn::audio::GetSubMixBufferCount(pSource).
  • 0 <= destinationIndex && destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pDestination).

Details
Gets the mix volume set for each mix buffer using the nn::audio::SetSubMixMixVolume() function. For more information about sourceIndex and destinationIndex, see nn::audio::SetSubMixMixVolume().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSubMix while calling this function.

◆ SetSubMixMixVolume() [2/2]

void nn::audio::SetSubMixMixVolume ( SubMixType *  pSource,

float  volume,
int  sourceIndex,
int  destinationIndex 
)
noexcept

Sets the mix volume for the SubMixType object.

Parameters
[in]pSourceThe SubMixType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe SubMixType that is the output destination.
[in]volumeMix volume
[in]sourceIndexThe mix buffer index for the input.
[in]destinationIndexThe mix buffer index for the output.

  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::SetSubMixDestination(pSource, pDestination) has been run for pSource and pDestination.
  • nn::audio::SubMixType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::SubMixType::GetVolumeMax().
  • 0 <= sourceIndex && sourceIndex < nn::audio::GetSubMixBufferCount(pSource).

◆ GetSubMixNodeId()

NodeId nn::audio::GetSubMixNodeId ( const SubMixType *  pSubMix)
noexcept

Gets the ID of the SubMixType object in the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pSubMixSubMixType
Returns
Returns NodeId.
Precondition
  • pSubMix != nullptr.
  • pSubMix is initialized.

Details
NodeId is a numeric value that uniquely identifies the VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType objects registered to the audio renderer. The various NodeId objects are never duplicated within a single audio renderer. A NodeId is assigned for each instance of each added VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType.

◆ AcquireVoiceSlot() [1/2]

bool nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
VoiceType *  pOutVoice,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCount,
SampleFormat  sampleFormat,
int  priority,
const void *  pParameter,
size_t  size,
const VoiceType::BehaviorOptions *  pBehaviorOptions 
)
noexcept

Initializes VoiceType with options that specify its behavior and adds it to AudioRendererConfig.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when getting the audio renderer that will add VoiceType.
[out]pOutVoicePointer to an uninitialized VoiceType structure.
[in]sampleRateSampling rate.
[in]channelCountNumber of channels.
[in]sampleFormatSampling format.
[in]priorityPriority.
[in]pParameterAdditional parameters.
[in]sizeSize of the additional parameters.
[in]pBehaviorOptionsOptions specifying the behavior of Voice.
Returns
Returns true if the VoiceType is available, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutVoice != nullptr.
  • sampleRate > 0.
  • channelCount >= 1 && channelCount <= nn::audio::VoiceType::ChannelCountMax.
  • sampleFormat == nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmInt16 || sampleFormat == nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmFloat || sampleFormat == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm.
  • nn::audio::VoiceType::PriorityHighest <= priority && priority <= nn::audio::VoiceType::PriorityLowest.
  • When pParameter != nullptr, pParameter is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • When pParameter != nullptr, size > 0.
  • pBehaviorOptions != nullptr.
  • If pBehaviorOptions->isPitchAndSrcSkipped == true, sampleRate == nn::audio::GetAudioRendererSampleRate(handle).
Postcondition
  • pOutVoice is initialized.

Details
After this function has been called, perform all subsequent operations on pOutVoice using the functions listed in the description of VoiceType. Set the output destination for VoiceType using the nn::audio::SetVoiceDestination() function, and set the mix volume using the nn::audio::SetVoiceMixVolume() function.

The following parameters must be specified when initializing VoiceType. These parameters cannot be changed after the function is called.

  • Number of channels.
  • Sampling rate.
  • Sampling format.
  • Additional parameters and their sizes.

For the number of channels, the sampling rate, and the sample format, specify the sampling rate required for the input waveforms specified to pOutVoice by the nn::audio::AppendWaveBuffer() function. If the sampling rate set for the VoiceType connection destination is different from the sampling rate set for VoiceType, the sampling rate is converted automatically during rendering.

In this function, the number of voice units corresponding to the channel count is used. For example, if a VoiceType object with six channels has been allocated, six voice units are used.

For the priority, specify a value between VoiceType::PriorityHighest and VoiceType::PriorityLowest. The lower the value, the higher the priority.

Additional parameters are needed when specifying SampleFormat_Adpcm for sampleFormat. If specifying another format, specify either nullptr or 0

The memory region specified for pParameter must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType. For more information, see nn::audio::MemoryPoolType and nn::audio::AcquireMemoryPool().

pBehaviorOptions are the options that specify the behavior of the VoiceType object being initialized. If VoiceType::BehaviorOptions::isPlayedSampleCountResetAtLoopPoint is set to true, the number of samples obtained by nn::audio::GetVoicePlayedSampleCount() gets reset to 0 when the audio loops. If VoiceType::BehaviorOptions::isPitchAndSrcSkipped is set to true, the pitch conversion and sampling rate conversion (SRC) processes are skipped. Note that nn::audio::SetVoicePitch() can no longer be used to configure pitch settings after these processes are skipped. Because sampling rate conversion will be skipped, the sampling rate specified for the parameter must be the same as the sampling rate set for the VoiceType connection destination.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireVoiceSlot(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pOutVoice, int sampleRate, int channelCount, SampleFormat sampleFormat, int priority, const void* pParameter, size_t size)
  • ReleaseVoiceSlot(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pVoice)
  • SetVoiceDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetVoiceDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • SetVoiceDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pSource, SplitterType* pDestination)
  • ClearVoiceDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pSource)

Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ AcquireVoiceSlot() [2/2]

bool nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
VoiceType *  pOutVoice,
int  sampleRate,
int  channelCount,
SampleFormat  sampleFormat,
int  priority,
const void *  pParameter,
size_t  size 
)
noexcept

Initializes a VoiceType object and adds it to AudioRendererConfig.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when getting the audio renderer that will add VoiceType.
[out]pOutVoicePointer to an uninitialized VoiceType structure.
[in]sampleRateSampling rate.
[in]channelCountNumber of channels.
[in]sampleFormatSampling format.
[in]priorityPriority.
[in]pParameterAdditional parameters.
[in]sizeSize of the additional parameters.
Returns
Returns true if the VoiceType is available, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutVoice != nullptr.
  • sampleRate > 0.
  • channelCount >= 1 && channelCount <= nn::audio::VoiceType::ChannelCountMax.
  • sampleFormat == nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmInt16 || sampleFormat == nn::audio::SampleFormat_PcmFloat || sampleFormat == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm.
  • nn::audio::VoiceType::PriorityHighest <= priority && priority <= nn::audio::VoiceType::PriorityLowest.
  • When pParameter != nullptr, pParameter is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • When pParameter != nullptr, size > 0.
Postcondition
  • pOutVoice is initialized.

Details
This function initializes VoiceType to act with the default behavior. Otherwise, it works the same as nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pOutVoice, int sampleRate, int channelCount, SampleFormat sampleFormat, int priority, const void* pParameter, size_t size, const VoiceType::BehaviorOptions* pBehaviorOptions). The default behavior is equivalent to setting all of the options inpBehaviorOptions to false in the preceding function.

Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ ReleaseVoiceSlot()

void nn::audio::ReleaseVoiceSlot ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
VoiceType *  pVoice 
)
noexcept

Releases a VoiceType object from AudioRendererConfig.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when getting the audio renderer that will release VoiceType.
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireVoiceSlot(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pOutVoice, int sampleRate, int channelCount, SampleFormat sampleFormat, int priority, const void* pParameter, size_t size)
  • ReleaseVoiceSlot(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pVoice)
  • SetVoiceDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetVoiceDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearVoiceDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, VoiceType* pOutVoice)

Also, do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling any of these functions. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ IsVoiceValid()

bool nn::audio::IsVoiceValid ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Determines whether VoiceType is valid.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns true if enabled, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
This function checks whether a voice drop has occurred in pVoice. It returns false if called on a VoiceType that has not been initialized correctly.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function.

◆ IsVoiceDroppedFlagOn()

bool nn::audio::IsVoiceDroppedFlagOn ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Gets the number of voice drop flags for VoiceType.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns true when the voice drop flag is turned on, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
This function checks whether a voice drop has occurred in pVoice. The voice-drop feature is a feature for automatically skipping VoiceType rendering so noise is not generated due to a slowdown in processing when audio rendering puts a heavy load on the system. The audio renderer automatically selects which VoiceType to target for voice drops based on the priority specified for each VoiceType object. If objects have the same priority, the selection is made based on last-note priority. In other words, the selection is designed so VoiceType objects set with a new priority are not dropped whenever possible.

The voice-dropped flag is set for a VoiceType object that has been dropped by the audio renderer. While this voice-dropped flag remains set, the audio renderer will continue to skip the rendering of this VoiceType. The playback of this VoiceType object does not advance while rendering is being skipped. Accordingly, functions like nn::audio::GetVoicePlayedSampleCount() will continue to return the same value. A VoiceType object set with the voice-dropped flag can be handled the same way as a VoiceType object that is paused (in the PlayState_Pause state). Accordingly, it can be destroyed quickly by the nn::audio::ReleaseVoiceSlot() function, just like a VoiceType object in the paused state.

In addition, by changing the play state to stopped (PlayState_Stop), all of the WaveBuffer objects registered to the VoiceType can be taken away using the nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer() function. However, because the rendering of this VoiceType object is being skipped, unlike a VoiceType object in the paused state, the playback of this object cannot be resumed by using the nn::audio::SetVoicePlayState() function to specify the play state (PlayState_Play).

When the voice-dropped flag is cleared, the VoiceType can once again be used for rendering by the audio renderer. The voice-dropped flag will not be disabled automatically. If you want to disable the flag, you need to call the function again and explicitly remove it. To disable the voice-dropped flag, use the nn::audio::ResetVoiceDroppedFlag() function.

pVoice will return false immediately after initialization by the nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot() function. After that, pVoice returns true when a voice drop is generated during playback and the voice-dropped flag is set.

The voice-drop feature can be enabled or disabled for each separate audio renderer. For more information, see nn::audio::InitializeAudioRendererParameter and nn::audio::AudioRendererParameter.

Note
nn::audio::InitializeAudioRendererParameter creates a parameter that disables the voice-drop feature. Accordingly, to use the voice-drop feature, you must explicitly enable it after calling nn::audio::InitializeAudioRendererParameter.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ ResetVoiceDroppedFlag()

void nn::audio::ResetVoiceDroppedFlag ( VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Sets the VoiceType voice drop flag to off.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
Postcondition
  • IsVoiceDroppedFlagOn(pVoice) == false.

Details
This function clears the voice-dropped flag for pVoice. A VoiceType object in the voice-dropped state will not be used for audio rendering until it is released from this state. The VoiceType object whose voice-dropped flag has been cleared by this function will once again be used for rendering by the audio renderer. For more information about the voice-drop feature, see nn::audio::IsVoiceDroppedFlagOn().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ SetVoiceDestination() [1/3]

void nn::audio::SetVoiceDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
VoiceType *  pSource,
FinalMixType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Sets the FinalMix that is the output destination of the VoiceType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot() initializes VoiceType.
[in]pSourceThe VoiceType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe FinalMixType that is the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • If nn::audio::GetVoiceBehaviorOptions(pVoice).isPitchAndSrcSkipped == true, GetVoiceSampleRate(pSource) == GetFinalMixSampleRate(pDestination).
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetVoiceDestination() [2/3]

void nn::audio::SetVoiceDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
VoiceType *  pSource,
SubMixType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Sets the SubMix that is the output destination of the VoiceType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot() initializes VoiceType.
[in]pSourceThe VoiceType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe SubMixType that is the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • If nn::audio::GetVoiceBehaviorOptions(pVoice).isPitchAndSrcSkipped == true, GetVoiceSampleRate(pSource) == GetSubMixSampleRate(pDestination).

◆ SetVoiceDestination() [3/3]

void nn::audio::SetVoiceDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
VoiceType *  pSource,
SplitterType *  pDestination 
)
noexcept

Sets the SplitterType that is the output destination of the VoiceType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot() initializes VoiceType.
[in]pSourceThe VoiceType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe SplitterType that is the output destination.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • If true is specified for VoiceType::BehaviorOptions::isPitchAndSrcSkipped in AcquireVoiceSlot(), that GetVoiceSampleRate(pSource) == GetSplitterSampleRate(pDestination).

◆ ClearVoiceDestination()

void nn::audio::ClearVoiceDestination ( AudioRendererConfig *  pOutConfig,
VoiceType *  pSource 
)
noexcept

Clears the output destination specified for VoiceType.

Parameters
[out]pOutConfigThe AudioRendererConfig used when nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot() initializes VoiceType.
[in]pSourcePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Precondition
  • pOutConfig != nullptr.
  • pOutConfig is initialized.
  • pOutVoice != nullptr.
  • pOutVoice is initialized.

Details
For the operations on pOutConfig this function is thread-safe, but for the operations on pSource it is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pSource while calling this function.

nn::audio partially blocks access to pOutConfig while this function is in use. Note that the following functions, which use the same pOutConfig, may be blocked.

  • AcquireFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pOutFinalMix, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseFinalMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, FinalMixType* pFinalMix)
  • AcquireSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pOutSubMix, int sampleRate, int bufferCount)
  • ReleaseSubMix(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSubMix)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, FinalMixType* pDestination)
  • SetSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource, SubMixType* pDestination)
  • ClearSubMixDestination(AudioRendererConfig* pOutConfig, SubMixType* pSource)

Calling this function simultaneously with RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited. For more information, see RequestUpdateAudioRenderer().

Details

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function.

◆ SetVoicePriority()

void nn::audio::SetVoicePriority ( VoiceType *  pVoice,
int  priority 
)
noexcept

Sets the priority of the VoiceType.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
[in]priorityPriority.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
  • (nn::audio::VoiceType::PriorityHighest <= priority && priority <= nn::audio::VoiceType::PriorityLowest)
Postcondition
  • GetVoicePriority(pVoice) == priority.

Details
For the priority, specify a value between VoiceType::PriorityHighest and VoiceType::PriorityLowest. The lower the value, the higher the priority.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetVoicePriority()

int nn::audio::GetVoicePriority ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Gets the priority of the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns the priority.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
The priority is specified to some value between VoiceType::PriorityHighest and VoiceType::PriorityLowest by the functions nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot() and nn::audio::SetVoicePriority(). The lower the value, the higher the priority.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function.

◆ SetVoicePlayState()

void nn::audio::SetVoicePlayState ( VoiceType *  pVoice,
VoiceType::PlayState  playState 
)
noexcept

Sets the play state for the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
[in]playStateThe playback state.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
Postcondition
  • GetVoicePlayState(pVoice) == state.

Details
Changes the VoiceType playback state.

This state set using this function goes into effect after the next call to the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function.

The meanings for each of the playState values are as follows. PlayState_Play sets pVoice to the playback state. PlayState_Stop sets pVoice to the stopped state. When entering the stopped state, all added WaveBuffer instances are treated as played back. In addition, the value available with nn::audio::GetVoicePlayedSampleCount() is reset to 0. The WaveBuffer objects that have have played back can be obtained using nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer(). Note that at most two audio frames must have passed before nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer() can be used to get anything. PlayState_Pause sets pVoice to the paused state. In contrast with using the PlayState_Stop setting, there is no effect on the state of added WaveBuffer objects or the value from nn::audio::GetVoicePlayedSampleCount(). Note that it might take an audio frame of time until Audio Renderer playback is completely paused, and during that interval, the values available from nn::audio::GetWaveBufferCount() and GetVoicePlayedSampleCount() might change. Setting to PlayState_Play once more after setting to PlayState_Pause resumes playback.

The behavior for any individual playState is not affected by whether the output destination is specified. This is true even for PlayState_Play.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ GetVoicePlayState()

VoiceType::PlayState nn::audio::GetVoicePlayState ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Gets the play state of the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns the playback state.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
This function returns VoiceType::PlayState_Stop immediately after nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot() is called. For more information about the behaviors configured using VoiceType::PlayState, see nn::audio::GetVoicePlayState().

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function.

Examples
AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ SetVoiceSrcQuality()

void nn::audio::SetVoiceSrcQuality ( VoiceType *  pVoice,
VoiceType::SrcQuality  srcQuality 
)
noexcept

Sets the quality of the VoiceType sample rate conversion.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
[in]srcQualitySample rate conversion quality.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
Postcondition
  • GetVoiceSrcQuality(pVoice) == srcQuality.

Details
If this function is called and the settings are changed during playback, noise may occur. We recommend changing the settings either before playback begins or while it is stopped.

◆ SetVoiceVolume()

void nn::audio::SetVoiceVolume ( VoiceType *  pVoice,
float  volume 
)
noexcept

Sets the volume for the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
[in]volumeVolume.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
  • nn::audio::VoiceType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::VoiceType::GetVolumeMax().
Postcondition
  • GetVoiceVolume(pVoice) == volume.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Note
Audio cutoff may occur depending on the set volume value. If audio cutoff occurs, verify that the volume is within appropriate values. If a negative volume value is set, the phase of the waveform is inverted.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, and AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp.
