◆ SetVoiceMixVolume() [1/2]

void nn::audio::SetVoiceMixVolume ( VoiceType *  pSource,
FinalMixType *  pDestination,
float  volume,
int  sourceIndex,
int  destinationIndex 
)
noexcept

Sets the mix volume for the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pSourceThe VoiceType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe FinalMix that is the output destination.
[in]volumeMix volume.
[in]sourceIndexThe channel number on the input side.
[in]destinationIndexThe mix buffer index for the output.
Precondition
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::VoiceType::GetVolumeMin() <= volume && volume <= nn::audio::VoiceType::GetVolumeMax().
  • nn::audio::SetVoiceDestination(pSource, pDestination) has been run for pSource and pDestination.
  • 0 <= sourceIndex && sourceIndex < nn::audio::GetVoiceChannelCount(pSource).
  • 0 <= destinationIndex && destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pDestination).
Postcondition
  • nn::audio::GetVoiceMixVolume(pSource, pDestination, sourceIndex, destinationIndex) == volume.

Details
This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Note
Audio cutoff may occur depending on the set volume value. If audio cutoff occurs, verify that the volume is within appropriate values. If a negative volume value is set, the phase of the waveform is inverted.
Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ GetVoiceMixVolume() [1/2]

float nn::audio::GetVoiceMixVolume ( const VoiceType *  pSource,
const FinalMixType *  pDestination,
int  sourceIndex,
int  destinationIndex 
)
noexcept

Gets the mix volume of the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pSourceThe VoiceType that is the input source.
[in]pDestinationThe FinalMix that is the output destination.
[in]sourceIndexThe channel number on the input side.
[in]destinationIndexThe mix buffer index for the output.
Returns
Returns the mix volume for the specified sourceIndex and destinationIndex.
Precondition
  • pSource != nullptr.
  • pSource is initialized.
  • pDestination != nullptr.
  • pDestination is initialized.
  • nn::audio::SetVoiceDestination(pSource, pDestination) has been run for pSource and pDestination.
  • 0 <= sourceIndex && sourceIndex < nn::audio::GetVoiceChannelCount(pSource).
  • 0 <= destinationIndex && destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetFinalMixBufferCount(pDestination).

Details
The mix volume values immediately after calling nn::audio::SetVoiceDestination() are all 0.0f.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function.

Examples
AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp.

  • 0 <= destinationIndex && destinationIndex < nn::audio::GetSubMixBufferCount(pDestination).

◆ SetVoiceBiquadFilterParameter()

void nn::audio::SetVoiceBiquadFilterParameter ( VoiceType *  pVoice,
int  filterIndex,
const BiquadFilterParameter &  parameter 
)
noexcept

Sets the biquad filter parameter for the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
[in]filterIndexThe index for the biquad filter whose parameter is being changed.
[in]parameterParameters
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
  • (filterIndex == 0) || (filterIndex == 1).

Details
A two-stage biquad filter is prepared for each VoiceType object. You can specify which one to configure using filterIndex. Filtering is applied in order of 0, 1 for filterIndex.

Examples
AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, and AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp.

◆ AppendWaveBuffer() [1/2]

bool nn::audio::AppendWaveBuffer ( VoiceType *  pVoice,
const WaveBuffer *  pWaveBuffer 
)
noexcept

Adds a WaveBuffer object to VoiceType.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
[in]pWaveBufferPointer to a WaveBuffer structure.
Returns
Returns true if successful, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
  • pWaveBuffer != nullptr.
  • pWaveBuffer->buffer != nullptr
  • pWaveBuffer->buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • pWaveBuffer->startSampleOffset >= 0.
  • pWaveBuffer->endSampleOffset >= 0.
  • pWaveBuffer->endSampleOffset >= pWaveBuffer->startSampleOffset.
  • The sample in the range of [pWaveBuffer->startSampleOffset, pWaveBuffer->endSampleOffset) is in the range of the memory region specified by pWaveBuffer->buffer and pWaveBuffer->size.
  • pWaveBuffer->buffer refers to the start of the ADPCM frame when nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat"nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat(pVoice)" == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm.
  • pWaveBuffer->pContext is nullptr or aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize when nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat"nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat(pVoice)" == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm.
  • pWaveBuffer->contextSize > 0 when nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat"nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat(pVoice)" == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm and pWaveBuffer->pContext != nullptr.

Details
You can use this function to add multiple WaveBuffer objects. The behavior of this function is the same as when specifying an instance where pMemberOptions->isLoopInfoEnabled == false in the pMemberOptions argument of nn::audio::AppendWaveBuffer(VoiceType* pVoice, const WaveBuffer* pWaveBuffer, const WaveBuffer::MemberOptions* pMemberOptions). Playback happens continuously in the order in which they were added. If looped playback is specified for a WaveBuffer, any WaveBuffer added subsequently is not played back.

Up to VoiceType::WaveBufferCountMax instances of WaveBuffer can be added at the same time. If you want to add more than this number of WaveBuffer objects, you must wait for registered WaveBuffer objects to finish playing, and then call the nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer() function.

The memory region specified for pWaveBuffer->buffer and pWaveBuffer->pContext must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType, and that nn::audio::MemoryPoolType must be attached. For more information, see the description for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, AudioSplitter/AudioSplitter.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ AppendWaveBuffer() [2/2]

bool nn::audio::AppendWaveBuffer ( VoiceType *  pVoice,
const WaveBuffer *  pWaveBuffer,
const WaveBuffer::MemberOptions *  pMemberOptions 
)
noexcept

Adds a WaveBuffer object to VoiceType.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
[in]pWaveBufferPointer to a WaveBuffer structure.
[in]pMemberOptionsPointer to a WaveBuffer::MemberOptions structure.
Returns
Returns true if successful, or false otherwise.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.
  • pWaveBuffer != nullptr.
  • pMemberOptions != nullptr.
  • pWaveBuffer->buffer != nullptr
  • pWaveBuffer->buffer is aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize.
  • pWaveBuffer->startSampleOffset >= 0.
  • pWaveBuffer->endSampleOffset >= 0.
  • pWaveBuffer->endSampleOffset >= pWaveBuffer->startSampleOffset.
  • The sample in the range of [pWaveBuffer->startSampleOffset, pWaveBuffer->endSampleOffset) is in the range of the memory region specified by pWaveBuffer->buffer and pWaveBuffer->size.
  • pWaveBuffer->buffer refers to the start of the ADPCM frame when nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat"nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat(pVoice)" == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm.
  • pWaveBuffer->pContext is nullptr or aligned to nn::audio::BufferAlignSize when nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat"nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat(pVoice)" == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm.
  • pWaveBuffer->contextSize > 0 when nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat"nn::audio::GetVoiceSampleFormat(pVoice)" == nn::audio::SampleFormat_Adpcm and pWaveBuffer->pContext != nullptr.

However, if pMemberOptions->isLoopInfoEnabled == true, the following preconditions are added.

Precondition
  • pWaveBuffer->loopEndSampleOffset >= 0.
  • pWaveBuffer->loopEndSampleOffset >= pWaveBuffer->loopStartSampleOffset.
  • The sample in the range of [pWaveBuffer->loopStartSampleOffset, pWaveBuffer->loopEndSampleOffset) is in the range of the memory region specified by pWaveBuffer->buffer and pWaveBuffer->size.
  • pWaveBuffer->loopCount >= 0 || pWaveBuffer->loopCount == LoopCountForever.

Details
You can use this function to add multiple WaveBuffer objects. Playback happens continuously in the order in which they were added. If infinite is specified for the loop count of the added WaveBuffer, any WaveBuffer added subsequently is not played back. The parameter for loop playback of the added WaveBuffer changes based on the instance settings specified in the pMemberOptions argument. For more information, see nn::audio::WaveBuffer.

Up to VoiceType::WaveBufferCountMax instances of WaveBuffer can be added at the same time. If you want to add more than this number of WaveBuffer objects, you must wait for registered WaveBuffer objects to finish playing, and then call the nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer() function.

The memory region specified for pWaveBuffer->buffer and pWaveBuffer->pContext must be contained within the memory region specified for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType, and that nn::audio::MemoryPoolType must be attached. For more information, see the description for nn::audio::MemoryPoolType.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetReleasedWaveBuffer()

const WaveBuffer * nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer ( VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Get the WaveBuffer object that VoiceType has finished playing.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns a pointer to a WaveBuffer that has finished playing.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
If multiple WaveBuffer objects have finished playing, the one on which nn::audio::AppendWaveBuffer() was first called is returned. You can get all of the WaveBuffer objects that have finished playing by calling this function repeatedly. Returns nullptr if none have finished playing. Returns nullptr if no WaveBuffer objects have been added to pVoice.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

Examples
AudioCpuRenderer/AudioCpuRenderer.cpp, AudioDevice/AudioDevice.cpp, AudioEffect/AudioEffect.cpp, AudioEffectAuxUtility/AudioEffectAuxUtility.cpp, AudioMemoryPool/AudioMemoryPool.cpp, AudioMultipleRenderer/AudioMultipleRenderer.cpp, AudioPerformanceMetrics/AudioPerformanceMetrics.cpp, AudioRenderer/AudioRenderer.cpp, AudioSink/AudioSink.cpp, CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime/CodecOpusCodecProcessingTime.cpp, CodecOpusDecoder/CodecOpusDecoder.cpp, CodecOpusEncoder/CodecOpusEncoder.cpp, CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder/CodecOpusMultiStreamDecoder.cpp, and HidVibrationRealTimeConverter/HidVibrationRealTimeConverter.cpp.

◆ GetWaveBufferCount()

int nn::audio::GetWaveBufferCount ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Gets the number of playable WaveBuffer objects that have been registered to VoiceType.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns the count of playable WaveBuffer instances.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
Gets the number of playable WaveBuffer objects that have been registered to VoiceType.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetVoicePlayedSampleCount()

int64_t nn::audio::GetVoicePlayedSampleCount ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Gets the number of samples that have been played by the VoiceType object.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns the number of samples that have played.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
Returns the number of samples of output waveforms played back after calling nn::audio::AcquireVoiceSlot(). The number of samples increases monotonously. Not rewound in cases of looped playback or when playback spans more than one WaveBuffer. However, if true is specified for the isEndOfStream object of the WaveBuffer added to pVoice, the sample number rolls back to 0 when that WaveBuffer finishes playing.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ GetVoiceNodeId()

int nn::audio::GetVoiceNodeId ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Gets the ID of the VoiceType in the audio renderer.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns NodeId.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
NodeId is a numeric value that uniquely identifies the VoiceType, SubMixType, FinalMixType, DeviceSinkType, and CircularBufferSinkType objects registered to the audio renderer. The various NodeId objects are never duplicated within a single audio renderer. A NodeId is assigned to each instance of an added VoiceType, SubMixType, or FinalMixType.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function. Calling this function simultaneously with nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() is prohibited.

◆ FlushWaveBuffers()

void nn::audio::FlushWaveBuffers ( VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Sets all WaveBuffer objects registered to VoiceType as finished being played.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
None.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Details
Sets all WaveBuffer objects registered to pVoice as finished being played.

This state set using this function goes into effect after the next call to the nn::audio::RequestUpdateAudioRenderer() function.

Note that although you can get played WaveBuffer objects using nn::audio::GetReleasedWaveBuffer(), as many as two audio frames can elapse before this function can get those objects.

This function is not thread-safe. Do not perform any operations on pVoice while calling this function.

◆ GetVoiceBehaviorOptions()

VoiceType::BehaviorOptions nn::audio::GetVoiceBehaviorOptions ( const VoiceType *  pVoice)
noexcept

Returns a group of options indicating the behavior configured for a VoiceType structure.

Parameters
[in]pVoicePointer to a VoiceType structure.
Returns
Returns a group of options indicating behavior.
Precondition
  • pVoice != nullptr.
  • pVoice is initialized.

Variable Documentation

◆ AudioCoprocessorFrameTimeLimit

constexpr std::int32_t nn::audio::AudioCoprocessorFrameTimeLimit = 4000
staticconstexpr

The audio coprocessor is the maximum amount of time, in microseconds, available for processing of one audio frame.

Details
If the audio renderer continues to perform rendering after exceeding this period, there will not be enough time to provide waveforms to the audio output device, and audio skipping may occur. When running multiple audio renderers simultaneously, audio skipping may occur if the total value of the processing times of each audio renderer exceeds this period.

You can use nn::audio::PerformanceFrameHeader::totalProcessingTime to get the time it took for the audio renderer to process an audio frame.

NX Platform Only:
  • On the Switch platform, because the application and system both use the DSP (audio coprocessor) simultaneously, the DSP resources allocated to each of them are both managed. For more information, see DSP Resource Limitations.
Windows Platform Only:
  • In the Windows environment, there are no restrictions on the amount of time available for processing of one audio frame.
